Sense.DEF: the 15th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十五个字母

Sense.DEF: zero
Sense.EXAMPLE: My phone number is six o four double two 60422.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的电话号码是60422。

Sense.DEF: a common type of blood
used when praying to a god or, in the past, when speaking to someone in great authority
Sense.TRAN: 啊〔对上帝祷告时或旧时对权威人士说话时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: O Lord, in you I put my trust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐主啊﹐我信奉你。

Sense.DEF:
another form of
oh
‘of’ written as people sometimes say it informally
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drop o’ whisky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点点威士忌

Sense.DEF: someone who is stupid or awkward, especially a man
a large tree that is common in northern countries, or the hard wood of this tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oak door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡木门

Sense.DEF: made of oak
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oaken chest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡木箱

Sense.DEF: small pieces of old rope used for filling up small holes in the sides of wooden ships
Sense.TRAN: 麻絮﹐填絮〔用于填塞木船船帮上的小洞〕

Sense.DEF:
a person who is old enough to receive a
pension
from the state
Sense.EXAMPLE: special rates for OAPs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给领取养老金者的特惠价格

Sense.DEF: a long pole with a wide flat blade at one end, used for rowing a boat
to get involved in a conversation or situation when the other people do not want you to
Sense.TRAN: 多嘴﹐插嘴﹔插手﹐多管闲事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were getting along fine until you stuck your oar in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你掺和进来之前﹐我们一直好好的。

Sense.DEF: one of the small pieces of metal on a rowing boat that holds the oars
someone who rows a boat, especially in races
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指划船比赛中的〕划手﹐桨手

Sense.DEF: a woman who rows a boat, especially in races
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指划船比赛中的〕女划手﹐女桨手

Sense.DEF: a place with water and trees in a desert
a peaceful or pleasant place that is very different from everything around it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The park was an oasis of peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座公园是个宁静宜人的去处。

Sense.DEF:
a round building with a pointed top, built for drying
hop s
Sense.TRAN: 〔烘干啤酒花的〕尖顶圆形烘房

Sense.DEF:
made of
oat s
Sense.EXAMPLE: oat biscuits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 燕麦饼干

Sense.DEF:
a
biscuit
made of oatmeal
a formal and very serious promise

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an oath of allegiance to the Queen
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 效忠女王的誓言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Servicemen have to swear an oath of loyalty to their country.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军人必须宣誓效忠祖国。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The president took the oath of office made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统宣誓就职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could not break her oath .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不能违背誓言。

Sense.DEF: a formal promise to tell the truth in a court of law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The evidence was given under oath.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一证词是立过誓的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Witnesses are required to take the oath make this promise .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人必须宣誓。

Sense.DEF: an offensive word or phrase that expresses anger, surprise, shock etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was shouting out oaths as they led him away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把他带走时﹐他一直大声咒骂。

Sense.DEF: crushed oats used in cooking, especially for making biscuits or porridge
a soft breakfast food made by boiling crushed oats
a light brown colour
the grain from which flour or oatmeal is made and that is used in cooking, or in food for animals
very determined not to change your beliefs, actions, or feelings, in a way that seems unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: They argued, but he remained obdurate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发生了争论﹐但他还是固执己见。

Sense.DEF: when someone does what they are told to do, or what a law, rule etc says they must do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: obedience to God
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遵从上帝

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had always lived in obedience to the church’s teachings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的个人生活一直严格遵从教规。

GramExa.GLOSS: complete obedience without any thought
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 盲目的/毫无怀疑的/完全的服从
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With blind obedience, I allowed my father to organize my life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对父亲盲目地顺从﹐听凭他来安排我的生活。

Sense.EXAMPLE: obedience classes for dogs and their owners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为狗和主人安排的服从训练课

Sense.DEF: always doing what you are told to do, or what the law, a rule etc says you must do
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obedient child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听话的孩子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: citizens who are obedient to the law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遵纪守法的公民

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a child is good rather than obedient.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐形容孩子时一般说good﹐而不说obedient
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The children were all very good.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子都很乖。

Sense.DEF: a phrase used to end a very formal letter
Sense.TRAN: 您恭顺的仆人〔正式信函的结尾用语〕

Sense.DEF: respect and obedience to someone or something, often shown by bending your head or the upper part of your body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They made obeisance to the sultan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向苏丹鞠躬行礼。

Sense.DEF: a tall pointed stone pillar, built to remind people of an event or of someone who has died
very fat in a way that is unhealthy
when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The little boy made no effort to obey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这小男孩不肯服从。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “坐下！”他说道﹐那只狗马上就服从了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soldiers are expected to obey orders without questioning them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军人必须毫无异议地服从命令。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Failure to obey the law can lead to a large fine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反该法律会被课以巨额罚款。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘obey to someone/something’. Say 而要说 obey someone/something: He refused to obey their orders (NOT不说obey to their orders). 他拒绝服从他们的命令。

Exponent.DEF: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
Exponent.TRAN: 服从〔权威〕﹔遵守〔法律或规定〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must obey a senior officer at all times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须随时服从上级。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If everyone obeys the rules of the road, safety is much improved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果人人遵守交通法规﹐安全方面就会大有改观。

Exponent.DEF: to do what someone has advised or ordered you to do. In informal and everyday situations, people usually say do what sb says rather than obey.
Exponent.TRAN: 照某人说的做〔在非正式语境及日常情景中一般用此语﹐而不用obey〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I did what you said but the car still hasn’t started.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我照你说的做了﹐可汽车还是发动不了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My husband never does what I say.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我丈夫从来不照我说的去做。

Exponent.EXP: do what you are told/do as you are told
Exponent.DEF: to do what your parent or teacher says you must do – used especially about children
Exponent.TRAN: 照着〔父母或老师〕告诉你的做〔尤用于孩子〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At school, we expect the pupils to do what they are told.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里﹐我们要求学生听老师的话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do as you’re told and sit down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫你坐下就坐下。

Exponent.DEF: to do what someone says you should do, or advises you to do
Exponent.TRAN: 听从某人的命令/指示/建议
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You must follow your doctor’s orders.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须遵照医嘱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I followed the manufacturer’s instructions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我按照生产商的说明做了。

Exponent.DEF: to accept and obey a rule, law, agreement etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Players have to abide by the rules of the game.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 选手必须遵守比赛规则。

Exponent.DEF: to obey the law or customs of a place, even when you do not agree with them, because this is a necessary part of living in a society
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Smokers should respect the law, and only smoke in the privacy of their own homes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟人士应遵守法律﹐只在自己家中吸烟。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand
the part of medical science that deals with obstetrics and gynaecology
a doctor who works in this part of medical science
an obituary
an article in a newspaper about the life of someone who has just died
a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: an everyday object such as a spoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调羹之类的日常用品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small metal object
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小金属物件
Sense.EXAMPLE: scientists studying plants, animals, or inanimate objects things that are not alive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究植物﹑动物或无生命物体的科学家

Sense.DEF: the purpose of a plan, action, or activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The object of the game is to improve children’s math skills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项游戏旨在提高儿童的数学技能。

Sense.EXAMPLE: My object was to explain the decision simply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的目的是要简单明了地解释这一决定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The customer will benefit most, and that is the object of the exercise the purpose of what you are doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客户将是最大的受益者﹐这正是此举的目的。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is pitied, wanted etc
Sense.TRAN: 怜悯/渴望/嘲弄等的对象
Sense.EXAMPLE: She feared becoming an object of ridicule.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她害怕成为人们嘲笑的对象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sports cars and other objects of desire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑车及其他人们渴望拥有的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: an object of study
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究的对象

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are willing to spend a lot of money to get something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Money’s no object; I want the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钱不成问题﹐我要最好的。

Sense.DEF: an event or story that shows you the right or wrong way of doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The way ants work is an object lesson in order and organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚂蚁的工作方式在条理性和组织性方面提供了可资借鉴的实例。

Subsense.DEF: a noun or pronoun representing the person or thing that something is done to, for example ‘the house’ in ‘We built the house.’
Subsense.TRAN: 直接宾语〔如 We built the house 中的 the house〕

Subsense.DEF: a noun or pronoun representing the person or thing that is joined by a preposition to another word or phrase, for example ‘the table’ in ‘He sat on the table.’
Subsense.TRAN: 介词宾语〔如 He sat on the table 中的 the table〕

Subsense.DEF: the person who is involved in the result of an action, for example ‘her’ in ‘I gave her the book.’
Subsense.TRAN: 间接宾语〔如 I gave her the book 中的 her〕

Sense.DEF: a combination of written information on a computer and instructions that act on the information, for example in the form of a document or a picture
Sense.TRAN: 对象〔计算机中编写的信息和有关指令的组合体﹐形式为文档或图像〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: multimedia data objects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多媒体数据对象

Sense.DEF: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没人反对的话﹐我想请哈里森夫人出席。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Robson strongly objected to the terms of the contract.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯森强烈反对合同中的条款。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I objected to having to rewrite the article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我反对重写这篇文章。

GramExa.PROPFORM: I object used in formal arguments, for example in a court of law
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 我反对〔用于法庭等正式辩论中〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Chairman, I object. That is an unfair allegation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席先生﹐我反对。这项指控不公正。

Sense.DEF: to state a fact or opinion as a reason for opposing or disapproving of something
Sense.TRAN: 提出…作为反对的理由﹔反对说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group objected that the policy would prevent patients from receiving the best treatment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体反对说﹐这一政策会使病人得不到最佳的治疗。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘My name’s not Sonny,’ the child objected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我的名字不叫小家伙。”那孩子反驳道。

Sense.DEF: to treat a person or idea as a physical object
Sense.EXAMPLE: a culture that objectifies women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将女性物化的一种文化

Sense.DEF: a reason that you have for opposing or disapproving of something, or something you say that expresses this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her objection was that he was too young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她反对的理由是他太小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had moral objections to killing animals for food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从道义上反对宰食动物。

GramExa.GLOSS: in spite of their objections
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill was passed over the objections of many Democrats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 议案在众多民主党人士的反对声中获得通过。

Sense.DEF: said by lawyers to a judge in a court when they think that what another lawyer has just said should not be allowed
Sense.TRAN: 反对！ 抗议！〔法庭上律师认为对方律师言辞不当时对法官的表态用语〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Does anyone have any objections to the proposal?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人对这个提议有异议吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what your objection is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Parish Council made several objections to the changes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 行政堂区委员会对变革提出了若干反对意见。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make an objection
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His father raised no objections when John told him that he wanted to become a dancer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰告诉父亲他想当舞蹈演员﹐父亲没有反对。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: change something so that someone will no longer object
stop objecting to something
formally make an objection

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Parents at the school have voiced strong objections to the closure.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长们强烈反对学校关闭。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There were serious objections to using the videotaped evidence at the trial.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人坚决反对将录像用作庭审证据。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: One of the main objections was that classes were being taught by untrained staff.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要反对意见中有一条是认为授课人员未经培训。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 宗教信仰上的反对意见

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘say an objection’. Say 而要说 make an objection.

Sense.DEF: unpleasant and likely to offend people
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹔可能得罪人的﹔讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: objectionable odours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难闻的气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: This programme contains scenes some viewers may find objectionable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本节目包含可能令一些观众反感的镜头。

Sense.DEF: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政治方面的〕目的﹐目标
Sense.EXAMPLE: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best way to accomplish your objectives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 完成目标的最佳方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The degree program has two main objectives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

Sense.DEF: a place that you are trying to reach, especially in a military attack
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指军事行动中的〕攻击目标
Sense.EXAMPLE: The 4th Division’s objective was a town 20 miles to the east.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第4师的攻击目标是东面20英里处的一个城镇。

Sense.DEF: based on facts, or making a decision that is based on facts rather than on your feelings or beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 客观的﹐不带个人感情的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to give an objective opinion about your own children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难对自己的子女作出客观的评价。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists need to be objective when doing research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家做研究时要客观。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of a completely objective, independent press
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个完全客观﹑独立的新闻媒体的重要性

Sense.DEF: existing outside the mind as something real, not only as an idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: The world has an objective reality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界具有客观真实性。

Sense.DEF: if you consider something objectively, you try to think about the facts, and not be influenced by your own feelings or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look at your skills objectively when deciding on a career change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在决定改行时要客观地考虑自己的技能。

Sense.DEF: someone who states or shows that they oppose something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: objectors to the new motorway
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对修建这条新高速公路的人

Sense.DEF: object-oriented computer programming languages are based on objects that are arranged in a hierarchy
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机编程语言〕面向对象的
Sense.EXAMPLE: object-oriented programming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面向对象程序设计
Sense.EXAMPLE: object-oriented languages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面向对象的计算机语言

Sense.DEF: a small object used for decoration, with some value as art
Sense.TRAN: 〔装饰性的〕小艺术品﹐小工艺品

Sense.DEF: a gift that is offered to God or a god, or the act of offering the gift
Sense.TRAN: 〔给上帝或神的〕祭品﹐供物﹔供奉

Sense.DEF: to make someone have to do something, because it is the law, their duty, or the right thing to do
Sense.TRAN: 使有义务〔做某事〕﹐使有责任〔做某事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tenants are obligated to pay their rent on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房客有义务按时缴纳房租。

Sense.DEF: to feel that you must do something because it is right or because someone has done something for you
Sense.TRAN: 感到有义务﹔觉得欠了人情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ava felt obligated to help her mother, even if it meant leaving college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿娃感到有义务帮助母亲﹐即使这样做意味着要离开大学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Watson felt obligated to him for the loan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为那笔贷款﹐沃森觉得欠了他的人情。

Sense.DEF: a moral or legal duty to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔道义或法律上的〕义务﹐职责﹐责任

GramExa.EXAMPLE: America’s obligation to its allies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国对其盟友的义务

Sense.EXAMPLE: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主有责任对所有员工一视同仁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents are under a legal obligation to educate their children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长对子女的教育负有法律责任。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are under no obligation to buy any more books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必非要买更多的书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greater resources are needed to meet these obligations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 履行这些义务需要更多的资源。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rights and obligations imposed on them by treaties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条约给他们规定的权利和义务
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government must pay for health care for war veterans – it is an obligation we owe to them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府必须为退伍军人支付医疗保健费用——这是我们对他们负有的义务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a moral obligation to help the poor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助穷人的道德义务
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stayed with the team out of a sense of obligation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他出于责任感而留在队里。

Sense.DEF: something that is obligatory must be done because of a law, rule etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因法律﹑规定等〕必须履行的﹐有义务的﹔强制性的

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is obligatory for sb (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is obligatory for companies to provide details of their industrial processes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司必须提供其工业流程的详细情况。

Sense.DEF: used humorously to describe something that is always done or included in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 惯常的﹐习惯上的〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She offered him the obligatory cup of tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她照例给他端来一杯茶。

Sense.DEF: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔因形势﹑法律﹑义务等关系而〕迫使﹐强迫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The minister was obliged to report at least once every six months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位大臣必须至少每六个月作一次汇报。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Circumstances had obliged him to sell the business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 客观情况迫使他出售公司。

GramExa.GLOSS: feel that you have a duty to do something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many parents feel obliged to pay for at least part of the wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多父母都觉得有责任至少承担婚礼的部分费用。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use oblige when you are talking about a person making someone do something they do not want to do. Use force or make.说迫使某人做其不想做的事时﹐不要用oblige﹐而要用force或make:No one can force (NOT不说oblige) you to stay in a job that you hate. 没有人能够逼你继续做你不喜欢的工作。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that you have to do sth rather than are obliged to do sth.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说have to do sth﹐而不说be obliged to do sth
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He had to sell the business.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不出售公司。

Sense.DEF: to do something that someone has asked you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s always a good idea to oblige important clients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能满足重要客户的请求总是好的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you need a ride home, I’d be happy to oblige.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你需要搭便车回家﹐我很乐意效劳。

Sense.DEF: used to make a polite request
Sense.TRAN: 如蒙…我将非常感激〔请别人帮忙时的客气话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d be obliged if you’d treat this matter as strictly confidential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事如果您能严格保密﹐我将非常感激。

Sense.DEF: used to thank someone very politely
Sense.TRAN: (我对你)非常感谢﹐不胜感激〔用于礼貌地向某人致谢〕

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of be obliged to, must and have to/have got to in spoken and written English. 英语口语和书面语中be obliged to﹐must和have to/have got to的使用频率。

This graph shows that the expressions have to and have got to are much more common in spoken English than must or be obliged to. Have got to is only used in British English. Must is more common in written English. Be obliged to is much less common than the others and is only used to say that someone must do something because of a rule or law, or because the situation forces them to do it. 本图表显示﹐在英语口语中 have to 和 have got to 的使用频率远远高于 must 或 be obliged to。have got to 仅用于英国英语。 must 更多用于书面语。be obliged to 的使用频率要低得多﹐且仅用于表示某人因规定﹑法律约束或为形势所迫而必须做某事。

Sense.DEF: willing and eager to help
Sense.TRAN: 乐于助人的﹐热心相助的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop assistant was very obliging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 店员非常热情。

Sense.DEF: not expressed in a direct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oblique reference to his drinking problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拐弯抹角地提及他的酗酒问题

Sense.DEF: not looking, pointing etc directly at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oblique glance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斜瞥

Sense.DEF: a sloping line etc
an angle that is not 90 degrees
a mark ( / ) used for writing fractions or for separating numbers, letters, words etc
to destroy something completely so that nothing remains
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hiroshima was nearly obliterated by the atomic bomb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 广岛几乎被原子弹夷为平地。

Sense.DEF: to remove a thought, feeling, or memory from someone’s mind
Sense.TRAN: 忘却﹐抹去〔想法﹑感情或记忆〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing could obliterate the memory of those tragic events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些悲惨事件的记忆是无法抹去的。

Sense.DEF: to cover something completely so that it cannot be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the fog came down, obliterating everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随后大雾降下﹐笼罩了一切。

Sense.DEF: when something is completely forgotten or no longer important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wind power presents too many advantages to be allowed to sink into oblivion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风能具有很多优点﹐不该被忽视。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The loser’s name has been consigned to oblivion completely forgotten.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失败者的姓名已湮没无闻。

Sense.DEF: the state of being unconscious or of not noticing what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 无感觉[知觉]的状态﹔漠视
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oblivion of sleep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡眠中的无知觉状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had drunk himself into oblivion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝得不省人事。

Sense.DEF: not knowing about or not noticing something that is happening around you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed oblivious to the fact that he had hurt her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎没有察觉自己伤害了她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Congress was seemingly oblivious to these events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会对这些事件似乎毫不知情。

Sense.DEF: an oblong shape has four straight sides at 90 degrees to each other, two of which are longer than the other two
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oblong table
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长方形桌子

Sense.DEF: an oblong shape is much longer than it is wide
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oblong leaf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长椭圆形的叶子

Sense.DEF: very strong offensive criticism
loss of respect and honour
very offensive, unpleasant, or rude
Sense.TRAN: 惹人讨厌的﹔可憎的﹔粗暴无礼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s really obnoxious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这人真讨厌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obnoxious idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人作呕的念头
Sense.EXAMPLE: obnoxious odours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难闻的气味

Sense.DEF: a wooden musical instrument like a narrow tube, which you play by blowing air through a reed
relating to sex in a way that is shocking and offensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bradford made an obscene gesture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉德福德做了个下流手势。

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: calls from an unknown person saying obscene things

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下流骚扰电话
Sense.EXAMPLE: obscene photographs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淫秽照片

Sense.DEF: extremely unfair, immoral, or unpleasant, especially in a way that makes you angry
Sense.TRAN: 不公平的﹔不道德的﹔令人震怒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some players earn obscene amounts of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些运动员的收入高得离谱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obscene act of cruelty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人震惊的残暴行为

Sense.DEF: sexually offensive language or behaviour, especially in a book, play, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指书籍﹑戏剧﹑电影等中的〕淫秽语言﹐下流举动
Sense.EXAMPLE: laws against obscenity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止淫秽内容的法律

Sense.DEF: a sexually offensive word or action
Sense.EXAMPLE: drunken youths screaming obscenities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高声嚷着淫词秽语的醉酒年轻人

Sense.DEF: the practice of deliberately stopping ideas and facts from being known
not well known and usually not very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obscure poet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名不见经传的诗人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The details of his life remain obscure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生平不详。

Sense.DEF: difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: obscure legal phrases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费解的法律术语
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some obscure reason, the group is very popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组合莫名其妙地很受欢迎。

Sense.DEF: to make something difficult to know or understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent successes have obscured the fact that the company is still in trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来的成功掩盖了公司依然处于困境的事实。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from being seen or heard clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view was obscured by mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 薄雾中景色朦胧。

Sense.DEF: the state of not being known or remembered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group produced two albums before disappearing into obscurity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体发行两张专辑后就淡出乐坛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: O’Brien died in obscurity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥布莱恩默默无闻地死去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She rose from obscurity to stardom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从无名之辈一跃成为明星。

Sense.DEF: something that is difficult to understand, or the quality of being difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: obscurities in the text
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文中的难解之处

Sense.DEF: a funeral ceremony
very eager to please or agree with people who are powerful – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 献媚的﹐奉承的﹐奴颜婢膝的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obsequious smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谄媚的微笑

Sense.DEF: something that is observable can be seen or noticed
Sense.EXAMPLE: an observable change in behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行为的显著变化

Sense.DEF: when someone obeys a law or does something because it is part of a religion, custom, or ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔对法律﹑宗教﹑风俗或仪式的〕遵守﹐奉行

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the observance of a peace agreement
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对和约的遵守
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the strict observance of Islam
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对伊斯兰教规的严格遵守

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Memorial Day observance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念日的习俗

Sense.DEF: something you do as part of a ceremony, especially a religious ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious observances
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教仪式

Sense.DEF: good or quick at noticing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet and observant person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个寡言而机敏的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supervisors are trained to be observant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主管被训练得敏锐机警。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the writer’s observant eye for detail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位作家善于捕捉细节的敏锐目光

Sense.DEF: obeying laws, religious rules etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: observant Jews
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遵守教规的犹太教徒

Sense.DEF: the process of watching something or someone carefully for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bloomfield’s approach to linguistics was based on observation of the language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布龙菲尔德的语言学研究方法以对语言的观察为基础。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent two nights under close observation in hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在医院接受了两个晚上的严密观察。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His orders were to keep the men under observation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下的命令是监视这些人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Art classes help develop children’s powers of observation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美术课有助于提高儿童的观察力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careful observation suggests that this is not the case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细观察的结果表明情况并非如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detailed observations were carried out on the behaviour of the students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这些学生的行为作了细致观察。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From their direct observations, children absorb a model of marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童通过直接观察来理解某一种婚姻的模式。

Sense.DEF: something that you notice when watching something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some interesting observations emerged from this research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究得出了一些有趣的结果。

Sense.DEF: a spoken or written remark about something you have noticed
Sense.TRAN: 〔对所注意到的事物的〕评述﹐评论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Darwin’s observations on the habits of certain birds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 达尔文对某些鸟类习性的论述

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paz makes some observations about the role of the critic.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕斯论述了评论家的作用。

Sense.DEF: the act of obeying a law etc
a position from which an enemy can be watched
a tall structure built so that you can see a long way, used to watch prisoners, look for forest fires etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来监视犯人﹑观察森林火灾等的〕瞭望塔

Sense.DEF: a special building from which scientists watch the moon, stars, weather etc
to see and notice some­thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was observed that 40 percent of patients had high blood pressure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据观察﹐40%的病人患有高血压。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officers observed him driving at 90 miles per hour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察发现他以90英里的时速驾车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据观察发现﹐食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people say that someone sees, notices, or spots something or someone.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示某人看见某物或某人时﹐人们用see﹐notice或spot
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She was spotted going into a restaurant with a well-known footballer.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人看见她和一位著名足球运动员一起走进一家餐厅。

Sense.DEF: to watch something or someone carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have been observing his movements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方一直在监视他的行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One student performs the experiment, while his partner observes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名学生做实验﹐他的搭档则进行观察。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Observe how the people in the group interact.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意观察这个小组内的人是如何相互交流的。

Sense.DEF: to say or write what you have noticed about a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keynes observed that humans fall into two classes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯恩斯认为人分为两类。

Sense.DEF: to do what you are supposed to do according to a law or agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: So far the ceasefire has been observed by both sides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到目前为止﹐双方都遵守着停火协定。

Sense.DEF: to do things and obey laws that are part of a religion or custom
someone who regularly watches or pays attention to particular things, events, situations etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an observer of nature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察大自然的人

Sense.EXAMPLE: political observers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治观察员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Observers are predicting a fall in interest rates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察员预测利率会下降。

Sense.DEF: someone who attends meetings, classes, events etc to check what is happening
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑事件等的〕观察员﹔〔课程的〕旁听者
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN sent observers to the peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国派遣观察员参加和谈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Independent observers monitored the elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立观察员对大选进行了监督。

Sense.DEF: someone who sees or looks at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: reports from observers at sea and on dry land
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自海上和陆地的目击者报告

GramExa.GLOSS: someone looking at something but not very carefully
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A casual observer would have guessed his age at 70.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是不仔细看﹐可能会猜他的年龄是70岁。

Sense.DEF: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 使痴迷﹐使迷恋﹐使心神不宁〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of young girls are obsessed by their weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻女孩都过于担心自己的体重。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jody’s been obsessed with some lifeguard for months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔迪几个月来一直迷恋着某个救生员。

Sense.DEF: to think about something or someone much more than is necessary or sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop obsessing about your hair. It’s fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再过于担心你的头发了﹐它看上去很好。

Sense.DEF: an extreme unhealthy interest in something or worry about something, which stops you from thinking about anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gambling became an obsession, and he eventually lost everything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迷上赌博﹐最后失去了一切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unhealthy obsession with being thin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对瘦的病态追求
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The current obsession with exam results is actually harming children’s education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前一味追求考试成绩的做法实际上对儿童教育有害。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The game pachinko became a national obsession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹珠机游戏已经风靡全国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has an enthusiasm for art, to the point of obsession in my opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对艺术很热衷﹐在我看来已经到了痴迷的程度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked after him with a devotion bordering on obsession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽心尽力地照顾他﹐简直到了沉迷的地步。

Sense.DEF: thinking or worrying about something all the time, so that you do not think about other things enough – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 痴迷的﹐迷恋的﹔过度的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obsessive concern with cleanliness and order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对干净整齐的过分讲究

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I try to stay fit, but I’m not obsessive about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我努力保持健康﹐但并不苛求。

Sense.DEF: someone whose behaviour is obsessive
someone who is obsessive-compulsive tends to repeat particular actions in a way that is not necessary, because they have strong anxious feelings
Sense.TRAN: 强迫症的﹐强迫性神经症的
Sense.EXAMPLE: obsessive-compulsive behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强迫症行为

Sense.DEF: a type of rock that looks like black glass
when something becomes old-fashioned and no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented
when a product is designed so that it will soon become unfashionable or impossible to use and will need replacing
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品的〕有计划报废/内在陈旧性
Sense.EXAMPLE: the planned obsolescence of some software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些软件的有计划报废

Sense.DEF: becoming obsolete
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐被废弃的﹔即将过时的

Sense.DEF: no longer useful, because something newer and better has been invented
Sense.EXAMPLE: obsolete weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已被淘汰的武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: computer hardware that quickly became obsolete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快就变得过时的电脑硬件
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will computers render make books obsolete?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机会把书籍淘汰掉吗？

Sense.DEF: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fear of change is an obstacle to progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 惧怕变革是进步的一大障碍。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

Sense.DEF: an object which blocks your way, so that you must try to go around it
a line of objects which people have to jump over, climb through etc in a race
Sense.TRAN: 障碍赛跑道﹔障碍赛赛场

Sense.DEF: a series of difficulties which must be dealt with to achieve a particular aim
Sense.TRAN: 〔为达到某一目标所需克服的〕重重困难

Sense.DEF: an area of land with special equipment that soldiers must run through, climb over etc, as part of their training
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队的〕突击训练场﹐军事训练场地

Sense.DEF: a type of race in which runners have to jump over or climb through various objects
a doctor who has special training in obstetrics
the part of medical science that deals with the birth of children
determined not to change your ideas, behaviour, opinions etc, even when other people think you are being unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was the most obstinate man I’ve ever met.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我遇到过的最固执的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so obstinate!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么固执！
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obstinate refusal to obey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 固执地拒绝服从

Sense.DEF: difficult to deal with or get rid of
Sense.TRAN: 难以对付的﹔难以去除的﹔难治的
Sense.EXAMPLE: obstinate stains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽固的污渍
Sense.EXAMPLE: a complex and obstinate issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复杂又难缠的问题

Sense.DEF: noisy and refusing to do what someone asks
Sense.TRAN: 吵闹任性的﹐不服约束的

Sense.DEF: to block a road, passage etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柱子挡着﹐我们看不见舞台。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something or something from happening, by making it difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group is trying to obstruct the peace process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该团体试图阻挠和平进程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fined for obstructing the work of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因妨碍警察执行公务而被罚款。

Sense.DEF: when something blocks a road, passage, tube etc, or the thing that blocks it
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路﹑通道﹑管道等的〕堵塞(物)﹐阻塞(物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: an operation to remove an obstruction from her throat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去除她喉咙里阻塞物的手术
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police can remove a vehicle that is causing an obstruction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察有权把造成阻塞的车辆移走。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an unlawful obstruction of the highway
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法阻塞公路

Sense.DEF: when someone or something prevents or delays a legal or political process
Sense.TRAN: 〔对司法或政治程序的〕阻挠﹐拖延

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the obstruction of vital legislation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对重要立法的阻挠
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was found guilty of obstruction of justice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因妨碍司法公正而被判有罪。

Sense.DEF: an offence in football, hockey etc in which a player gets between an opponent and the ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球﹑曲棍球等比赛中的〕阻挡(犯规)

Sense.DEF: when someone tries to prevent or delay a legal or political process
Sense.TRAN: 〔对司法或政治程序的〕蓄意阻挠﹐故意拖延

Sense.DEF: trying to prevent someone from doing something, by deliberately making it difficult for them
Sense.TRAN: 蓄意阻挠的﹐故意妨碍的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an obstructive official
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓄意阻挠的官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: obstructive tactics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阻挠策略

Sense.DEF: relating to a blocked tube, passage etc in the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: obstructive symptoms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梗阻症状

Sense.DEF: to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过自身的努力﹑技能或工作〕获得﹐得到

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Further information can be obtained from head office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 详细资料可向总公司索取。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You will need to obtain permission from the principal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要得到校长的同意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the results obtained through these surveys
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过这些调查得出的结果

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people say that they get a result, a ticket, some information etc rather than obtain it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们说得到结果﹑票﹑信息等时用get﹐而不用obtain
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You have to get permission from your parents.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须得到父母的允许。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况﹑制度或规则〕继续存在﹐通用
Sense.EXAMPLE: These conditions no longer obtain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些状况已不复存在。

Sense.DEF: able to be obtained
Sense.EXAMPLE: The form is obtainable at your local post office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该表格可向当地邮局索取。

Sense.DEF: if something obtrudes, or you obtrude something, it becomes noticeable where it is not wanted
noticeable in an unpleasant or annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: obtrusive TV antennas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 碍眼的电视天线
Sense.EXAMPLE: The waiters were friendly and not obtrusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务员态度友好﹐举止得体。

Sense.DEF: slow to understand things, in a way that is annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But why?’ said Charles, being deliberately obtuse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “但是为什么呢？”查尔斯故意傻傻地说道。

Sense.DEF: an angle between 90 and 180 degrees
the opposite of a particular situation or feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The obverse of victory is defeat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 与胜利相对的是失败。

Sense.DEF: the front side of a coin or medal
to prevent or avoid a problem or the need to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new treatment obviates the need for surgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的疗法免除了手术的必要。

Sense.DEF: easy to notice or understand
Sense.TRAN: 显然的﹐明显的﹔易理解的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was obvious that Gina was lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜显然是在撒谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It might be obvious to you, but it isn’t to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对你来说也许很容易理解﹐但对我却并非如此。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you want something very badly, when other people think this behaviour is not suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know you really like him, but you don’t have to be so obvious about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你很喜欢他﹐但你也不必表露得如此明显。

Sense.DEF: the person or thing that you would expect everyone to choose
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teaching is an obvious choice of career if you like working with children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你喜欢和孩子打交道﹐那么教书就是当然的选择。

Sense.DEF: what clearly seems the best thing to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The obvious thing is to speak to her before you make a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的办法显然是在你作决定前和她谈一谈。

Sense.DEF: to say something that is already obvious so it is not necessary to say it
Sense.TRAN: 说出明摆着的事﹐此话可能多余
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is stating the obvious, but regular measurement of blood pressure is essential in older people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能不说大家也知道﹐定期给老人量血压十分必要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It seems obvious to me that he is guilty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看他显然有罪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This may sound obvious, but don’t forget to put your name on your paper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听起来谁都知道﹐可还是别忘了在卷子上写好名字。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It soon became obvious that the boy was not really interested.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快就明显看出那男孩并不感兴趣。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plan, for obvious reasons, was being kept secret.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 出于显而易见的原因﹐该计划一直保密。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This case is an obvious example of what can go wrong.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事是说明会出现什么问题的明显例子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The obvious question is: why?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明摆着的问题是: 为什么？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: extremely obvious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cause of her problems is glaringly obvious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那些问题的原因极其明显。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: clearly obvious
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His interest in her was blatantly obvious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她的兴趣是非常明显的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very obvious, and embarrassing or upsetting
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It became painfully obvious that she and Edward had nothing in common.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐她和爱德华显然毫无共同点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The cause of the pain was not immediately obvious.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛的原因暂时还不清楚。

Exponent.DEF: something that is obvious is very easy to notice or understand – used especially when you are surprised that other people cannot notice it
Exponent.TRAN: 明显的﹔易理解的〔尤用以表示因别人未加注意而惊讶〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is an obvious connection between the two murders.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两宗谋杀案之间有明显关联。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was obvious that something was wrong.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然哪里出问题了。

Exponent.DEF: easy to notice that something is true, so that you feel sure about it and have no doubts
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was clear to me that my father was dying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚父亲快死了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are clear signs of an economic recovery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有明确迹象显示经济正在复苏。

Exponent.DEF: very easy to notice, especially because you can see, hear, smell, or feel something
Exponent.TRAN: 显著的〔尤指感官能够感知的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Steroid drugs cause a noticeable change in someone’s behaviour.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 类固醇药物可导致人的行为发生显著变化。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Road noise tends to be more noticeable in certain weather conditions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在某些天气情况下﹐道路噪声往往会更加明显。

Exponent.DEF: very easy to notice, because of being different from things around them
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因与周围事物不同〕显眼的﹐引人注目的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a conspicuous white spot on the bird’s wings
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟翼上醒目的白色斑点
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She tried to make herself look less conspicuous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尽量让自己不那么惹人注意。

Exponent.DEF: extremely obvious, so that you cannot possibly confuse something with something else
Exponent.TRAN: 清楚明白的﹐确定无疑的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the unmistakable sound of gunfire
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 确定无疑的枪炮声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The flower’s scent is unmistakable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这花的香气绝不会搞错。

Exponent.DEF: facts, ideas etc that are self-evident are obvious and true, although some people may not accept them or know about them
Exponent.TRAN: 不证自明的﹔显而易见的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The facts in this case are self-evident and cannot be denied.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本案的事实显而易见﹐无法否认。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We hold these truths to be self-evident we believe that they obvious and true – from the American Declaration of Independence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为下面这些真理是不言而喻的(引自美国《独立宣言》)。

Exponent.DEF: use this about something that someone does which is clearly bad, but which they do not seem to be ashamed of
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a blatant lie
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 无耻的谎言
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bill is a blatant attempt to limit our right to free speech.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该法案公然妄图限制我们的言论自由。

Exponent.DEF: to know that something must be true because you can see signs that show this
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Even though it was dark, she could tell it was him.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管天很黑，她还是认出来是他。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How can you tell if you've broken your arm?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么知道自己的胳膊有没有断？

Sense.DEF: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood
Sense.TRAN: 明显地﹐显而易见地﹔明白地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re obviously going to need more help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐这要花点时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cost is obviously important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用当然很重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她皱起眉头﹐显然感到不解。

Sense.DEF: a wind instrument that has an egg-shaped body, holes which you block with your fingers, and a tube which you blow down

Subsense.DEF: a time when something happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve seen Jana with them on several occasions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几次看见贾娜和他们在一起。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On this occasion we were sitting in a park in Madrid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一次我们是坐在马德里的一座公园里。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

Subsense.DEF: a suitable or favourable time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

Subsense.HINTTRAN: Do not use occasion to mean ‘a time when it is possible for you to do what you want to do’. Use opportunity or chance. 表示可以做自己想做之事的机会时﹐不要用occasion﹐而要用opportunity或chance: Do not waste this opportunity (NOT不说this occasion). 不要坐失良机。

Sense.DEF: an important social event or ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

Sense.DEF: a cause or reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: His remark was the occasion of a bitter quarrel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话引起了一场激烈的争吵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had occasion to call on him last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年我因事去拜访过他。

Sense.DEF: if a particular action ever becomes necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: If ever the occasion arises when I want advice, you’re the first person I’ll come to.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我若是有事需要请教﹐第一个便来找你。

Sense.DEF: sometimes but not often
Sense.EXAMPLE: On occasion, prisoners were allowed visits from their families.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯可获准偶尔接受家属探访。

Sense.DEF: at the time of an important event
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the occasion of his second wedding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他第二个婚礼上

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She used her best china on special occasions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在特殊场合摆出最好的瓷器。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The big occasion for country people was the Agricultural Fair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业展览会就是乡村民众的盛会了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He wore the suit on formal occasions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套装他在正式场合才穿。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I prefer not to discuss business at social occasions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢在社交场合谈生意。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very formal official occasion
when you celebrate something
important as part of history

Collocate.EXAMPLE: To celebrate the occasion, a small party was held at his home.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家里举行了一个小聚会来庆祝此事。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something special to celebrate an event
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The bells were rung to mark the occasion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 敲响钟声以示纪念。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a feeling that an event is very special or important
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The music gave the event a real sense of occasion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐为这一活动平添了隆重的气氛。

Collocate.COLLOC: enter into the spirit of the occasion
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: join in a social occasion in an eager way

Sense.DEF: to cause something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a long career break occasioned by her husband’s job being moved to Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因为丈夫的工作调到巴黎﹐事业曾被长期中断。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your behaviour has occasioned us a great deal of anxiety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的行为已引起我们极大的不安。

Sense.DEF: happening sometimes but not often or regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made occasional visits to London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有时候会去伦敦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had an occasional coffee together after shopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He only has occasional use of a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

Sense.DEF: sometimes, but not regularly and not often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Occasionally Alice would look up from her books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯偶尔会从书中抬起头来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We only see each other very occasionally rarely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是难得见一次面。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say once in a while rather than occasionally.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们常说once in a while﹐而不说occasionally
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We still see her once in a while.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然偶尔去看看她。

Sense.DEF: a small light table that can be easily moved
Sense.TRAN: 〔易于挪动的〕轻便小桌﹐备用小桌

Sense.DEF: the western part of the world, especially Europe and the Americas
Sense.TRAN: 西方﹐西方国家﹐西半球〔尤指欧洲和美洲〕

Sense.DEF: someone from the western part of the world
mysterious practices and powers involving magic and spirits
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a strange man who dabbled in the occult.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个懂一点魔法的怪人。

Sense.DEF: magical and mysterious
Sense.TRAN: 玄妙的﹔奥秘的﹔神秘的﹔超自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: occult practices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神秘习俗
Sense.EXAMPLE: the occult powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超自然力量

Sense.DEF: the number of people who stay, work, or live in a room or building at the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: single occupancy room rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 单人入住的房费

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hotels in Tokyo enjoy over 90% occupancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东京的宾馆入住率高达90%以上。

Sense.DEF: someone’s use of a building, hotel, or other space, for living or working in, or the period during which they live or work there
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day for changing from one occupancy to the next was on a Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 租户变更是在某个星期六。

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in a house, room etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The furniture had been left by the previous occupants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具是先前的住户留下的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police are still trying to trace the occupants of the house which was destroyed by fire.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方仍在查找被焚房子里的住户。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a room, vehicle etc at a particular time
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑汽车等某一时期的〕使用者﹐占有人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither of the car’s two occupants was injured.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车里的两个人都没有受伤。

Sense.DEF: a job or profession
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please state your name, address and occupation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请写明你的姓名﹑地址和职业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: professional and managerial occupations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专业及管理工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: manual occupations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体力工作

Sense.DEF: when a large group of people enter a place and take control of it, especially by military force

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the German occupation of France
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德军对法国的占领

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The area is under occupation controlled by a foreign army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一地区已被占领。

Sense.DEF: a way of spending your time
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of my childhood occupations was collecting stamps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我儿时的消遣之一是集邮。

Sense.DEF: when someone lives or stays in a building or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the first scientists came to the region they found little evidence of human occupation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一批科学家来到这个地区时﹐他们基本没发现任何人类居住过的痕迹。

Sense.DEF: relating to or caused by your job
Sense.TRAN: 职业的﹐工作的﹔由职业引起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: occupational pension schemes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业退休金计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: an occupational health centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业医疗保健中心
Sense.EXAMPLE: occupational disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业病
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting injured is an occupational hazard a risk that always exists in a particular job or activity of the sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤是这项运动的职业性危害。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to help people get better after an illness by giving them activities to do
the job of an occupational therapist
busy doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His time was occupied with the children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的时间都被孩子占用了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s fully occupied with work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作使她忙得不可开交。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum has enough exhibits to keep anyone occupied for an hour or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座博物馆的展品足够让任何人观赏一两个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept myself occupied by watching television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了不让自己闲着﹐我一直看电视。

Sense.DEF: a bed, chair, room etc that is occupied is being used
Sense.TRAN: 〔床﹑椅子﹑房间等〕已被占用的﹐有人使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, this seat is occupied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐这个座位有人了。

Sense.DEF: an occupied place is controlled by an army from another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: occupied territories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 占领区

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in or uses a particular house, piece of land etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔房屋﹑土地等的〕占用者﹐居住者
Sense.EXAMPLE: A large proportion of occupiers now own their homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大部分住户的房子都是他们自己的。

Sense.DEF: a member of an army that has occupied a city or country by force
to live or stay in a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He occupies the house without paying any rent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在这幢房子里﹐没有付一分钱房租。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was purchased and occupied by its new owners last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房屋去年被新业主买下入住了。

Sense.DEF: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only six percent of police time is occupied with criminal incidents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪事件只占用6%的警务时间。

Sense.DEF: to fill a particular amount of space
Sense.EXAMPLE: Family photos occupied almost the entire wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家人的照片差不多占了整个墙面。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that something takes up time or space rather than occupies it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示某事物占用时间或空间时﹐人们一般说take up﹐而不说occupy
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Work takes up most of her time.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作占去了她的大部分时间。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: That bed takes up almost the whole room.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 那张床几乎占据了整个房间。

Sense.DEF: to enter a place in a large group and keep control of it, especially by military force
Sense.EXAMPLE: an occupying army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 占领军
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students occupied Sofia University on Monday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期一学生们占领了索非亚大学。

Sense.DEF: if something occupies your mind etc, you think about that thing more than anything else
Sense.TRAN: 占据某人的脑海/思想/注意力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work will occupy your mind and help you forget about him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作会占据你的思想﹐使你忘记他。

Sense.DEF: to use something such as a room, seat, or bed
Sense.TRAN: 使用﹐占用〔房间﹑座位﹑床等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many patients who are occupying hospital beds could be transferred to other places.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多占用医院床位的病人都可以转往其他地方。

Sense.DEF: to have an official position or job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Before becoming Prime Minister, he had already occupied several cabinet posts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成为首相之前﹐他已经出任过好几个内阁职位。

Sense.DEF: to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say happen rather than occur.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说happen﹐而不说occur
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The accident happened while she was at school.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故是在她上学时发生的。

Sense.DEF: to happen or exist in a particular place or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔在特定地点或情况下〕发生﹐存在

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whooping cough occurs mainly in young children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 百日咳多发于幼儿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The highest rates of unemployment occur in the inner urban areas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内城地区失业率最高。

Sense.DEF: if an idea or thought occurs to you, it suddenly comes into your mind
Sense.TRAN: 〔主意或想法突然〕浮现于脑中﹐被想起﹐被想到

GramExa.PROPFORM: it occurs to sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suppose it didn’t occur to you to phone the police?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你根本就没想到打电话报警吧？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It never seems to occur to my children to contact me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的孩子们似乎从来都想不到和我联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It had never occurred to him that he might be falling in love with her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未想到自己可能会爱上她。

Sense.DEF: something that happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Laughter was a rare occurrence in his classroom.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的课堂上难得有笑声。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Flooding in the area is a common occurrence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区经常发生水灾。

Sense.DEF: the fact of something happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The frequent occurrence of earthquakes in the area means that the buildings must be specially designed to withstand the force.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区地震频发﹐这意味着建筑物必须有专门的抗震设计。

Sense.DEF: a form of mental illness in which a person does the same thing again and again and cannot stop doing it, for example washing their hands many times a day
Sense.TRAN: 强迫症﹐强迫性神经症〔一种精神疾病﹐特征为反复做同一件事而无法停止﹐如一天洗手很多次〕

Sense.DEF: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood on the beach, gazing at the ocean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在海滩上﹐凝视着大海。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like to swim in the ocean when it’s warm enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水足够暖的时候﹐我喜欢在海里游泳。

Sense.DEF: one of the very large areas of sea on the Earth’s surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Pacific Ocean
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太平洋

Sense.DEF: a lot of something, especially a liquid
Sense.TRAN: 大量[许多]某物〔尤指液体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: oceans of champagne
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的香槟

Sense.DEF: on the land along the edge of an ocean
Sense.EXAMPLE: oceanfront houses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滨房屋

Sense.DEF: an oceangoing ship is designed to sail across the sea rather than a river or lake
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oceangoing tanker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远洋油轮

Sense.DEF: relating to the ocean
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oceanic island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大洋岛
Sense.EXAMPLE: oceanic waters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海域

Sense.DEF: the scientific study of the ocean
a large American wild cat that has a pattern of spots on its back
Sense.TRAN: 豹猫〔产于美洲的一种大型野生猫科动物﹐背部有斑点〕

Sense.DEF: used in Scotland and parts of Ireland to express surprise or to emphasize a remark
Sense.TRAN: 啊﹐呀﹐哎哟〔苏格兰和爱尔兰部分地区用语﹐表示惊讶或加强语气〕

Sense.DEF: a type of reddish-yellow earth used in paints
the reddish-yellow colour of ochre
an Australian man – used in Australia and New Zealand
Sense.TRAN: 澳大利亚人﹔老兄〔澳大利亚和新西兰用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: G’day Ocker!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好﹐老兄！

Sense.DEF: one of the times when the clock shows the exact hour as a number from 1 to 12
Sense.EXAMPLE: It's already 9 o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经9点钟了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting is at 10 o'clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开会时间是10点钟。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use o'clock when mentioning minutes or parts of an hour. 不要用o'clock 表达分钟或非整点时间: ten past nine (NOT不说half past nine o'clock) 9点10分 | half past one (NOT不说half past one o'clock) 1点半 Do not use o'clock when writing the time in the form 1.00, 2.00 etc. 把时间写成1.00,2.00等形式时，不要用o'clock.

Sense.DEF: computer software that recognizes numbers and letters of the alphabet which are written on paper, so that information from paper documents can be scanned into a computer
Sense.TRAN: 光(学)字符识别〔一种计算机软件﹐能识别写在纸上的数字和字母﹐以便把信息扫描进计算机〕

Sense.DEF: government by a particular sort of people or according to a particular principle
Sense.TRAN: 〔由某一类人或根据某一原则管理的〕政府﹐政体﹔统治﹔政治
Sense.EXAMPLE: democracy government by the people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主政府﹔民主政体
Sense.EXAMPLE: meritocracy government by people with the most ability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精英管理﹐贤能统治

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in a particular principle of government
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democrat someone who believes in government by the people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主主义者

Sense.DEF: a member of a powerful or governing social class or group
Sense.TRAN: 有权势的社会阶层[统治阶级]的一分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a technocrat a scientist who controls an organization or country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术官僚

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=October 十月

Sense.DEF: a flat shape with eight sides and eight angles
a type of hydrocarbon that is in fuel and is used as a measure of its quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: low octane petrol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低辛烷值汽油
Sense.EXAMPLE: high octane fuel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高辛烷值燃料

Subsense.DEF: the range of musical notes between the first note of a scale and the last one
the first and last notes of a musical scale played together

Sense.DEF: eight singers or musicians performing together
Sense.TRAN: 八重唱组合﹔八重奏乐团

Sense.DEF: a piece of music for an octet
eight, or having eight
Sense.EXAMPLE: octagon a shape with eight sides
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 八边形﹐八角形
Sense.EXAMPLE: octopus a sea creature with eight arms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 章鱼﹐八爪鱼

Sense.DEF: the tenth month of the year, between September and November

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We moved in last October.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是去年10月搬进去的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You are going to be busy in October.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 10月份你就要忙了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We begin on October 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们10月6日开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were arrested on 6th October.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们于10月6日被捕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The baby was baptized Monday, October 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝是在10月6日星期一受洗的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is between 80 and 89 years old
Sense.TRAN: 八十至八十九岁之间的人﹐八旬老人

Sense.DEF: a sea creature with eight tentacles arms
relating to your eyes or your ability to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: ocular muscles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼部肌肉

Sense.DEF: a doctor who examines and treats people’s eyes
to take too much of a drug so that it is dangerous

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He OD’d on sleeping tablets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他服用了过量安眠药。

Sense.DEF: to see, hear, eat etc too much of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children who OD on video games
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉迷于电子游戏的儿童

Sense.DEF: a beautiful female slave in former times
different from what is normal or expected, especially in a way that you disapprove of or cannot understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an odd thing to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这话说得很奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an odd way to behave
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古怪的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re an odd couple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是古怪的一对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was something odd about him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人有些奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What she did was unforgivable, but the odd thing was he didn’t seem to mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的所作所为是不可原谅的﹐但奇怪的是他好像并不在意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was holding an extremely odd-looking weapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她手持一件非常奇特的武器。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It seemed odd that he wanted a picture of me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想要一张我的照片﹐这似乎有点奇怪。

Sense.DEF: a few occasions, days etc that happen at various times but not often and not regularly
Sense.TRAN: 偶尔的场合/日子/时刻/饮酒等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of sleep doesn’t matter on the odd occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔睡眠不足没什么关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I take the odd day off work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偶尔请假不上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like the odd glass of wine with my dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢晚餐时偶尔喝杯葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo smokes the odd cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔偶尔吸一支烟。

Sense.DEF: not specially chosen or collected
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any odd scrap of paper will do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便拿一张纸片都行。

Sense.DEF: separated from a pair or set
Sense.TRAN: 〔一双或一套中〕单只的﹐不成对的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an odd shoe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单只鞋

GramExa.GLOSS: not a matching pair of socks etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was wearing odd socks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿了两只不配对的短袜。

Sense.DEF: a number that cannot be divided exactly by two, for example 1, 3, 5, 7 etc
a little more than 20 etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have another 20-odd years to work before I retire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还要工作20多年才退休。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is different from the rest of the group or not included in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which shape is the odd one out?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪个形状与其他的不同？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was always the odd one out at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里我总是跟同学格格不入。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves in a strange or unusual way

Tail.EXAMPLE: a rather oddball sense of humour

Sense.DEF: a strange or unusual person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a class of 120 students there were four women including myself, and I still felt rather an oddity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一个有120名学生的班级里﹐包括我在内共有4名女生﹐可我仍然感觉像个异类。

Sense.DEF: a strange quality in someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: 60s fashions that are remem­bered for their oddity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以风格怪异而留在人们记忆中的60年代的时装

Sense.DEF: a man who does various jobs in people’s houses or gardens
Sense.TRAN: 〔在他人家里或花园里〕打零工的人

Sense.DEF: small jobs of different types
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a few odd jobs to do this weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个周末我有点杂活要干。

Sense.DEF: in a strange or unusual way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been behaving oddly this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个星期她行为有点异常。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something seems strange or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oddly enough, someone asked me the same question only yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真奇怪﹐就在昨天还有人问过我同样的问题。

Sense.DEF: small things of no value, or pieces of a material that were not used when something was made
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can make a patchwork quilt from oddments of silk and cotton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以用丝绸和棉布的边角料做一条百衲被。

Sense.DEF: how likely it is that something will or will not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The odds are it is likely that he will commit the same crime again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可能还会犯同样的罪行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can narrow the odds of a nasty accident happening in your home by being more safety-conscious.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 增强安全意识可以减少家中发生意外危险的可能性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The odds against a plane crash are around a million to one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生空难的可能性仅有约百万分之一。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid that the odds are heavily against her winning it is not likely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕她获胜的可能性很小。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What are the odds how likely is it that they will mess up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们失败的可能性有多大？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new company that has beaten the odds and succeeded it was not likely to succeed, but it did
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战胜逆境而取得成功的一家新公司

Sense.DEF: difficulties which make a good result seem very unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital’s director has been battling against the odds to improve patient care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位医院院长一直在克服困难﹐努力提高病人护理服务质量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soldiers’ job was to hold on despite impossible odds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些士兵的任务是排除万难﹐坚守下去。

Subsense.DEF: to disagree

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Briggs found himself at odds with his colleagues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里格斯发现自己与同事们意见不合。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two politicians were at odds over what was the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位政治家在何为事实真相的问题上产生了分歧。

Subsense.DEF: if two statements, descriptions, actions etc are at odds with each other, they are different although they should be the same

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark’s account of what happened is at odds with Dan’s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克对所发生情况的说法和丹的说法不一样。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave him a sweet smile, totally at odds with the look of dislike in her eyes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给了他一个甜甜的微笑﹐这和她眼中的不悦完全不符。

Sense.DEF: the numbers that show how much money you will win if you bet on the winner of a horse race or other competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The odds are 6-1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赔率是6比1。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At odds of 10-1 he bet a hundred pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以10比1的赔率押了100英镑。

GramExa.GLOSS: high or low numbers, that show a high or low risk of losing
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone was surprised when Desert Zone won the race, at very long odds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高赔率的“沙漠地带”竟然在赛马中获胜﹐人人都感到意外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are laying odds of 8-1 that the Conservatives will win the next election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为保守党在下次大选中获胜开出8比1的赔率。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what someone does or what happens is not important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pay me now or later – it makes no odds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在付给我或者晚点再付都没关系。

Sense.DEF: to pay a higher price than is usual or reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most residents live in tiny apartments and pay over the odds for them too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分居民居住在狭小的公寓里﹐还要支付高额房租。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 巨大的/相当大的/难以置信的困难
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He survived a night in the cold water against incredible odds.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他克服了难以置信的困难﹐在冰冷的水中挺过了一夜。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of difficulties
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We must hope that, despite great odds, we can achieve a peaceful settlement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须坚信﹐虽然困难重重﹐但我们一定能达成和平协议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: making success seem extremely unlikely
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They face impossible odds simply trying to get an education.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 单是为了能获得教育﹐他们就面临着难以克服的困难。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: succeed despite great difficulties
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The baby, born sixteen weeks too early, defied the odds and is celebrating her first birthday.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个早产16周的婴儿竟然存活下来﹐现在迎来一岁生日。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: work hard despite great difficulties
despite something seeming very unlikely
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Against all odds, he recovered from his illness.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管病情凶险﹐他还是恢复了健康。

Collocate.COLLOC: the odds are stacked against sb
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: there are a lot of difficulties that may prevent someone’s success
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人处于非常不利的境地

Sense.DEF: small things of various kinds without much value
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t keep much in his desk – just a few odds and ends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他书桌里没放多少东西﹐只是些零碎物品。

Sense.DEF: the person, horse etc that is most likely to win a race or other competition
Sense.TRAN: 被看好的大热门﹐最有希望获胜的人[赛马等]

Sense.DEF: very likely
Sense.TRAN: 很有可能的﹐十有八九的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s odds on that she won’t come.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她多半不会来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They must have felt they were odds-on to win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们肯定觉得自己胜算很大。

Sense.DEF: a poem or song written in order to praise a person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keats’ ‘Ode to a Nightingale’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 济慈的《夜莺颂》

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 十分讨厌的﹐可憎的﹐丑恶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an odious little man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨厌的小男人

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of hatred that a lot of people have for someone because of something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Internationally Reagan attracted odium for his militarism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 里根因为穷兵黩武招致国际社会的反感。

Sense.DEF: an instrument in a vehicle that shows how many miles or kilometres the vehicle has travelled
the American spelling of odour

Sense.TRAN: 有气味的﹔有香味的﹐芳香的

Sense.DEF: the American spelling of odourless
having a smell
Sense.TRAN: 有气味的﹔有香味的﹐芳香的
Sense.EXAMPLE: odorous gases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有气味的气体

Sense.DEF: a smell, especially an unpleasant one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the faint odour of damp
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丝潮湿的气味

GramExa.EXAMPLE: obnoxious odours from a factory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一家工厂传出的难闻气味

Sense.DEF: having no smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: a colorless, odorless liquid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种无色无味的液体

Sense.DEF: a series of experiences that teach you something about yourself or about life
Sense.TRAN: 对人生有教益的一连串经历﹐艰难历程
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spiritual odyssey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次精神上的艰难历程

Sense.DEF: a long journey with a lot of adventures or difficulties

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They departed Texas on a three-year odyssey that took them as far as Japan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开得克萨斯﹐踏上了历时三年的艰险旅程﹐最远到达了日本。

Sense.FULLFORM: the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development
Sense.DEF: a group of rich countries who work together to develop trade and economic growth
Sense.TRAN: 经济合作与发展组织〔发达国家致力于发展贸易和促进经济增长的组织〕

Sense.DEF: related to an Oedipus complex
Sense.TRAN: 俄狄浦斯情结的﹐恋母情结的

Sense.DEF: according to Freudian psychology, when a son unconsciously feels sexual desire for his mother, combined with a hatred for his father
Sense.TRAN: 俄狄浦斯情结﹐恋母情结〔弗洛伊德心理学中指儿子无意识地依恋母亲并仇视父亲的心理〕

Sense.DEF: over – used especially in poetry
the tube which food passes down from your mouth to your stomach
a substance that is produced in a woman’s ovaries that causes changes in her body and prepares it for having babies
all the works of an artist or writer
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oeuvre of Van Gogh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡•高的全部画作

Sense.DEF: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from
Sense.EXAMPLE: the back of the house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的后部
Sense.EXAMPLE: the last scene of the movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影的最后一个场景
Sense.EXAMPLE: the end of the day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天的末了

Sense.DEF: used to show who something or someone belongs to or has a connection with
Sense.EXAMPLE: a friend of Mark’s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克的一个朋友
Sense.EXAMPLE: Avocado salad is a favourite of mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鳄梨色拉是我的最爱之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Product inspection is the responsibility of the employees themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 检验产品是员工自己的责任。

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a feature or quality that something has
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cost of the meal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这顿饭的花费
Sense.EXAMPLE: the beauty of the scenery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色之美
Sense.EXAMPLE: the length of the swimming pool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳池的长度

Sense.DEF: used to show what group one or more things or people belong to
Sense.EXAMPLE: some of the students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sunflowers’ is one of his best-known paintings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《向日葵》是他最著名的画作之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the guests are vegetarian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中有两位客人是素食者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a member of the baseball team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棒球队的一名队员

Sense.DEF: used to show what type of substance or thing you are referring to, when talking about an amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔谈论数量时表示所指之物的种类〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: two kilos of sugar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两公斤糖
Sense.EXAMPLE: millions of dollars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万美元
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bar of chocolate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块巧克力

Sense.DEF: used to say what something contains
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cup of coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯咖啡
Sense.EXAMPLE: several packets of cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几包香烟
Sense.EXAMPLE: truckloads of refugees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一车车的难民

Sense.DEF: used to say what type of things or people are in a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: a herd of elephants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群大象
Sense.EXAMPLE: his circle of friends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友圈子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of bananas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一串香蕉

Subsense.DEF: used to state specifically which thing of the general type mentioned you are referring to
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于具体说明所指的是某类事物中的哪一个〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the city of New York
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约城
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the art of painting
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绘画艺术
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the problem of unemployment
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业问题

Subsense.DEF: used to state specifically what a particular number, amount, age etc is
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于具体说明某数字﹑数量﹑年龄等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: at the age of 52
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在52岁时
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an increase of 3%
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3%的增长

Sense.DEF: used to talk about things produced by a famous or skilled writer, artist etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于谈论某位著名的或技巧高超的作家﹑艺术家等的作品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the plays of Shakespeare
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚的剧作
Sense.EXAMPLE: the paintings of Picasso
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毕加索的画作
Sense.EXAMPLE: the work of a great architect
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位建筑大师的作品

Sense.DEF: used to say what a story, some news etc is about, or what a picture, map etc shows
Sense.EXAMPLE: a story of love and loss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱与失的故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: news of his arrest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被捕的消息
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photo of Elizabeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张伊丽莎白的相片
Sense.EXAMPLE: a map of Indonesia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅印度尼西亚地图

Subsense.DEF: used after nouns that refer to actions, or to people who do something, in order to show who or what the action is done to
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于表示动作或施动者的名词之后﹐说明动作的对象〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the cancellation of the meeting
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议的取消
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the killing of innocent children
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀害无辜儿童
Subsense.EXAMPLE: supporters of the project
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目的支持者

Subsense.DEF: used after nouns that refer to actions in order to show who or what does the action
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于表示动作的名词之后﹐说明施动者〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the ringing of the phone
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话铃响
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the arrival of a visitor
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位客人的到来

Sense.DEF: used after some adjectives that describe feelings, to show who or what the feeling is directed towards
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些描述情感的形容词之后﹐说明情感的指向〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always been frightened of spiders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一向害怕蜘蛛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children want their parents to feel proud of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数儿童都希望父母为自己而骄傲。

Sense.DEF: used when referring to the day, moment etc when something happened
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于指某事发生的日期﹑时刻等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the day of the accident
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生的那一天
Sense.EXAMPLE: the week of the festival
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节日期间的那一周
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was at home at the time of the murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀发生时我在家里。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something is in relation to a place or thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于指某物与某地或某物之间的位置关系〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a historic seaside town 99 km south of London
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦以南99公里处的一座滨海历史名城

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the left of the sofa is a table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙发的左边是一张桌子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I live within a mile of here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我住在离这儿不到一英里远的地方。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a person or thing by saying what their main qualities or features are
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于描写某人或某物所具有的主要品质或特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Albright was seen as a woman of great determination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥尔布赖特在大家的眼里是一位意志非常坚定的女性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an area of considerable historical interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个非常有历史意义的地区。

Sense.DEF: used to say what someone’s age is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has two children, a boy of twelve and a girl of fifteen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有两个孩子﹐一个12岁的男孩和一个15岁的女孩。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it is kind/stupid/careless etc of sb (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s action shows a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 某人(做某事)是仁慈的/愚蠢的/粗心的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was kind of you to remember my birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真好﹐记得我的生日。

Sense.DEF: used to say where someone comes from
Sense.EXAMPLE: the people of China
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国人民
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jesus of Nazareth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿撒勒的耶稣

Sense.DEF: used to show the country, organization, or group in which someone has a particular position
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某一职位的人所属的国家﹑组织或团体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: King Philip II of Spain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙国王腓力二世
Sense.EXAMPLE: the secretary of the tennis club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网球俱乐部的干事

Sense.DEF: used in dates before the name of the month
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 27th of July
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 7月27日

Sense.DEF: used to say when something happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: the presidential election of 1825
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1825年的总统大选
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the biggest upsets of recent years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近年来最大的冷门之一

Sense.DEF: used in giving the time, to mean ‘before’
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示时间﹐意思是“之前﹐不到”〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a quarter of seven 6.45.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是7点差一刻。

Sense.DEF: used to show the cause of someone’s death
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died of cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死于癌症。

Sense.DEF: used to say what material has been used to make something
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某物是由何种材料制成的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dress of pure silk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真丝连衣裙
