Sense.LEXUNIT: of an evening/of a weekend etc
Sense.DEF: in the evenings, at weekends etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We often used to walk by the river of an evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前晚上常在河边散步。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: To refer to someone or something that belongs to or is connected with someone, it is usual to use -’s or -s’, not of, with short noun phrases.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指某人或某物属于某人或与某人有关时﹐通常用-’s或-s’接短的名词短语﹐而不用of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Dad’s car (NOT 不说 the car of Dad)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸的汽车
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a child’s bike (NOT 不说 the bike of a child)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子的自行车
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: my sisters’ boyfriend (NOT 不说 the boyfriend of my sister)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我姐姐的男朋友
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: the miners’ strike (NOT 不说 the strike of the miners)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 矿工的罢工
F2NBox.EXPL: When referring to one of several people or things belonging to or connected with someone, or when using ‘this’ or ‘that’, use of mine/yours/his/hers/ours/theirs.
F2NBox.TRAN: 提到多个人或物中的一个属于某人或与某人有关时﹐或用到this或that时﹐要用of mine/yours/his/hers/ours/theirs
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a friend of mine (NOT 不说 a friend of me)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一位朋友
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: that car of yours (NOT 不说 that car of you)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的那辆汽车
F2NBox.EXPL: To talk about the person who sang, wrote, or painted a particular work, use by, not of.
F2NBox.TRAN: 谈论某个作品由某人所唱﹑所写或所画时﹐用by﹐而不用of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a song by Mariah Carey (NOT 不说 of Mariah Carey)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚•凯莉唱的一首歌

Sense.DEF: used to show that other people probably already know what you are saying is true, or expect to hear it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, she won, of course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐当然是她赢啦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should of course keep copies of all your correspondence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你当然应该保留所有信函的复印件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course there will be some difficult times ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今后当然会有遇到困难的时候。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are saying ‘yes’ when someone asks your permission to do something
Sense.TRAN: 当然﹐好的〔当别人要做某事而征求你的同意时﹐用于强调同意的回答〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I ring you back in a minute?’ ‘Yes, of course.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我能不能过一会儿给你回电话？”“当然可以啦。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is it OK if I have another cup of coffee?’ ‘Course, help yourself.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我再喝杯咖啡行吗？”“当然可以﹐别客气。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying to someone is true or correct
Sense.TRAN: 当然﹐自然〔用于强调你对某人说的话属实或正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you really believe her?’ ‘Of course I do!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你当真相信她？”“那当然！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hope this idea of yours works.’ ‘Course it’ll work.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我希望你的这个想法行得通。”“当然会行得通。”

Sense.DEF: used to show that you accept or agree with what someone has just said
Sense.TRAN: 对﹐当然〔对别人刚说的话表示接受或同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t get angry. She’s only thirteen.’ ‘Of course.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别生气﹐她才13岁。”“当然不会。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The correct answer is 83.’ ‘Oh, yes, of course.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “正确的答案是83。”“噢﹐没错﹐当然是啦。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are saying ‘no’ to something
Sense.TRAN: 当然不行[没有]〔强调对某事的否认〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you been reading my email?’ ‘Of course not!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你一直在看我的电子邮件？”“当然没有！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you mind if I bring a friend?’ ‘No, of course not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我带个朋友来你会介意吗？”“当然不会。”

Sense.DEF: away from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got into his car and drove off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上了车﹐随即开车走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly they turned off and parked in a side road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然他们拐出去停在一条岔路上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once we were off the main freeway, the trip felt more like a vacation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一离开主高速公路﹐旅途的感觉就更像是度假了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her husband was off on a business trip somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫到什么地方出差去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you ready? Off we go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好了吗？ 我们走吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must be off now I must leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我必须走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were off to Italy leaving to go to Italy and wanted to make an early start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要去意大利﹐想早点出发。

Sense.DEF: not on something, or removed from something
Sense.TRAN: 不在〔某物〕上面(的)﹔从〔某物〕上移开(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep off the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勿踩草坪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he leaned forward, his hat fell off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俯身时帽子掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had taken the mirror off the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把镜子从墙上取下来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take your coat off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的外衣脱下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was trying to scrape the mud off my boots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想办法把靴子上的泥刮掉。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘off of’ something. Say 而要说 off something: She fell off her chair (NOT不说off of her chair). 她从椅子上摔下来了。

Sense.DEF: out of a bus, train, plane etc
Sense.TRAN: 下〔公共汽车﹑火车﹑飞机等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get off at the next stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将在下一站下车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone got off the train at Winnipeg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的人都在温尼伯下火车。

Sense.DEF: a machine, piece of equipment etc that is off is not working or operating
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备等〕不在工作﹐不在运转﹐停止
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will someone switch the radio off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure all the lights are off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要把所有的灯都关掉。

Sense.DEF: not at work, school etc because you are ill or on holiday
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生病或度假〕不工作﹔不上学﹔休息
Sense.EXAMPLE: My secretary’s been off with flu for the past week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的秘书过去一周得了流感没来上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clare had to stay off school because her mother was ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔因为妈妈病了不能去上学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look tired. Why don’t you take tomorrow off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去很疲惫﹐为什么明天不休息一天呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He needs more time off duty for relaxation and rest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他需要更多的时间放松休息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Going to work today, mum?’ ‘No. It’s my day off today.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈﹐你今天去上班吗？”“不﹐今天我休息。”

Sense.DEF: from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: My brother once borrowed some money off him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟曾经从他那里借过钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got this necklace off a woman outside the market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条项链我是从市场外面的一个女人那里买的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how far away something is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We could see the cliffs of Shetland about two miles off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以看见大约两英里外设得兰的悬崖峭壁。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kara’s home was a long way off across the sea.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉的家在大海那一边很远的地方。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how much time there is between now and a future event
Subsense.EXAMPLE: With the exams now only a week off, I had to study hard.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在离考试只有一个星期了﹐我得努力学习。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Christmas seemed a long way off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节似乎还很远。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how likely or unlikely something is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Any kind of peace agreement still seems a long way off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 达成任何一种和平协议似乎仍然是遥不可及的事。

Subsense.DEF: only a short distance away from a place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Our hotel was just off the main street.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的宾馆离大街很近。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an island off the coast of France
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 靠近法国海岸的一座岛

Subsense.DEF: connected to a particular room, area, road etc
Subsense.TRAN: 与〔某房间﹑地区﹑道路等〕相连接(的)
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s a small bathroom off the main bedroom.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个小浴室和主卧室相连。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a narrow street leading off the corner of the square
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和广场一角相连的狭窄街道

Sense.DEF: used to say that a price is reduced by a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you buy more than ten, they knock 10% off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你买十个以上﹐他们就打九折。

Sense.DEF: if an event which has been arranged is off, it will not now take place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wedding’s off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼取消了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The race may have to be called off if the bad weather continues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果恶劣天气持续﹐比赛可能要取消。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is off is rude or is not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked out before the end of your lecture, which I thought was a bit off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的讲座还未结束她就走出去了﹐我认为这有点失礼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, I know when someone’s being off with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听着﹐有人对我无礼时我是知道的。

Sense.DEF: used to say how much of something someone has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The school’s fairly well off for books these days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校现在有相当多的图书。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How are you off for sports equipment? do you have enough?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的体育运动装备够不够？

Sense.DEF: for short periods but not regularly, over a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 断断续续地﹐时有时无地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been going out together for five years, off and on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们断断续续交往了五年。

Sense.DEF: no longer wanting or liking something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Toby’s been off his food for a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托比已有几天不想吃东西了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I used to enjoy tennis, but I’ve gone off it a bit now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前很喜欢打网球﹐但现在有点不大感兴趣了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seems to have gone off Mark since he’s grown a beard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从马克留了胡子﹐她就好像不喜欢他了。

Sense.DEF: no longer taking something such as a drug or medicine
Sense.EXAMPLE: The operation was a success, and she’s off the morphine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术很成功﹐她已不再需要注射吗啡了。

Subsense.DEF: food that is off is no longer fresh enough to eat
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ugh! The milk’s off.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唷﹐这牛奶坏了！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you think the meat’s gone off?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得这肉变质了吗？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a particular kind of food is not available in a restaurant although it is on the menu
Subsense.TRAN: 〔餐厅里菜单上的某道菜〕没有了﹐不供应
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, the fish pie is off today, sir.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐先生﹐今天没有鱼肉馅饼。

Sense.DEF: not as good as usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales figures for last year were a little off compared with those of the previous year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和前一年相比﹐去年的销售额略有下降。

Sense.DEF: not correct or not right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our calculations were off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们计算错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guess again. You’re way off very far from being correct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再猜猜﹐你差得太远了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: off the top of your head

Sense.DEF: a day, week etc when you are not doing something as well as you usually do
Sense.TRAN: 发挥不正常[失水准]的一天/一个星期等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brian never usually loses his temper – he must be having an off day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布赖恩一般从不发火——今天他肯定是心情不好。

Sense.DEF: a period or season which is not as busy as other times of the year
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the off season, there’s hardly anyone staying at the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡季的时候﹐宾馆里几乎没什么人住。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a pair of things such as wheels on a car, to mean the one on the right
Sense.TRAN: 〔车轮等成对的物体之中〕右边的﹐右侧的

Sense.DEF: the start of a race or a journey
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horses were in line, ready for the off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赛马已站成一排﹐准备出闸。

Sense.DEF: from the beginning of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was doubtful about the interview from the off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从一开始就对面谈心存疑虑。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guy who did this ought to be offed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干这事的人该杀。

Sense.DEF: not being broadcast on the radio or television at the present moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-air television recordings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非直播的电视录像

Sense.DEF: the inside parts of an animal, for example the heart, liver, and kidneys used as food
Sense.TRAN: 〔用作食物的〕动物内脏﹐下水﹐杂碎

Sense.DEF: in an unsteady position and likely to fall

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sudden movement of the ship knocked them both off balance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船突然移动﹐使得他俩都失去了平衡。

Sense.DEF: to surprise or shock someone because they are not prepared for something that happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was thrown off-balance by some of the more difficult questions I was asked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被问到几个较难的问题﹐一时措手不及。

Sense.DEF: unusual and not what people normally expect, especially in an interesting way
Sense.TRAN: 不寻常的﹐另类的﹔〔尤指〕不落俗套的
Sense.EXAMPLE: offbeat humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另类的幽默
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a little offbeat, but she’s a wonderful actress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有点另类﹐却是个出色的演员。

Sense.DEF: not exactly in the centre of something
Sense.TRAN: 偏离中心的﹐中心错位的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Place the photo slightly off-centre, so that there is more space on the page.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把照片放在稍稍偏离中心的位置﹐这样页面上的空间就更多了。

Sense.DEF: if you do something on the off-chance that something will happen, you do it hoping that it will happen although it is unlikely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just came to see you on the off-chance that Pippa might be here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来看你只是抱着一丝希望皮帕或许会在这儿。

Sense.DEF: sexually offensive
Sense.TRAN: 下流的﹐有伤风化的﹐猥亵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-color jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下流玩笑

Sense.DEF: slightly ill
Sense.TRAN: 稍有不适的﹐脸色不好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been feeling a bit off-colour lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来她一直感到身体有点不舒服。

Sense.DEF: a piece of wood, paper etc that is left after the main piece has been cut and removed
if someone such as a policeman, nurse, or soldier is off-duty, they are not working
Sense.EXAMPLE: an off-duty guard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不当班的警卫
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shall be off-duty on Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四我不上班。

Sense.DEF: an illegal action or a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sexual offences against children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对儿童的性犯罪

Sense.DEF: when you offend or upset someone by something you do or say

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The problem was how to say ‘no’ to her without causing offence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题是怎样拒绝她而又不得罪她。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be upset by what he said; he meant no offence did not intend to offend anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要为他的话而生气﹐他并没有冒犯谁的意思。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you hope that what you are going to say or do will not offend them
Sense.TRAN: 没有冒犯的意思﹐请别见怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: No offense, but this cheese tastes like rubber.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请别见怪﹐这奶酪吃起来像是嚼橡胶。

Sense.DEF: to feel offended because of something someone says or does
Sense.TRAN: 对(某事)生气﹐因(某事)见怪
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he took offence at my lack of enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他因为我缺乏热情而不开心了。

Sense.DEF: the act of attacking
Sense.EXAMPLE: the weapon of offence used during the attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击时使用的凶器

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something that is against the law
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had committed the offence of dangerous driving.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他犯了危险驾驶罪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In that year, 367 people were charged with terrorist offences.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那年有367人被控犯有恐怖袭击罪行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say officially that they are guilty

Collocate.COLLOC: it is an offence to do sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is an offence to carry a weapon in a public place.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在公共场所携带武器是违法的。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 可处以某种惩罚的罪行
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Possession of the drug is an offence punishable by up to one year’s imprisonment.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 持有毒品属犯罪行为﹐最高可判刑一年。

Collocate.COLLOC: make sth an offence/make it an offence to do sth

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is a criminal offence to sell alcohol to someone under the age of 18.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 向未满18岁者售酒构成刑事犯罪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: serious offences such as murder or armed robbery
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谋杀或持械抢劫之类的重罪

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The police cautioned him for a minor offence.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方对他的轻微违法行为作出了警告。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Because it was a first offence, she was not sent to prison.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为是初犯﹐她没有被判坐牢。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is not as serious as another offence
a very serious offence against the law of the US, rather than against a state’s law

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 违章行驶/违法停车/交通违法行为
性犯罪/涉毒犯罪/恐怖犯罪等

Sense.DEF: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Liddy was offended by such a personal question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提这样私人的问题让利迪很生气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The careful language is designed not to offend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

Sense.DEF: to seem bad or unacceptable to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: A solution must be found that doesn’t offend too many people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须找到一个不会冒犯太多人的解决办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of these new buildings really offend the eye look very ugly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新大楼中有一些实在有碍观瞻。

Sense.DEF: to commit a crime or crimes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the young men here are likely to offend again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的年轻人中有许多很可能会再次犯罪。

Sense.DEF: to be against people’s feelings of what is morally acceptable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Broadcasters have a responsibility not to offend against good taste and decency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 节目主持人有责任使自己的行为举止不与高雅趣味和得体言行相悖。

Sense.DEF: someone who is offended is angry and upset by someone’s behaviour or remarks

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stella was beginning to feel a little offended.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯特拉开始感到有点愤愤然。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew that Piers would be deeply offended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早知道皮尔斯会很恼火的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get very offended when he talks to me like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那样和我说话让我非常反感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: radio listeners who are easily offended
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动辄不满的电台听众

Sense.DEF: someone who is guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: Community punishment is used for less serious offenders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区服务刑被用来处罚犯罪情节较轻者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At 16, Scott was already a persistent offender someone who has been caught several times for committing crimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯科特16岁时就已经是个惯犯了。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is the cause of something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: Among causes of air pollution, car exhaust fumes may be the worst offender.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在造成空气污染的诸多因素中﹐汽车尾气可能是罪魁祸首。

Sense.DEF: the thing that is causing a problem – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 引起问题的…﹐造成不便的…〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to have the offending tooth removed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定把这颗讨厌的牙拔掉。

Sense.DEF: relating to or guilty of an illegal offence
Sense.EXAMPLE: offending behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违法行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: the offending vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违章车辆

Sense.DEF: making people feel angry or insulted
Sense.TRAN: 令人不快的﹐惹人生气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his offending remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那伤人的话

Sense.DEF: the usual American spelling of offence
the part of a game such as American football, which is concerned with getting points and winning, or the group of players who do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔美式橄榄球等比赛中的〕进攻﹐攻势﹔进攻队员﹐锋线队员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Bears are going to have to work on their offense this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季熊队必须要加强进攻了。

Sense.DEF: very rude or insulting and likely to upset people
Sense.TRAN: 无礼的﹐冒犯的﹐令人恼火的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found her remarks deeply offensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她的话令人非常恼火。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: crude jokes that are offensive to women
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冒犯女士的粗鄙笑话

Sense.EXAMPLE: offensive behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无礼的行为

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: an offensive smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人讨厌的气味

Sense.DEF: for attacking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jan was convicted of possessing an offensive weapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简因为持有攻击性武器而被定罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The troops took up offensive positions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部队准备发起进攻。

Sense.DEF: relating to getting points and winning a game, rather than stopping the other team from getting points
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Jets’ offensive strategy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷气机队的进攻策略

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 里克的话里带有很具冒犯性的种族主义意味。

Sense.DEF: a planned military attack involving large forces over a long period
Sense.EXAMPLE: a military offensive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事进攻
Sense.EXAMPLE: A major offensive was launched on August 22.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月22日发起了一场大规模的攻势。

Sense.DEF: to start attacking or criticizing someone before they start attacking or criticizing you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Republicans went on the offensive over soaring gasoline prices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党在汽油价格暴涨的问题上采取了先发制人的态度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The international coalition was ready to take the offensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国际联盟准备先发制人。

Sense.DEF: a planned set of actions intended to influence a lot of people
to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I offer you something to drink?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They offered him a very good job, but he turned it down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给他提供了一份很好的工作﹐但他拒绝了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maureen lit a cigarette and offered one to Lucy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫琳点了一支香烟﹐又递了一支给露西。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The drama school offers places to students who can show talent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所戏剧学校为能展现才华的学生提供学习的机会。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are willing to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t need any help, but it was nice of you to offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不需要任何帮助﹐但是我谢谢你的好意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My dad has offered to pick us up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸爸表示愿意开车来接我们。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The newspaper offered to apologise for the article.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报社表示愿意为那篇文章道歉。

Sense.DEF: to provide something that people need or want

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your doctor should be able to offer advice on diet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的医生应该能够在饮食方面提出建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course offers the opportunity to specialize in the final year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程提供最后一年进行专门研究的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A number of groups offer their services free of charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些团体免费提供服务。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Centre offers a wide range of sports facilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该中心提供各式各样的体育运动设施。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I did what I could to offer comfort to the family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽自己所能为家人提供舒适的生活。

Sense.DEF: to have qualities, opportunities etc that people are likely to want or enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Canada has much to offer in terms of location and climate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从地理位置和气候方面来说﹐加拿大可提供许多有利条件。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt he had nothing to offer her that she wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己给不了她想要的。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are willing to pay a particular amount of money for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve offered us £75,000 for the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向我们出价7.5万英镑买这幢房子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are offering a reward for any information.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方正在悬赏征求线索。

Sense.DEF: to pray to God or give something to God
if an opportunity to do something offers itself, it becomes available to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll raise the subject when a suitable occasion offers itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等有合适的机会﹐我会把这件事提出来的。

Sense.DEF: to hold out your hand in order to shake hands with someone
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something
Sense.TRAN: 〔愿为某人做某事或愿给某人某物的〕提议﹔提供

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His offer to resign will be accepted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的辞职请求会被接受。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you are willing to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you accept their offer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会接受他们的开价吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: offer a particular amount of money for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within 20 minutes they were prepared to make us an offer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不出20分钟﹐他们就准备好给我们一个价格了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company made an offer of $5 million for the site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司出价500万美元购买这个地块。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll be interested if Newcastle make me a good offer,’ said the 25-year-old striker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “如果纽卡斯尔队出个好价钱给我的话﹐那我会有兴趣的。”这名25岁的前锋说。

GramExa.GLOSS: be ready to consider people’s offers and lower your original price
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re asking £2,500, but we’re open to offers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要价2,500英镑﹐但是可以商议。

Sense.DEF: a reduction of the price of something in a shop for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: All special offers advertised in this brochure are subject to availability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小册子上宣传的所有特价商品售完即止。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a free offer on orders over £45.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 订购金额超过45英镑可获得一件免费赠品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: To take advantage of this offer buy something at the reduced price, complete the attached forms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 填写所附表格﹐即可享受优惠价格。

Subsense.DEF: available to be bought, chosen, or used
Subsense.TRAN: 可买到的﹐供使用的﹐提供的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Activities on offer include sailing, rowing, and canoeing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供的活动项目包括帆船﹑划艇和独木舟。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was impressed with the designs on offer.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对所提供的设计印象深刻。

Subsense.DEF: for sale for a short time at a cheaper price than usual
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Lean minced beef is on offer this week.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周特价出售瘦牛肉糜。

Sense.DEF: if a house that is for sale is under offer, someone has offered to buy it for a particular price

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say yes to it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are you going to accept their offer?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会接受他们的报价吗？

Collocate.COLLOC: take up an offer/take sb up on their offer
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: accept someone’s offer
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I might take him up on his offer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我会接受他的提议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say no to it
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She declined the offer of a lift.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝了让她搭车的好意。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He received the offer of a place at Cambridge University.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被剑桥大学录取。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They suddenly withdrew their offer at the last minute.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在最后一刻突然撤回聘用通知。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I still did not have a formal job offer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我依然没有获得任何正式的工作机会。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are grateful for your kind offer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们十分感谢你的好意。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 提供帮助/给予支持/表示友谊等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Any offers of help would be appreciated.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于任何帮助﹐我们都不胜感激。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: I am grateful for it – used especially when politely refusing someone’s offer
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 感谢你的好意〔尤用于婉拒他人帮助〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I appreciate your offer, but I don’t need any help.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你的好意﹐不过我不需要帮忙。

Sense.DEF: a book, play, piece of music etc that someone has written recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: the latest offering from Nancy Griffith
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希•格里菲思的最新作品

Sense.DEF: something that is given to God
something that is given as a present to please someone
the money people give during a religious ceremony in church
the offering of the bread and wine to God at a Christian church service
to surprise someone by happening when they are not expecting something or prepared for it
Sense.TRAN: 使某人措手不及﹐让某人猝不及防
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sudden snow storm caught us all off-guard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突如其来的暴风雪让我们全都猝不及防。

Sense.DEF: not very friendly towards someone when you are talking to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said you were a bit offhand with her this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说你今天下午对她有点敷衍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an offhand tone of voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简慢的语调

Sense.DEF: said or done without thinking or planning
Sense.EXAMPLE: an offhand remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱口而出的话

Sense.DEF: immediately, without time to think about it or find out about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t remember offhand where the file is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一时想不起这份文件放在哪里了。

Sense.DEF: a building that belongs to a company or organization, with rooms where people can work at desks
Sense.EXAMPLE: The department occupies an office just a mile from the White House.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该部门就在离白宫一英里远的地方有个办公楼。

GramExa.GLOSS: the most important office
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The head office is in Edinburgh.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总部在爱丁堡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you go to the office the office where you work today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天你去办公室了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Have a nice day at the office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿你今天上班愉快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The agency has a network of regional offices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家机构在各地都有办事处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Office staff need well-designed desks and chairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室人员需要设计精良的桌椅。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the increased demand for office space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对办公室空间日益增长的需求

Sense.DEF: a room where someone has a desk and works, on their own or with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the manager’s office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理办公室
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, Ann’s not in her office right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐安现在不在办公室里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan shares an office with Lisa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹和莉萨共用一间办公室。

Subsense.DEF: the time between about 9:00 in the morning and 5:00 in the afternoon, when people in offices are working
Subsense.TRAN: 办公时间〔约为上午9点至下午5点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Can you phone again during office hours?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在办公时间内再打电话来好吗？

Subsense.DEF: the time during the day or week when students can meet with their teacher in the teacher’s office
Subsense.TRAN: 〔教师在办公室接待学生的〕接待时间﹐会面时间
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Professor Lee’s office hours are from two to four on Mondays and Thursdays.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李教授的接待时间是每周一和周四的下午2点到4点。

Sense.DEF: an important job or position with power, especially in government
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政府中拥有权力的〕重要职位
Sense.EXAMPLE: the office of President
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统职位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was celebrating ten years in office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在庆祝自己任职十年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A provisional military government took office started in an important job or position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个临时军政府开始执政。

GramExa.GLOSS: have a particular important job or position
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Trujillo held office as finance minister.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特鲁希略担任财政部长一职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a five year term of office period of time working in an important job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年的任期

Sense.DEF: used in the names of some government departments
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于某些政府部门的名称中〕部﹐局﹐处
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Foreign Office
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交部
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Office of the District Attorney
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方检察院

Sense.DEF: a room or building where people go to ask for information, buy tickets etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the tourist office
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游信息询问处

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a lost property office?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有没有失物招领处？

Sense.DEF: the place where a doctor or dentist examines or treats people

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s good offices/the good offices of sb
Sense.DEF: help given by someone who has authority or can influence people

GramExa.PROPFORM: through the good offices of sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to obtain a visa through the good offices of a friend in the Service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在政府部门一位朋友的大力帮助下﹐我获得了签证。

PIC.HEADING: OFFICE 办公室
PIC.PICCONTENT: filing cabinet BrE【英】/file cabinet AmE【美】文件柜；photocopier 复印机；flip chart 翻页挂图；desk lamp 台灯；email 电子邮件；printer 打印机；scanner 扫描仪；hard drive 硬盘；computer screen 计算机屏幕；mouse 鼠标；mouse mat BrE【英】/mouse pad AmE【美】鼠标垫；briefcase 公文包；calculator 计算器；keyboard 键盘；stapler 订书机；in tray BrE【英】/inbox AmE【美】收件盘；out tray BrE【英】/outbox AmE【美】发件盘；drawer 抽屉；folder 文件夹；telephone 电话机；pencil 铅笔；swivel chair 转椅；mobile phone BrE【英】/cellular phone AmE【美】手机；pen 笔；highlighter 荧光笔；paperclips 回形针；clipboard 带夹书写板；desk 办公桌；paper 纸；binder 活页夹

Sense.DEF: a boy or young man who does simple jobs in an office
a large building with many offices in it, especially ones that belong to different companies
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为不同公司合用的〕办公大楼

Sense.DEF: someone who has an official position, especially in the government
Sense.TRAN: 政府官员﹐任公职者﹐公务员

Head.HWD: Office Of Public Sector Information, the

Sense.DEF: the organization that is responsible for running Her Majesty’s Stationery Office (HMSO) and other public information services in the UK. It is part of The National Archives.
a party, especially one held before Christmas, in the office of a company, government department etc for the people who work there
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指圣诞节前夕在办公室为员工举办的〕办公室派聚会﹐联欢会

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a position of authority in the army, navy etc

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 陆军/海军/军队等的军官

Sense.EXAMPLE: a commanding officer of the SAS
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国空军特种部队的一名指挥官

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a position in an organization or the government
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构的〕高级职员﹔〔政府的〕官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: a prison officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 典狱官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chief medical officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医务总监
Sense.EXAMPLE: a former Cabinet officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前内阁官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: the public information officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共信息官员

Sense.DEF: a member of the police
Sense.EXAMPLE: a request for 400 more officers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再增加400名警官的要求

Sense.DEF: a title for a policeman or policewoman
Sense.TRAN: 警官〔对男女警察的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officer Murdoch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默多克警官

Sense.DEF: someone who is in a position of authority in an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government official
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: senior administration officials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级行政人员

Sense.DEF: approved of or done by someone in authority, especially the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: an official investigation into the causes of the explosion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对此次爆炸事件原因的官方调查
Sense.EXAMPLE: the official policy on education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方的教育政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: official statistics about illegal drug use
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法使用毒品的官方统计数据
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will have to get official permission first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须先得到正式许可。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally the letter of appointment came, making it all official.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任命书终于来了﹐这样一切都名正言顺了。

Sense.DEF: relating to or done as part of an important job or position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President was leaving for a four-day official tour of Mexico.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统即将前往墨西哥﹐进行为期四天的正式访问。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Queen’s performance of official duties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王对公职的履行
Sense.EXAMPLE: They dined in an official capacity with other European leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以官方身份和其他欧洲国家领导人一起用餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Lord Mayor’s official residence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市长大人的官邸

Sense.DEF: an official explanation, account etc is one that is given formally and publicly, but may not be true
Sense.TRAN: 公布的﹐据官方的﹐公开宣称的〔但可能并非事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many doubted the official version of events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人怀疑官方对事件的说法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official line what is said publicly by people in authority was that the troops were there to protect the King.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方的说法是军队在那里是为了保护国王。

Sense.DEF: chosen to represent someone or an organization, or do something for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s official logo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的正式标识
Sense.EXAMPLE: the official representative from the American administration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府的官方代表

Sense.DEF: an official event is a formal public event
Sense.EXAMPLE: The official opening of the institute was in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个机构正式成立于5月份。

Sense.DEF: government departments or the people who work in them – used when you think they are not helpful
a way of talking or writing used by government officials, that is unnecessarily difficult to understand
publicly or formally
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new church was officially opened on July 5th.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新教堂于7月5日正式启用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing has yet been officially announced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都还没有正式宣布。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme was officially launched in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该计划是在5月份正式实施的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has the company officially confirmed the appointment?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司正式证实这项任命了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the number of officially recognized political parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方认可的政党数量

Sense.DEF: according to what someone says publicly, even though this may not be true
Sense.TRAN: 根据官方的说法﹐据公布〔尽管不一定是事实〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officially, the talks never took place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据官方的说法﹐会谈根本没有进行。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to take care of the financial affairs of a company or a person that is bankrupt
Sense.TRAN: 〔负责处理公司或私人破产事务的〕官方接管人﹐破产管理人

Sense.DEF: to perform official duties, especially at a religious ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 行使职责﹔〔尤指〕主持宗教仪式

Sense.DEF: too eager to tell people what to do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 爱发号施令的﹐好管闲事的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an officious traffic warden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名爱发号施令的交通督导员

Sense.DEF: to be likely to happen soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Big changes were in the offing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨变即将发生。

Sense.DEF: music that is off-key sounds unpleasant because it is played slightly above or below the correct pitch
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band sounded slightly off-key.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队的演奏听起来稍稍走调了。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼上有人正在不着调地唱着歌。

Sense.DEF: not completely straight or correctly balanced
Sense.TRAN: 不完全笔直的﹔不完全平衡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paintings were slightly off-kilter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画有点挂歪了。

Sense.DEF: unusual in a strange or interesting way
Sense.EXAMPLE: her off-kilter sense of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那奇特的幽默感

Sense.DEF: a shop that sells wine, beer, and other alcoholic drinks, in bottles or cans
Sense.TRAN: 〔出售瓶装或罐装含酒精饮料的〕外卖酒店

Subsense.DEF: if a place is off limits, you are not allowed to go there

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Footpaths are, of course, off limits to bikers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人行道当然不允许骑车。

Subsense.DEF: if a subject is off limits, you are not allowed to talk about it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Unlike most group discussions, nothing was off limits.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 话题没有限制﹐这和大多数小组讨论不一样。

Sense.DEF: with your computer not connected to the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: I work offline most of the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一天里大多数时候都在未联网的状态下工作。

Sense.DEF: if computer equipment is off­line, it is not directly connected to the computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: The printer was offline all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打印机一上午都处于脱机状态。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of something that you do not want by giving it or selling it to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过送人或出售来〕清除〔不需要之物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dealer had offloaded some of the shares onto a willing client.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票经纪人把其中一部分股票脱手给了一名愿意接盘的客户。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about your worries etc in order to make yourself feel better
Sense.TRAN: 〔为减轻心理负担而〕倾诉忧虑/情感/难题等

Sense.DEF: to take something off a truck or ship
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men offloaded their cargo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人卸下了他们的货物。

Sense.DEF: a politician who is off-message says things that are different from the ideas of the political party they belong to
Sense.TRAN: 与所属党派的政治观点不一致(的)﹐偏离所属党派的既定思想(的)

Sense.DEF: off-peak hours or periods are times that are less busy because fewer people want to do or use something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Telephone charges are lower during off-peak periods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非高峰时段电话收费要低一些。

Sense.DEF: off-peak travel, electricity etc is cheaper because it is done or used at less busy times
Sense.TRAN: 〔旅行的〕淡季的﹔〔用电收费〕非高峰时段的

Sense.DEF: not on the usual ski slopes
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-piste skiing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 道外滑雪

Sense.DEF: an article from a magazine that is printed and sold separately
Sense.TRAN: 〔杂志中的文章的〕单行本﹐选印本

Sense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour or the appearance of something is off-putting, you do not like it or you think it is unattractive
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人的举止或某物的外观〕令人气恼的﹔令人讨厌的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some women found the competitive style of the discussions off-putting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些女性觉得这种互不相让的讨论方式令人反感。

Sense.DEF: a road for driving off a freeway
Sense.TRAN: 〔高速公路的〕驶出坡道﹐驶出匝道

Sense.DEF: designed to be used on rough ground as well as on roads
Sense.EXAMPLE: an off-road vehicle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越野车

Sense.DEF: going over rough ground
Sense.TRAN: 越野的﹐在粗糙不平的地面上行驶的
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-road cycling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越野自行车运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-road tracks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越野赛道

Sense.DEF: when a film actor is not acting
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影演员〕在银幕外﹐在私人生活中
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s he like off-screen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在银幕外是什么样子？

Subsense.DEF: the time of year when not many people are taking holidays

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most hotels are closed in the off-season.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数宾馆在淡季时都歇业。

Subsense.DEF: the time of year when a sport is not usually played

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Take advantage of our special off-season fares.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 别错过我们的淡季特惠价格。

Sense.DEF: if the cost or amount of something offsets another cost or amount, the two things have an opposite effect so that the situation remains the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cuts in food prices will be offset by direct payments to farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品降价将通过直接付款给农民的方式进行补偿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可以用旅费抵税。

Sense.DEF: to make something look better by being close to it and different
Sense.EXAMPLE: His blonde hair offset a deep tan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满头的金发衬出了他黝黑的皮肤。

Sense.DEF: relating to a method of printing in which ink is put onto rollers and the paper then passes between the rollers
a type of mortgage given by banks, in which the money someone has in their bank account is taken away from the amount they owe, reducing the total amount of interest they have to pay
Sense.TRAN: 抵销抵押﹐对冲抵押〔银行提供的一种抵押贷款方式﹐即把某人存在银行账户内的款额拿来对冲﹐以减少应付的贷款利息总额〕

Sense.DEF: something such as an organization which has developed from a larger or earlier one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company was originally an offshoot of Bell Telephones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司原本是贝尔电话公司的一家分支机构。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the Mafia and its offshoots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑手党组织及其分支

Sense.DEF: a new stem or branch on a plant
in or under the sea and not far from the coast
Sense.EXAMPLE: offshore oil fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近海油田
Sense.EXAMPLE: an offshore island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近海岛屿

Sense.DEF: banks etc that are based abroad in a country where you pay less tax than in your home country
Sense.TRAN: 境外[海外]的银行/公司/投资等
Sense.EXAMPLE: offshore financial centres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设在境外的金融中心

Sense.DEF: a wind etc that is blowing or moving away from the land
in a position, usually ahead of the ball, where you are not allowed to play the ball in sports such as soccer and hockey
the side of a car that is nearest to the middle of the road when you are driving it
happening away from a particular place, especially a place of work
Sense.TRAN: 厂外(的)﹐工作场所之外(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: the off-site disposal of harmful waste
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有害废弃物的厂外处置
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small team worked off-site on the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小组在场外实施该项目。

Sense.DEF: someone’s child or children – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人的〕子女﹔子孙﹔后代〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young mother trying to control her offspring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

Sense.DEF: an animal’s baby or babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lion and its offspring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头狮子和它的幼崽

Sense.DEF: just behind or to the side of a stage in a theatre, where the people watching a play cannot see
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud crash offstage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后台传来一声很响的碰撞声。

Sense.DEF: when an actor is not acting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Offstage, Peter seemed a shy sort of person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现实生活中的彼得看起来是个腼腆的人。

Sense.DEF: places for parking that are not on public streets
Sense.TRAN: 不在主要街道的停车处

Sense.DEF: an off-the-cuff remark, reply etc is one that you make without thinking about it first
Sense.TRAN: 未经准备的﹐当场的﹐即席的

Sense.DEF: off-the-peg clothes are made in standard sizes, not made especially to fit one person

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was only a cheap suit, bought off-the-peg.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不过是一套便宜的西服﹐是买现成的。

Sense.DEF: an off-the-record remark is unofficial and is not supposed to be made public
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Prime Minister’s remarks were strictly off the record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相的讲话严禁发表。

Sense.DEF: already made and available in shops rather than being designed especially for a customer
Sense.EXAMPLE: off-the-shelf database software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现成的数据库软件

Sense.DEF: very strange or unusual, often in an amusing way
Sense.EXAMPLE: an off-the-wall concept
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀奇古怪的观念

Sense.DEF: away from a place where horses race
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few states allow offtrack betting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有几个州允许场外赛马赌博。

Sense.DEF: a white colour that has some yellow or grey in it

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件米黄色的女式衬衫

Sense.DEF: a year when something is not as successful as usual

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an off-year for car sales
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车滞销的一年

Sense.DEF: a year in which no national political elections happen
often

GramExa.EXAMPLE: oft-repeated advice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再三重复的忠告

Sense.DEF: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: She often works at the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她周末经常要上班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果洗头过勤﹐头发会变得干枯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How often do you see your parents?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你隔多久去看你父母？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I quite often go to Paris on business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常去巴黎出差。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough a lot of times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗宾是个难管的孩子﹐你自己也常常这么说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not often that a government minister will admit to being wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府部长承认错误不是常事。

Sense.DEF: if something happens often, it happens in many situations or cases
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s often difficult to translate poetry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诗歌通常很难翻译。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Very often children who behave badly at school have problems at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在学校里不守规矩的儿童往往在家里也有问题。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something sad, disappointing, or annoying happens too much
Sense.TRAN: 有太多时候﹐太过频繁〔表示坏事发生次数太多〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All too often doctors are too busy to explain the treatment to their patients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有太多时候﹐医生忙得没时间对病人解释治疗方法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This type of accident happens only too often.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这类事故太多了。

Sense.DEF: sometimes
Sense.EXAMPLE: An inspector comes round every so often to check the safety equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔有检查员来检查安全设备。

Sense.DEF: usually
Sense.EXAMPLE: More often than not the train is late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这趟火车常常晚点。

Sense.DEF: often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oftentimes I have to wait more than 20 minutes for a bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我经常得花二十多分钟才等到一辆公共汽车。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone in a way that shows you think they are sexually attractive – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t like the way he was ogling me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢他色迷迷地看着我的样子。

Sense.DEF: the message that you record on your telephone and that people will hear if they telephone you and you do not answer the call
Sense.TRAN: 预录留言﹐电话留言〔预录在电话中﹐来电者可以听到的留言〕

Sense.DEF: an examination in a particular subject which children take in schools in Scotland, usually at the age of 16
Sense.TRAN: 普通等级考试﹐O级考试〔苏格兰学校对某一特定科目的考试﹐考生年龄一般在16岁〕

Sense.DEF: a large imaginary person in children’s stories who eats people
someone who seems cruel and frightening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father sounded like a real ogre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲的口气听上去像个十足的恶魔。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to get someone’s attention or continue what you are saying
Sense.TRAN: 噢﹐嘿﹐嗨〔用于引起别人的注意或表示想继续说下去〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, look, I think that’s Harry over there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐你看﹐我想那边那个人是哈里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Milk, cereal, juice – oh, and put lettuce on the list too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶﹑麦片﹑果汁——噢﹐把生菜也列到清单上。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving an answer to a question
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you met his wife?’ ‘Oh, yes, I know her quite well.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你见过他妻子吗？”“噢﹐见过﹐我和她很熟。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I hope Jenny won’t be angry.’ ‘Oh, no, don’t worry about that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “但愿珍妮不会生气。”“噢﹐不会的﹐这不用担心。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you lend me ten pounds?’ ‘Oh, all right, but only until tomorrow.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能借给我十英镑吗？”“噢﹐没问题﹐但明天得还我。”

Sense.DEF: used to make a slight pause when you are speaking
Sense.TRAN: 嗯﹐噢〔说话时的短暂停顿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met your friend in town, oh, what’s her name?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在城里碰到你的朋友了﹐噢﹐她叫什么名字？

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are very happy, angry, disappointed etc about something
Sense.TRAN: 啊﹐哈﹐呀〔表示对某事感到很高兴﹑气愤﹑失望等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, aren’t those flowers gorgeous!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呀﹐那些花可真漂亮！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, how awful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐真糟糕！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, no! I’ve left my keys in the car!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐坏了﹐我把钥匙落在车里了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, good, you’re still here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐太好了﹐你还在这里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, God, I forgot all about it!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐天啊﹐我把它全给忘了！

Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, well, never mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐没关系。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are surprised about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Frances has left her husband, you know.’ ‘Oh, has she?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道﹐弗朗西丝跟她丈夫分开了。”“哦﹐真的吗？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, I didn’t know that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐那我可不知道啊。

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring electrical resistance
used to show that you are surprised or happy about something
Sense.TRAN: 啊﹐哈﹐呀〔表示对某事感到很意外或高兴〕
the abbreviation of 缩写=overhead projector高射投影仪

Sense.DEF: used to call someone or attract their attention in a way that is not very polite
Sense.TRAN: 嘿﹐喂﹐嗨〔用于呼喊某人或引起某人注意﹐不太礼貌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oi, you, come over here a minute!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐你﹐过来一下！

Sense.DEF: an offensive word for someone who you think is not intelligent or well educated, and who speaks or behaves in a rough way
the thick dark liquid from under the ground from which petrol is produced
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rise in the price of oil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格的上涨
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of protecting our oil supplies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保护我们石油供应的重要性
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oil refinery factory where oil is made purer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炼油厂

Sense.DEF: a smooth thick liquid that is used to make machines run easily or is burned to produce heat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Check the oil level in your car every week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每周都要检查一下汽车的机油量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The heating system runs on oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供暖系统使用燃油。

Sense.DEF: a smooth thick liquid made from plants or some animals, used especially in cooking or for making beauty products
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤用于烹调或生产美容用品的〕植物油﹐动物油
Sense.EXAMPLE: cooking oil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食用油

GramExa.EXAMPLE: coconut oil shampoo
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 椰子油洗发剂
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fish oils are supposed to help relieve arthritis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说鱼油有助于缓解关节炎的症状。

Sense.DEF: paints that contain oil
Sense.TRAN: 油漆﹔油性涂料﹔油画颜料

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I usually paint in oils using oils.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常画油画。

Sense.DEF: to put oil onto part of a machine or part of something that moves, to help it to move or work more smoothly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bicycle chain needs oiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自行车链条需要上油了。

Sense.DEF: to put oil or cream onto your skin, for example to protect you from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked Simon to oil my back for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让西蒙帮我在背上抹油。

Sense.DEF: to help something to be done in business or politics successfully and easily
made with oil as the main substance
Sense.TRAN: 油基的﹐以油为主原料的
Sense.EXAMPLE: oil-based paints
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油基油漆

Sense.DEF: oil-bearing rock contains oil
a metal container for oil with a long thin tube for pouring the oil out
special cloth that has had oil put on it so that it has a smooth surface and water cannot go through it
covered with a layer of oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: Place the sausages on an oiled baking tray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把香肠放在涂过油的烤盘上。

Sense.DEF: an area of land or sea under which there is oil
an oil-fired heating system burns oil to produce heat
an oil-free liquid, skin treatment etc contains no oil
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体﹑皮肤护理等〕无油的﹐不含油的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oil-free sun lotion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无油防晒霜

Sense.DEF: a lamp that works by burning oil
someone who owns an oil company or works in the oil industry
paint that contains oil
Sense.TRAN: 油漆﹔油性涂料﹔油画颜料

Sense.DEF: a picture painted with oil paint
the art of painting with oil paint
used humorously to say that someone is not very attractive
Sense.TRAN: 他/她相貌平平[算不得好看]〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a part of an engine that contains the supply of oil
an oil-rich country has plenty of natural oil under the ground from which it is able to make a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oil-rich Gulf States
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油蕴藏量丰富的海湾国家

Sense.DEF: a large structure on the land or in the sea, which has equipment for getting oil from under the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于陆上或海底采油的〕石油钻台[塔]﹔油井设备

Sense.DEF: special cloth that has had oil put on it so that it has a smooth surface and water cannot go through it
a coat and trousers made of oilskin and worn together
a coat made of oilskin
a large area of oil floating on the surface of the sea or a river
Sense.TRAN: 〔海上或河面上的〕大面积浮油

Sense.DEF: a large ship that carries oil
a hole that is dug in the ground so that oil can be taken out
covered with oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wiped his hands on an oily rag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一块油腻的抹布上擦了擦手。

Sense.DEF: similar to oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oily liquid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油状液体

Sense.DEF: oily hair or skin contains more natural oil than is usual or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shampoo for oily hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适用于油性头发的洗发液

Sense.DEF: oily food contains a lot of oil or fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: oily fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富含脂肪的鱼

Sense.DEF: someone who is oily is very polite, in a way that other people think is unpleasant and not sincere
Sense.TRAN: 圆滑的﹐油滑的﹐善于逢迎的

Sense.DEF: used to represent the sound that a pig makes
a soft cream that you rub into your skin, especially as a medical treatment
orange juice
used to show that you agree with something or give permission for someone to do something
Sense.TRAN: 行﹐可以〔用于表示同意某事或允许某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I take the car today?’ ‘Okay.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “今天我能用这辆车吗？”“行啊。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, if that’s what you prefer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以﹐如果你喜欢那样的话。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone if they agree with you or will give permission for you to do something
Sense.TRAN: 好吗﹐行吗〔用于征求别人的允许〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll see you at seven, OK?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我7点和你见面﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: used when you start talking about something new, or when you pause before continuing
Sense.TRAN: 好(了)〔用于转换话题或停顿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, let’s move on to the next point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐我们来谈下一个问题吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Okay, any questions so far?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐到这里为止有什么问题吗？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop arguing with you or criticizing you
Sense.TRAN: 好了﹐行了﹐得了〔用于叫别人不要再和你争吵或批评你〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, OK, so I made a mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐好了﹐算我弄错了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, I’m doing my best, okay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瞧﹐我正在尽力呢﹐行了吧？

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the word okay in spoken and written English. 单词okay在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。
This graph shows that the word okay is much more common in spoken English than in written English. 本图表显示﹐单词okay在英语口语中的使用频率远远高于书面语。

Sense.DEF: if you are OK, you are not ill, injured, or unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 没病(的)﹔安然无恙(的)﹔没有不开心(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you OK?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没事吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you feel OK now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你觉得好些了吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum’s doing OK now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈现在不错。

Sense.DEF: something that is OK is acceptable and will not cause any problems
Sense.TRAN: 可以(的)﹐不错(的)﹐可接受(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will half past eight be OK?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 8点半行不行？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does my hair look OK?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头发看上去行吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Sorry I’m late.’ ‘That’s OK.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “抱歉﹐我迟到了。”“没关系。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it OK if I leave my bags here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把包放在这里行吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yeah, the TV’s working OK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是的﹐电视机没问题。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is okay (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s okay for you to go home now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在可以回家了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you the rest tomorrow, if that’s OK with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你觉得可以﹐余下的钱我明天付给你。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: People usually avoid OK or okay in writing, and use more formal words such as acceptable or satisfactory.
F2NBox.TRAN: 人们通常避免在书面语中使用OK或okay﹐而用更为正式的词﹐如acceptable或satisfactory
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We have to make sure that the quality is acceptable.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须确保质量过硬 。

Sense.DEF: satisfactory but not extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was the film?’ ‘It was okay, but not brilliant.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “电影怎么样？”“还算可以﹐但谈不上很好。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I did okay in the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这次考试我考得还可以。

Sense.DEF: someone who is OK is nice, pleasant, etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve met Jim once, and he seems OK.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我见过吉姆一次﹐他看起来人不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an OK guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人不错。

Sense.DEF: to say officially that you will agree to something or allow it to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plans have been okayed, so let’s get started as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划已经获得批准﹐所以我们尽快开始吧。

Sense.DEF: to give or get permission to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get the OK from head office?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得到总部的批准了吗？

Sense.DEF: an African animal like a giraffe, but with a shorter neck

a corralan area surrounded by fences where animals can be kept in the town of Tombstone, Arizona. In 1881 it was the scene of a famous gunfight in which Wyatt Earp, his brothers, and Doc Holliday fought against a group of criminals called the Clanton gang. The story was made into a well-known film Gunfight at the OK Corral(1957), and this phrase is sometimes used humorously when talking about a fight involving several people.
Sense.TRAN: 奥凯畜栏〔美国亚利桑那州汤姆斯通镇一地﹐以1881年发生的一场激烈枪战而闻名﹔Gunfight at the OK Corral 有时用于戏谑﹐指涉及多人的混战〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was more like the gunfight at the OK Corral than a football game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这哪里是足球赛﹐简直就是一场混战。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with someone or give permission for some­one to do something
Sense.TRAN: 行﹐好〔表示同意某人或允许某人做某事〕

Sense.DEF: a green vegetable used in cooking, especially in Asia and the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 秋葵(荚)〔尤在亚洲和美国南部用于烹调的一种绿色蔬菜〕

Sense.DEF: something that is old has existed or been used for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 旧的﹐陈旧的﹐年代久远的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of old shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双旧鞋
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the houses around here are very old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有些房子年代已经很久远了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of our oldest traditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最古老的传统之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s getting old now, and things are starting to go wrong with it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车现在越来越旧﹐已经开始出毛病了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That story’s as old as the hills extremely old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个故事非常古老。

Subsense.DEF: someone who is old has lived for a very long time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an old man
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a home for old people
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养老院

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t run around like I used to – I must be getting old.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能像以前那样东奔西跑了——我一定是老了。

Subsense.DEF: people who are old
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the care of the old and sick
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对老人和病人的照料

Sense.DEF: used to talk about how long a person or thing has lived or existed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe you’re nearly forty years old!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法相信你都快40岁了！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a house that’s 300 years old
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有300年历史的房子

Sense.EXAMPLE: How old are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你多大年纪？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you older than Sally?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你比萨莉大吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re old enough to get your own breakfast now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在已经长大﹐可以自己弄早餐了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not coming skating. I’m too old for that now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不去玩溜冰﹐我现在太老玩不动了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a six-week-old baby
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 六周大的婴儿
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 500-year-old sword
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把有500年历史的剑

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb is old enough to know better
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you think someone should behave more sensibly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人已长大﹐应该明白事理

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb is old enough to be his/her/your mother/father
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone is too old to be having a sexual relationship with someone else
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人的年纪够当他的/她的/你的母亲/父亲了〔用于表示某人年龄过大﹐不适合成为性伴侣〕

Sense.DEF: your old house, job, girlfriend etc is one that you used to have
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met up with one of my old girlfriends at the weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末我和一位昔日的女友聚了聚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My old car was always breaking down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前的那辆车老是抛锚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That happened when we were still in the old house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件事发生时我们还住在老房子里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My old boss was awful!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原来的老板太差劲了！

GramExa.GLOSS: someone with whom you used to have a romantic relationship

Sense.DEF: old things are things that are familiar to you because you have seen them or experienced them many times before
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s good to get back into the old routine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真好﹐生活又恢复了原样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I enjoyed seeing all the old familiar faces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢看到所有那些熟悉的老面孔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He comes out with the same old excuses every time!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每次都找那些老掉牙的借口！

Sense.DEF: an old friend, enemy etc is someone you have known for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob’s an old friend of mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃是我的一位老朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old colleague
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老同事
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re old rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是老对手了。

Sense.DEF: times in the past

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the old days people used to fetch water from the pump.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从前﹐人们用抽水泵打水。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the good old days/the bad old days
Sense.DEF: an earlier time in your life, or in history, when things seemed better or worse than now
Sense.EXAMPLE: We like to chat about the good old days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们喜欢聊聊过去的好时光。

Sense.DEF: to feel or look better again after you have been ill or very unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 感觉/看上去恢复了原来的样子
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s good to see you looking more like your old self again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很高兴看到你又和以前一样了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it does not matter which thing, place etc you choose
Sense.TRAN: 随便哪个东西/地方/时间等都行
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, just wear any old thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐就随便穿一件吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phone any old time – I’m always here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便什么时候打电话来都行﹐我一直在这里。

Sense.DEF: in an untidy or careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The papers had been dumped on my desk any old how.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸乱七八糟地堆在我的书桌上。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone you like
Sense.TRAN: 可爱的/可怜的/傻乎乎的等某人〔说到自己喜欢的人时用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good old Keith!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可爱的老基思！
Sense.EXAMPLE: You poor old thing!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这可怜的家伙！

Sense.DEF: used to talk about something you enjoy
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a good old talk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们畅快地聊了一阵子。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone you like and admire
Sense.EXAMPLE: You old devil! You were planning this all along!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个捣蛋鬼！你一直在计划这事啊！

Sense.DEF: used to talk very rudely about someone you do not like
Sense.TRAN: 老糊涂/老混蛋/老太婆等〔用于粗鲁地谈论不喜欢之人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stupid old cow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这愚蠢的老泼妇

Sense.DEF: a group of people within an organization or club who do not like changes or new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构或俱乐部内的〕守旧派﹐保守派﹐保守分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll never manage to persuade the old guard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝对劝服不了这群老顽固。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of experience of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m an old hand at this game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玩这种把戏我很在行。

Sense.DEF: to look or behave like someone much older than you, especially because of difficulties in your life
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因经历过磨难而〕显得成熟﹐显得老成

Sense.DEF: if you do something for old times’ sake, you do it to remind yourself of a happy time in the past
Sense.TRAN: 看在往日的情分上﹐念及老交情

Sense.DEF: the country that you were born in, but that you no longer live in, used especially to mean Europe
Sense.TRAN: 〔移民等的〕祖国﹐故国〔尤指欧洲国家〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: an old head on young shoulders
Sense.DEF: a young person who seems to think and behave like an older person
to punish someone for something wrong that they did to you in the past
old-fashioned and believing in old ideas and customs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a doctor of the old school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老派的医生

Sense.DEF: a belief based on old ideas that are now considered to be untrue
Sense.TRAN: 无稽之谈﹔愚蠢的信仰﹔迷信

Sense.DEF: from a long time ago in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: the knights of old
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昔日的骑士

Sense.DEF: an early form of English, Icelandic etc

Exponent.DEF: having lived for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an old man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老人
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m too old to learn a new language.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我年纪太大﹐没法学一门新的语言了。

Exponent.DEF: a polite word for old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an elderly lady
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位年长女士
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a home for the elderly elderly people
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 养老院

Exponent.DEF: becoming old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an ageing rock star
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 年华逝去的摇滚歌星
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the problems of an ageing population
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口老龄化问题

Exponent.DEF: aged relatives are very old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: aged parents
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 年迈的父母
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had to look after her aged aunt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得照顾年迈的姑母。

Exponent.DEF: an older brother or sister. Elder sounds more formal than older.
Exponent.TRAN: 哥哥/姐姐〔elder听起来比older正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have two elder brothers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有两个哥哥。

Exponent.DEF: very old – used humorously
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be 30 next year – it sounds really ancient!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年我就30岁了——听上去好老哦！

Exponent.DEF: to be fairly old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s 60 now, so he’s getting on a bit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在60岁﹐有点上年纪了。

Exponent.DEF: to be too old to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone thinks you’re past it when you get to 40.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都觉得一过40岁就不年轻了。

Exponent.DEF: relating to medical care and treatment for old people
Exponent.TRAN: 老年医学的﹐老年病学的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a geriatric hospital
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年医院
Exponent.EXAMPLE: geriatric patients
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老年病人

Exponent.EXAMPLE: an old car
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆旧车
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an old Chinese saying
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的一句老话

Exponent.DEF: very old – used about things that existed thousands of years ago, or things that look very old
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ancient civilisations
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 古文明
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an ancient Rolls Royce
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆古旧的劳斯莱斯

Exponent.DEF: antique furniture, clocks, jewellery etc are old and often valuable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an antique writing desk
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张古董书桌

Exponent.DEF: used about traditions, problems, or situations that have existed for a very long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔传统﹑问题或情形〕古老的﹐存在已久的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the age-old tradition of morris dancing
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯舞蹈的悠久传统
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the age-old prejudice against women in positions of power
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对担任要职的女性由来已久的偏见

Sense.DEF: the part of your life when you are old
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to start putting money away for your old age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该开始为晚年存钱了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother had a very lively mind, even in her old age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲思维十分活跃﹐即使到了晚年也依然如此。

Sense.DEF: money that is paid regularly by the state to old people who do not work any more
someone who does not work any more and who receives an old age pension

the most famous law court in the UK, officially called the Central Criminal Court. It is a crown courta court that deals with very serious crimes in London, named after the street it is on. Many famous criminals have been judged there, including murderers and traitorssomeone who helps an enemy country.
Sense.TRAN: 老贝利街法院〔英国中央刑事法院的俗称﹐因位于伦敦的老贝利街而得名〕

Sense.DEF: a man who used to be a student at a school
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old boys’ reunion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男校友聚会

Sense.DEF: the system by which men who went to the same school, belong to the same club etc use their influence to help each other
Sense.TRAN: 男校友[会员]关系网﹐校友[会员]之间的相互关照

Sense.DEF: an old man
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice old boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个和善的老头。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a male friend
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐老朋友〔对男性朋友的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are you, old boy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好吗﹐老兄？

Sense.DEF: an old-fashioned spelling of ‘old’, used in the names of shops, products etc to make them seem traditional and attractive
Sense.TRAN: 老的〔old 的旧拼法﹐用于商号﹑产品等名称﹐以示传统悠久及有吸引力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ye olde tea shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老(字号)茶庄

Sense.DEF: an economic system that is based on older types of industry such as steel, energy, and machinery
Sense.TRAN: 老式经济体系﹐旧式经济体系〔以老式工业如钢铁﹑能源和机械制造为基础的工业体系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the Old Economy really dead?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式工业体系真的消亡了吗？

Sense.DEF: a long time ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: People didn’t travel so much in the olden days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从前﹐人们不像现在这样经常去旅行。

Sense.DEF: a large dog with long thick grey and white hair
Sense.TRAN: 老英国牧羊犬〔一种大型犬﹐有灰白相间的浓密长毛〕

Sense.DEF: having existed, been in business etc for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 早已存在的﹔经营多年的
Sense.EXAMPLE: old-established merchant banks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史悠久的商业银行

Sense.DEF: a man who attended Eton College a famous and expensive private school in England, usually someone from the highest class in British society
Sense.TRAN: 老伊顿〔指曾经上过伊顿公学的男性﹐多出身于英国上等阶层〕

Sense.DEF: a place that is olde-worlde has been decorated so that it looks old-fashioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: an olde-worlde pub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家古色古香的小酒馆

Sense.DEF: not considered to be modern or fashionable any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wears really old-fashioned clothes!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿的衣服真过时！
Sense.EXAMPLE: old-fashioned farming methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式的农耕方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: The idea seems rather old-fashioned now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种观念现在看来似乎相当落伍了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is old-fashioned has ideas, attitudes etc that were more usual in the past than now
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s very old-fashioned when it comes to music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在音乐方面﹐他非常守旧。

Exponent.DEF: not considered modern or fashionable – used about styles of clothes, furniture etc, or about words and ideas
Exponent.TRAN: 〔服装﹑家具等的样式或词语﹑观念〕旧式的﹐过时的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The room was full of big old-fashioned furniture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里满是巨大的老式家具。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t wear that dress – it’s too old-fashioned.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能穿这裙子——太过时了。

Exponent.DEF: not containing the most recent information and therefore not useful
Exponent.TRAN: 过时的〔指信息不是最新而不再有用的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This guidebook is completely out-of-date.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本旅游手册完全过时了。

Exponent.DEF: used about machines, equipment, or methods that are old-fashioned and have been replaced by better, more recent ones
Exponent.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备或方法〕过时的﹐陈旧的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In today’s world, technology rapidly becomes outdated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在当今世界﹐技术的更新换代非常快。

Exponent.DEF: used about styles etc that were fashionable until recently but now look old-fashioned
Exponent.TRAN: 〔不久前流行的风格等〕已经过时的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pictures in this book already look a bit dated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里的图片看上去已经有点过时了。

Exponent.DEF: not fashionable and not popular with people anymore
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They lived in an unfashionable part of London.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在伦敦一个偏僻的地区。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The word ‘patriotic’ has become rather unfashionable these days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今“爱国”这个词已经不时髦了。

Exponent.DEF: old-fashioned – used about machines and equipment that are no longer being produced because better ones have been invented
Exponent.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备因被更好的产品取代而〕废弃的﹐淘汰的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: These days, you buy a computer and it’s almost immediately obsolete.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今你买一台电脑﹐几乎转眼间它就被淘汰了。

Exponent.DEF: old and not suitable for modern needs and conditions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: antiquated ideas about the constitution
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于宪法的陈旧观念
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an antiquated central heating system
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈旧的中央供暖系统

Sense.DEF: someone who is boring and has old-fashioned ideas about things, especially someone old
Sense.TRAN: 老家伙﹔极守旧的人﹐老顽固

Sense.DEF: old people – an expression used when talking about old people in a kind way
a place where old people live and are looked after when they are unable to look after themselves
a woman who is a former student of a school
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old girls’ reunion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女校友聚会

Sense.DEF: an old woman
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a nice old girl!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个和善的老太太！

Sense.DEF: the flag of the US
forests etc that have been growing in a place for a long time, rather than ones planted more recently
Sense.TRAN: 成熟的森林/热带雨林/树木等〔相对新种植的林木而言﹐指在某一地区生长了很长时间的树林等〕

Sense.DEF: if something is old hat, a lot of people have said or done the same thing before and it is therefore not new or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 陈旧的﹐过时的﹐老一套的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of this is probably old hat to you, isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对你来说﹐这其中大部分很可能是陈年老套了﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is old, especially an old film or song
Sense.TRAN: 老人﹔〔尤指〕老电影﹐怀旧老歌

Sense.DEF: fairly old
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oldish woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半老妇人

Sense.DEF: someone’s wife, mother, or girlfriend
Sense.TRAN: 某人的老婆[母亲﹐女朋友]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s your old lady?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你老婆在哪里？

Sense.DEF: someone who has been in prison many times
an offensive word for a woman who has never married and is not young any more
someone’s husband, father, or boyfriend
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard her old man beats her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听说她老公经常打她。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a male friend
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐伙计﹐朋友〔对男性朋友的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I have a word with you, old man?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老兄﹐我能和你说句话吗？

Sense.DEF: a famous painter, especially from the 15th to 18th century, or a painting by one of these painters
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指15至18世纪的〕古典名画家(作品)
Sense.EXAMPLE: a priceless collection of old masters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批价值连城的古典名画收藏品

Sense.DEF: people who come from families that have had a lot of money for a long time, which gives them a high social position
Sense.TRAN: 〔继承祖业的〕有钱人﹐上流社会人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: He invited both the smart set and Perth’s old money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把那帮时髦人物和珀斯的上流社会人士都邀请来了。

Sense.DEF: the Devil
a place where old people live and are cared for when they are too old to live by themselves
a sailor who has had a lot of experience of sailing
old-fashioned, or relating to ideas from the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was one of the last old-school comics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是最后一代老派喜剧演员之一。

Sense.DEF: the situation that exists when people who went to the same private school use their influence to help each other get work or other advantages
Sense.TRAN: 〔私立学校毕业生之间互相帮助提携的〕校友关系﹐校友纽带
Sense.EXAMPLE: a system based on social class and the old school tie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以社会阶层和校友关系为基础的体制

Sense.DEF: an old person
similar to the type of something that existed in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: old-style capitalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈腐的资本主义

Sense.DEF: the first part of the Christian Bible containing ancient Hebrew writings about the time before the birth of Christ
typical of what used to exist, be done etc in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: old-time remedies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老式疗法

Sense.DEF: someone who has been doing a job or living in a place for a long time and knows a lot about it
Sense.TRAN: 老资格的人﹐老前辈﹐老手

Sense.DEF: an old man
someone’s wife or mother
a man who pays too much attention to small unimportant details
Sense.TRAN: 斤斤计较的男人﹐婆婆妈妈的男人

Sense.DEF: an old-world place or quality is attractive because it is old or reminds you of the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方或品质〕老式的﹐古色古香的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town has retained much of its old-world charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城镇保留了不少古朴的风味。

Sense.DEF: the eastern hemisphere, especially Europe, Asia, and Africa
Sense.TRAN: 旧世界〔指东半球﹐尤指欧洲﹑亚洲和非洲〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the civilizations of the Old World
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧世界的文明

Sense.DEF: used to represent the way some people say ‘old’
Sense.TRAN: 老的〔用以表示一些人说old的方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: my ole man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我老爸

Sense.DEF: containing, producing, or like oil
a green bush with white, pink, or purple flowers
an examination in a range of subjects, formerly done by students in schools in England and Wales, usually at the age of 15 or 16. In 1988, O levels were replaced by GCSEs.
Sense.TRAN: 普通证书考试﹐O级考试〔过去英格兰和威尔士15到16岁学生参加的各门学科的考试﹐1988年起被普通中等教育证书考试(GCSE)取代〕

Sense.DEF: connected with the sense of smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: the olfactory cells in the nose
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼻腔内的嗅觉细胞

Sense.DEF: a member of a small group of people who run a country or organization
Sense.TRAN: 寡头政治家﹔寡头统治集团成员

Sense.DEF: a small group of people who run a country or organization, or a country that is run by a small group of people
Sense.TRAN: 寡头统治集团﹔寡头统治的国家

Sense.DEF: when a country or organization is run by a small group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually oligarchy took over from democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终寡头政治取代了民主制度。

Sense.DEF: the control of all or most of a business activity by very few companies, so that other organizations cannot easily compete with them
a small bitter egg-shaped black or green fruit, used as food and for making oil
a tree that produces olives, grown especially in Mediterranean countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: an olive grove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片橄榄树林

Sense.DEF: a deep yellowish green colour
skin colour that is typical of people from countries such as Greece, Italy, or Turkey

Sense.LEXUNIT: extend/offer/hold out etc an olive branch (to sb)
Sense.DEF: to do or say something in order to show that you want to end an argument with someone
Sense.TRAN: (向某人)伸出橄榄枝〔表示愿意和解〕

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件橄榄绿的长袖运动衫

PIC.HEADING: OLIVE 橄榄
PIC.PICCONTENT: black olive 黑橄榄；green olive 绿橄榄

Sense.DEF: a pale yellow or green oil obtained from olives and used in cooking

a movement in skateboarding or snowboarding in which you push down hard on the back of the board with your foot as you jump upwards and forwards, making the board rise and travel forwards through the air with you
Sense.TRAN: 豚跳〔滑板或单板滑雪运动中的一个跳跃动作﹐即在往上或向前跳跃时脚用力踩蹬滑板后部﹐使它和人一起在空中滑行〕

Sense.DEF: a person who studies or has knowledge of a particular kind of science
Sense.EXAMPLE: a biologist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生物学家

Sense.DEF: the study of something, especially something scientific
Sense.EXAMPLE: geology the study of rocks and the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地质学
Sense.EXAMPLE: climatology the study of climate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气候学
Sense.EXAMPLE: Egyptology the study of ancient Egypt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古埃及学

Sense.DEF: the things studied by a particular science
Sense.EXAMPLE: The geology structure of the rocks etc of north Devon is particularly interesting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德文郡北部的地质结构格外有意思。

Sense.DEF: a particular occasion of the modern Olympic Games
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 25th Olympiad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第25届奥运会

Sense.DEF: like a god, especially by being calm and not concerned about ordinary things
Sense.TRAN: 神仙般逍遥自在的﹐超脱世俗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He viewed the world with Olympian detachment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冷眼旁观﹐超脱地看待这世界。

Sense.DEF: relating to the ancient Greek gods
Sense.TRAN: 奥林匹斯山诸神的﹐古希腊诸神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Olympian mythology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古希腊神话

Sense.DEF: someone who is taking part in, or who has taken part in, the Olympic Games – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 奥运会选手﹐奥运会运动员〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American Olympians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的奥运选手

Sense.DEF: relating to the Olympic Games
Sense.TRAN: 奥林匹克运动会的﹐奥运会的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Olympic gold medal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥运会金牌

Sense.DEF: an international sports event held every four years in different countries
Sense.TRAN: 奥林匹克运动会﹐奥运会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 1976 Olympic Games
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1976年奥林匹克运动会

Sense.DEF: a special honour given to someone by the Queen of England
Sense.TRAN: 功绩勋章〔英国女王授予的特殊荣誉〕

Sense.DEF: someone who deals with complaints made by ordinary people against the government, banks, insurance companies etc
Sense.TRAN: 民情调查员﹐巡视官﹐申诉专员〔专门处理民众对政府﹑银行﹑保险公司等投诉的人〕

Sense.DEF: the last letter of the Greek alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 奥米伽〔希腊字母表的最后一个字母﹐即 Ω, ω〕

Sense.DEF: eggs mixed together and cooked in hot fat, sometimes with other foods added
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cheese omelette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶酪煎蛋卷

Sense.LEXUNIT: you can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is impossible to achieve anything important without causing a few problems
Sense.TRAN: 要煎蛋卷就得打破鸡蛋﹐有失才有得〔指要做大事必会引起一些问题〕

Sense.DEF: a sign of what will happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car won’t start. Do you think it’s an omen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车发动不起来。你觉得这是某种预兆吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mist seemed like a bad omen and Sara’s heart sank a little.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这薄雾就像是个不好的兆头﹐萨拉的心往下一沉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will regard your presence as an omen of good fortune.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会把你的到场看成好运的预兆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a good omen for the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对未来而言是个好兆头。

Sense.DEF: an instrument for measuring something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speedometer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速度计

Sense.DEF: the written abbreviation of ‘Oh my God’– used especially in emails and on the Internet to express admiration, surprise, or shock
Sense.TRAN: 我的天啊〔Oh my God的书面缩写﹐尤用于电子邮件及因特网﹐表示赞赏﹑惊讶或震惊〕

Sense.DEF: making you feel that something bad is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How long will she be ill?’ he asked. There was an ominous silence.
