Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她的病多久会好？”他问。大家的沉默让人感觉不妙。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car is making an ominous rattling sound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车在发出一种不妙的咔嗒声。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空看上去黑沉沉的﹐好像要变天。

Sense.DEF: when you do not include or do not do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The omission of her name was not a deliberate act.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字不是故意遗漏的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his omission from the team
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未进入队里

Sense.DEF: something that has been omitted
Sense.TRAN: 省略的东西﹔遗漏的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Copies of the lists were posted so that omissions could be corrected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多份名单被张贴出来﹐以便更正遗漏之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your failing to note her mistakes is a serious omission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有发现她的错误﹐这是个严重的疏漏。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that is very bad and easily noticed

Sense.DEF: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请不要忽略任何细节﹐不管它多细小。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lisa’s name had been omitted from the list of honor students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉萨的名字不在优秀学生名单上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say leave out rather than omit.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说leave out﹐而不说omit
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Please don’t leave out any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 请不要忽略任何细节﹐不管它多么微不足道。

Sense.DEF: to not do something, either because you forgot or because you deliberately didn’t do it
Sense.TRAN: 忘记做某事﹔故意不做某事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oliver omitted to mention that he was married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利弗没有提及他已结婚。

Sense.DEF: everything or everywhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: an omnivore an animal that eats all kinds of food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂食动物

Sense.DEF: a radio or television programme consisting of several programmes that have previously been broadcast separately
Sense.TRAN: 节目荟萃[集锦]﹐多集节目的一次播出〔由曾分别播出过的几个节目组成的广播或电视节目〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Saturday omnibus edition of ‘Brookside’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《小溪边》的周六综合版

Sense.DEF: a book containing several stories, especially by one writer, that have already been printed separately
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某作家的〕选集﹐文集﹔汇编
Sense.EXAMPLE: Omnibus editions of novels tend to be too heavy to be read with comfort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说选集往往分量太重﹐读起来不方便。

Sense.DEF: a bus
an omnibus law contains several different laws collected together
Sense.EXAMPLE: an omnibus civil rights bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 综合民权法案

Sense.DEF: able to do everything
present everywhere at all times
Sense.TRAN: 〔任何时候都〕无所不在的﹐普遍存在的

Sense.DEF: knowing everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: the book’s omniscient narrator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书中全知全能的叙事者

Sense.DEF: an animal that eats both meat and plants
an animal that is omnivorous eats both meat and plants
interested in everything, especially in all books
Sense.TRAN: 对什么都感兴趣的﹔〔尤指〕什么书都看的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an omnivorous reader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兴趣广泛的读者

Subsense.DEF: touching a surface or being supported by a surface
Subsense.TRAN: 在…上面〔表示接触或由某一表面支撑着〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leave your things on the table over there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的东西放在那边的桌子上。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People were sunbathing on the grass.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们在草地上晒日光浴。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The little girl was sitting on her father’s shoulders.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小女孩坐在她爸爸的肩上。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone or something moves so that they are then touching or supported by a surface
Subsense.EXAMPLE: snow falling on the mountainsides
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落在山坡上的雪
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He threw himself on the bed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一头倒在床上。

Sense.DEF: used to say what part of someone’s body is touching the ground or another surface and supporting their weight
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was on her feet in no time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她立刻站了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was on his hands and knees searching for something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他趴在地上找东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you stand on your head?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会倒立吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to punch him on the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Matt kissed her on the cheek.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something is written or shown
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a diagram on page 25.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第25页上有个图表。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wrote his phone number on a piece of paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把自己的电话号码写在一张纸上。

Sense.DEF: attached to or hanging from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hung her coat on a hook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把外套挂在衣钩上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dogs must be kept on a lead at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何时候都要用皮带把狗拴住。

Sense.DEF: in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town is right on the border.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城镇就在边境上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a water supply on the island?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛上有供水吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He grew up on a ranch in California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在加利福尼亚的一个牧场里长大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a store on Fifth Avenue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第五大道上的一家商店

Sense.DEF: in a particular position in relation to something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll see the school on your left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会看到学校在你的左边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live on the opposite side of the town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在镇子的另一头。

Sense.DEF: looking or pointing towards something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were on the stranger standing in the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼睛看着站在门口的那个陌生人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She trained her binoculars on the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把望远镜对准了那幢房子。

Sense.DEF: during a particular day
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll be here on Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二他们要到这里来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was born on July 1st.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生于7月1日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll see you on Christmas Eve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们圣诞夜来看你。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use on before ‘this’, ‘last’, or ‘next’ and a day of the week.
F2NBox.TRAN: 星期几之前如果有this﹐last或next不要用on
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The school reopened last Tuesday (NOT 不说 on last Tuesday).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校上周二复课。

Sense.DEF: affecting or relating to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tax on cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香烟税
Sense.EXAMPLE: his influence on young people
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对青年人的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be new restrictions on the sale of weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对武器买卖将有新的限制。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What effect will these changes have on the tourist industry?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些变化会给旅游业带来什么影响？

Sense.DEF: about a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any books on India?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有关于印度的书吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can get information on local services by calling this number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以打这个电话获取有关当地公共事业机构的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an international conference on global warming
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关全球气候变暖的国际会议

Sense.DEF: as a result of someone’s order, request, or advice
Sense.TRAN: 根据﹐按照〔某人的命令﹑要求或建议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was killed on the King’s orders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被国王下令处死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I accepted the offer on the advice of my lawyer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我按律师的建议接受了这个条件。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about what someone usually eats or drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live mainly on beans, lentils and rice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们主要食用豆类﹑小扁豆和米饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is your baby on solid food yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的宝宝开始吃固体食物了吗？

Subsense.DEF: in or into a bus, train, plane etc
Subsense.TRAN: 乘坐﹐上〔公共汽车﹑火车﹑飞机等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did you manage to sleep on the plane?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在飞机上睡着了吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Tommy should be on the six o’clock train.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤米应该乘坐6点钟的那班火车。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She got on the first bus that came along.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一辆公共汽车来了﹐她就上去了。

Subsense.DEF: riding something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a statue of the King on horseback
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王骑着马的雕像
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll probably come on my bike.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很可能骑自行车来。

Sense.DEF: receiving money for a job or as a regular payment
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s on quite a good salary now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在工资相当高了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She must be on at least £50,000 a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她肯定一年至少挣五万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the difficulties faced by families on low incomes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低收入家庭面临的困难

Sense.DEF: using a particular type of fuel or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most buses run on diesel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数公共汽车都以柴油作燃料。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does it work on mains electricity?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它是靠电力供应系统来运转吗？

Sense.DEF: taking a particular drug or medicine regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you still on antibiotics?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还在服用抗生素吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor put her on Prozac.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生让她服用“百忧解”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of these kids are on heroin by the age of twelve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子中有许多12岁就开始吸食海洛因了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is behaving in a very strange way, as if they are taking an illegal drug
Sense.TRAN: 某人吃错什么药了？ 某人吸了什么毒了？〔用于表示某人的举止十分异常﹐好像吸食了毒品似的〕

Sense.DEF: using a machine or piece of equipment
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been on the computer all afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一下午都在用电脑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is Rachel still on the phone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔还在打电话吗？

Sense.DEF: playing a musical instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: He played a short piece on the piano.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用钢琴弹奏了一首短曲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The album features Rick Wakeman on keyboards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑收录的是里克•威克曼演奏的键盘音乐。

Sense.DEF: being broadcast by radio or television
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s on TV tonight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚电视里播什么节目？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you hear that programme on the radio last night?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚的那个广播节目你听了吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say in what form information is stored or music, films etc are recorded
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie is now available on video and DVD.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在可以买到这部电影的录像带和数字影碟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always keep a backup copy on disk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是在磁盘上留个备份。

Sense.DEF: taking part in an activity or travelling somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s on a course all this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周她一直都在上一门课程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I met him on vacation in Canada.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在加拿大度假时遇见了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My girlfriend is often away on business trips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的女朋友经常出差。

Sense.DEF: included in a group or team of people or in a list
Sense.TRAN: 在〔群体或团队〕中﹔在〔名单〕上
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you still on the management committee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还在管理委员会吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Edwards is no longer on the staff here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱德华兹先生不再是这里的员工了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whose team are you on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你属于谁的球队？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no steak on the menu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 菜单上没有牛排。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the next item on the agenda?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议事日程的下一项是什么内容？

Sense.DEF: as soon as someone has done something or as soon as something has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Couples are presented with a bottle of wine on their arrival at the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡夫妇到宾馆将获赠一瓶葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All patients are examined on admission to the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有病人入院时都要体检。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What was your reaction on seeing him?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他时你有什么反应？

Sense.DEF: compared with another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: This essay is a definite improvement on your last one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章比起你的上一篇显然大有进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales are 10% up on last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售额比去年增加了10%。

Sense.DEF: if you have something on you, you have it in your pocket, your bag etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have any money on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我身上一点钱都没带。

Sense.DEF: used to say who is going to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drinks are on me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮料我请客！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each table will get a bottle of champagne on the house paid for by the restaurant, hotel etc.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每桌都将得到一瓶本店奉送的香槟。

Sense.DEF: used to say what number you should use in order to telephone someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can contact me on this number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以打这个电话号码和我联系。

Sense.DEF: used when something bad happens to you, for example when something you are using suddenly stops working, or someone you have a relationship with suddenly leaves you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly the telephone went dead on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的电话突然断了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dorothy’s first husband walked out on her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多罗西的第一任丈夫抛下她走了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone continues to do something or something continues to happen, without stopping
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to play on even though it was snowing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管下雪了﹐我们仍决定继续比赛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went on and on talked for a very long time about his job all evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一晚上都在不停地讲他的工作。

Sense.DEF: if you move, walk etc on, you move forward or further towards something
Sense.TRAN: 继续往前的[地]﹐再向前的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you walk on a little, you can see the coast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再往前走一点﹐你就会看见海岸了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove on towards Manchester.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们继续朝曼彻斯特驶去。

Sense.DEF: later than or after a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now, 40 years on, this is one of the most successful theatres in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 40年以后的今天﹐这家剧院成了国内最为成功的剧院之一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From that moment on I never believed a word she said.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那一刻起﹐我不再相信她说的任何一句话。

Sense.DEF: if you have something on, you are wearing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: All he had on was a pair of tattered shorts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只穿了一条破短裤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your coat on. It’s freezing outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿上大衣吧﹐外面冷极了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is attached to something else, especially when it is in the correct position
Sense.TRAN: 覆盖﹔附着〔尤在正确的位置上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the cover on properly?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖子盖好了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember to put the lid back on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记得把盖子盖回去。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is written somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was wearing a badge with his name on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他佩戴着一枚证章﹐上面有他的姓名。

Sense.DEF: in or into a bus, train etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train stopped and two people got on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车停下来﹐有两个人上去了。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, light etc is on, it is operating
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who left all the lights on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是谁把灯都开着的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The TV’s on, but nobody seems to be watching it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视开着﹐但好像没人在看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat down at the desk and switched on the computer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐到书桌前﹐打开了电脑。

Sense.DEF: if a radio or television programme etc is on, it is being broadcast
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播或电视节目〕正在播出的
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time is ‘Star Trek’ on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《星际迷航》什么时候播出？

Sense.DEF: if an event is on, it has been arranged and is happening or will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The transport union has confirmed that the strike is definitely on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运输工会已证实肯定会举行罢工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d avoid the city centre – there’s some kind of procession on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要避开市中心﹐那里在举行什么游行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the party still on tonight or have they cancelled it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的派对照常举行﹐还是已经取消了？

Sense.DEF: performing or speaking in public
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re on in two minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两分钟以后你上。

Sense.DEF: if you are on at a particular time, you are doing your job at that time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not on again until two o’clock tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要到明天下午两点钟才上班。

Sense.DEF: if you have something on, there is something that you must do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t got anything on tomorrow, so I could see you then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天我没什么事﹐可以来看你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got a lot on at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在有很多事要干。

Sense.DEF: for short periods but not regularly over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been smoking for 10 years now, on and off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到现在﹐他断断续续地吸烟有十年了。

Sense.DEF: to keep complaining to someone or asking someone to do something, espe­ially when this annoys them
Sense.TRAN: 不停地对某人发牢骚﹔不断地要某人做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been on at him to fix that cupboard for weeks now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已催了他好几个星期叫他修那个柜子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you wouldn’t go on at me the whole time!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别没完没了地对我发牢骚！

Sense.DEF: to keep talking about something, in a way that is boring or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 〔令人生厌地〕不断谈论某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always going on about money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是不停地说钱啊钱的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what you’re on about!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道你在唠叨些什么！

Sense.DEF: if something is not on, it is not acceptable or reasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, what you’re suggesting is just not on!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉﹐你提出的事无法接受！

Sense.DEF: to be ready or willing to do something that someone has suggested
Sense.TRAN: 准备做某事﹔愿意做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, how many of you are on for a drink after work?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好﹐你们有几个人愿意下班后去喝一杯？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you accept a bet or an invitation to compete against them
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I bet you £20 he won’t turn up.’ ‘You’re on!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我跟你赌20英镑﹐他不会露面的。”“赌就赌！”

Sense.DEF: broadcast while actually happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: an on-air interview
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现场采访

Sense.DEF: carried on a ship, plane, car etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: an on-board computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 机载电脑

Sense.DEF: on one occasion only
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve only met her once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只见过她一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul’s been to Wexford once before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗曾去过韦克斯福德一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mrs Peterson came in to see Ruth just the once.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼德森太太仅仅来看过露丝一次。

Sense.LEXUNIT: once a week/once every three months etc
Sense.DEF: one time every week etc, as a regular activity or event
Sense.TRAN: 每周一次/每三个月一次等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff meetings take place once a week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工会议每周举行一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took separate holidays at least once every two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每两年至少有一次各自去度假。

Sense.DEF: at some time in the past, but not now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sonya and Ida had once been close friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼娅和艾达曾经是很要好的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She and her husband had once owned a house like this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她丈夫曾经也有过这样的房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was sad to see the once-great man looking so frail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到曾经的伟人如此脆弱﹐真让人难过。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the once-mighty steel industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一度辉煌的钢铁工业

Sense.DEF: in the past, at a time that is not stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I once ran 21 miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾经跑过21英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marx once described religion as the ‘opium of the people’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克思曾把宗教称为“人民的鸦片”。

Subsense.DEF: immediately or without delay
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now, go upstairs at once and clean your room!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在立刻上楼去打扫你的房间！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When I saw him I recognized him at once.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一看到他我就认出他了。

Subsense.DEF: together, at the same time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can’t do two things at once!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能同时做两件事！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t all talk at once.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要同时发言。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when people mean ‘immediately’, they usually say right away or, in British English, straight away rather than at once.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们表示 “立刻” 时一般说right away或straight away(英国英语)﹐而不说at once
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I recognized him right away.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我立刻认出了他。

Subsense.DEF: again, after happening several times before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I looked at myself in the mirror once more.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再看了一眼镜子里的自己。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once again she’s refusing to help.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她再一次拒绝帮助。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a situation changes back to its previous state
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crowds had all gone home and the street was quiet once more.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 众人都回家去了﹐街上恢复了宁静。

Subsense.DEF: used before you repeat something that you said before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once again, it must be stressed that the pilot was not to blame.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再说一遍﹐必须强调的是飞行员没有责任。

Subsense.DEF: if something happens all at once, it happens suddenly when you are not expecting it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All at once there was a loud banging on the door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然传来一记重重的敲门声。

Subsense.DEF: together, at the same time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A lot of practical details needed to be attended to all at once.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多实际上的细节问题都需要同时处理。

Sense.DEF: sometimes, although not often
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do get a little anxious once in a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的确偶尔会有点焦虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw her in the shop every once in a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时我在商店里看到她。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something has never happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never once saw him get angry or upset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未见过他生气或不快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not once did they finish a job properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从来没有把一件事情做好过。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something unusual happens, especially when you wish it would happen more often
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be honest for once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诚实点﹐哪怕就这一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just for once, let me make my own decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这一次让我自己作决定吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For once Colin was speechless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林这一次无话可说。

Subsense.DEF: if you deal with something once and for all, you deal with it completely and finally
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s settle this matter once and for all.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这个问题彻底解决了吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize your impatience when you ask or say something that you have asked or said many times before
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once and for all, will you switch off that television!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后说一次﹐把那电视关掉！

Sense.DEF: a few times
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrote to him once or twice, but he didn’t answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给他写过一两次信﹐但他没有回复。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that this is the only time you are allowing something, asking for something etc, and it will not happen again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go on, lend me the car, just this once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐把车借给我吧﹐就这一次。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll make an exception this once.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次我就破个例。

Subsense.DEF: at a time in the past that you think was much better than now
Subsense.TRAN: 以前﹐从前﹐那时候〔指比现在好得多的过去某一时期〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once upon a time you used to be able to leave your front door unlocked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从前﹐大门是可以不上锁的。

Subsense.DEF: a long time ago – used at the beginning of children’s stories
Subsense.TRAN: 从前﹐很久以前〔用于儿童故事的开头〕

Sense.DEF: very rarely
Sense.EXAMPLE: It only happens like this once in a blue moon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的情况是极为罕见的。

Sense.DEF: to repeat a bad, stupid, or dangerous action with the result that you get punished or cause trouble for yourself
Sense.TRAN: 屡次做坏事[傻事﹐危险之事]而遭殃
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried that trick once too often and in the end they caught him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一次次故伎重施﹐最后他们终于把他抓住了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people stay the same and cannot change the way they behave and think
Sense.TRAN: 一次是…就永远是…〔表示一个人的品性是无法改变的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once a thief, always a thief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一日为贼﹐终生是贼。

Sense.DEF: used to say that after you have done something one time you do not need or want to do it again
Sense.TRAN: 一次就够了〔表示你不需要或不想再做了〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that people will not do something again if it has been a bad experience
Sense.TRAN: 一朝被蛇咬﹐十年怕井绳

Sense.DEF: from the time when something happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once I get him a job, he’ll be fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一旦我帮他找到了工作﹐他就会好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once in bed, the children usually stay there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一旦上了床﹐一般就不下来了。

Subsense.DEF: to look at someone or something quickly to check what they are like
Subsense.TRAN: 匆匆打量一下某人﹐对某物草草过目一下

Subsense.DEF: to clean or tidy something quickly
Subsense.TRAN: 匆匆清洁某物﹐匆忙整理某物

Sense.DEF: the part of medical science that deals with cancer and tumours
a car etc that is coming towards you
Sense.TRAN: 迎面而来的汽车/车流等
Sense.EXAMPLE: He crashed into an oncoming car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撞上了一辆迎面驶来的汽车。

Sense.DEF: the number 1
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had one daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有一个女儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one hundred and twenty-one pounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 121英镑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come back at one one o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1点钟回来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katie’s almost one one year old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂快满一岁了。

Sense.DEF: a small number of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are one or two things to sort out before I leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走之前还有一两件事要料理好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One or two of us knew him quite well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中有一两个人对他很熟悉。

Sense.DEF: alone or in pairs, rather than in large numbers or groups
Sense.TRAN: 三三两两地﹐零零落落地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guests arrived in ones and twos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客人三三两两地到来了。

Sense.DEF: used to mean someone or something of a type that has already been mentioned or is known about
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于代替已提及的某人﹑某物或对方已知道的某人﹑某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Have you got a camera?’ ‘No.’ ‘You should buy one’ buy a camera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有照相机吗？”“没有。”“你应该买一架。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was crowded so we decided to catch a later one catch a later train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车很挤﹐于是我们决定乘坐下一班。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The only jokes I tell are the ones that I hear from you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说的那几个笑话都是从你这里听来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like all the pictures except this one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了这一张﹐其余的照片我都喜欢。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a member of a group or pair of people or things
Sense.TRAN: 〔指一组或一对人或物中的〕一个
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children seemed upset. One was crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子好像不开心﹐有一个在哭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has two daughters. One is a primary school teacher, the other is a musician.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有两个女儿﹐一个是小学教师﹐另一个是音乐家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the girls I work with is getting married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一位女同事要结婚了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is one of my favourite books.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我最喜欢的书之一。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: One of is followed by a plural noun but a singular verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: one of后跟复数名词﹐但使用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: One of the windows was open.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一扇窗开着。

Sense.DEF: the person or people who
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was the one who had been attacked, not Richard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到袭击的是我﹐不是理查德。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only ones who will benefit are the shareholders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的受益者将是股东。

Sense.DEF: used when one person or thing in a group does something, then the next, then the next, especially in a regular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: One by one each soldier approached the coffin and gave a final salute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵们逐个走到灵柩前﹐致以最后的敬礼。

Sense.LEXUNIT: one after another/one after the other
Sense.DEF: if events happen one after the other, they happen without much time between them
Sense.TRAN: 一个接一个地﹐接二连三地
Sense.EXAMPLE: One after another, tropical storms battered the Pacific coastline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带风暴接二连三地在太平洋沿岸肆虐。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is many different things all in one, they are all those things
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a TV, radio and VCR all in one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它集电视机﹑收音机和录像机的功能于一体。

Sense.DEF: used to mean people in general, including yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: One can never be too careful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再小心也不为过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Great pictures make one think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伟大的画作发人深思。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually use you rather than one.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般用you﹐而不用one
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can never be too careful.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 再小心也不为过。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you believe something, will do something etc and hope others will do the same
Sense.TRAN: 我就是…中的一个〔强调自己相信或会做某事等﹐并希望别人也如此〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I, for one, am proud of the team’s effort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己就对球队的努力感到非常自豪。

Sense.DEF: used to give an example of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: …就是一个例子﹐…就是其中之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were several other people absent that afternoon, weren’t there? Mr Ashton for one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天下午还有几个人缺席了﹐对不对？阿什顿先生就是其中之一。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be one up (on sb)/get one up on sb
Sense.DEF: to have or get an advantage over someone
Sense.TRAN: 强过(某人)/略胜某人一筹

Sense.DEF: to trick someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one’s going to put one over on me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也别想骗过我！

Subsense.DEF: to feel very calm or relaxed in the situation or environment you are in
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She felt as she always did in these mountains: peaceful, without care, at one with nature.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的心情就和她在这片群山中时总有的感觉一样: 平静﹐无牵无挂﹐和大自然融为一体。

Subsense.DEF: to agree with someone about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was at one with Wheatley on the need to abandon free trade.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和惠特利一致认为有必要放弃自由贸易。

Sense.DEF: used in particular phrases to mean ‘an alcoholic drink’
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某些特定的短语中指酒精饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How about a quick one at the pub?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去酒吧喝一杯怎么样？

GramExa.GLOSS: have drunk too much alcohol
have one last alcoholic drink before you leave a place

Sense.DEF: a joke or humorous story
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you heard the one about the chicken who tried to cross the road?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听过小鸡过马路的那个笑话吗？

Sense.DEF: if many people do something as one, they all do it at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole team stood up as one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全队一齐站了起来。

Sense.DEF: a particular kind of problem, question, story etc
Sense.TRAN: 难题/问得很好的问题等
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you attribute your long life to?’ ‘Oh that’s a difficult one’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你认为你长寿的秘诀是什么？”“噢﹐这问题不容易回答。”

Sense.DEF: the same person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Muhammad Ali and Cassius Clay are one and the same.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穆罕默德•阿里和卡修斯•克莱是同一个人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not/never be one to do sth
Sense.DEF: to never do a particular thing, because it is not part of your character to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人因个性关系〕决不会做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom is not one to show his emotions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆不是那种会流露自己感情的人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not/never be (a great) one for (doing) sth
Sense.DEF: to not enjoy a particular activity, subject etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been a great one for watersports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来不大喜欢水上运动。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone belongs to the same group as you, or has the same ideas, beliefs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can talk in front of Terry – he’s one of us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以当着特里的面说﹐他是我们自己人。

Sense.DEF: everyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apologies to one and all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向大家致歉。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has correctly guessed or understood something immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re not painting the house again, are you?’ ‘Got it in one!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不会是又要粉刷房子吧？”“你猜对了！”

Sense.DEF: spoken used by some people to mean ‘children’, especially young children
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got four little ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有四个小孩。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone’s behaviour is amusing, strange or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 你/他真有趣[奇怪﹐让人吃惊]
Sense.EXAMPLE: You are a one!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真有趣！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a particular person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 一个〔用于强调某人或某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: One person I find very difficult is Bob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得很难相处的一个人是鲍勃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If there’s one thing I can’t stand, it’s people who bite their nails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要说有什么事是我不能忍受的﹐那就是有人啃指甲。

Subsense.DEF: on a particular day, morning etc in the past
Subsense.TRAN: 〔过去的〕某一天/某个早上/某一年等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One morning I was sitting at my desk when a policeman knocked at my door.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天上午我正坐在书桌旁﹐突然有个警察来敲我的门。

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about a day, morning etc in the future which is not yet exactly known or decided
Subsense.TRAN: 〔将来不确定的〕某一天/某个早上/某一年等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We should go out for a drink one evening.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该哪天晚上出去喝一杯。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: One day she hopes to move to the South Coast.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望有一天能搬到南部海滨去。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular person or thing in comparison with other similar people or things
Sense.TRAN: 一个〔用于比较相似的人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why does my card work in one cash machine and not in another?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么我的卡在一台取款机上可以使用﹐但在另一台上却不能使用呢？

Sense.LEXUNIT: It’s one thing to ... it’s (quite) another to
Sense.DEF: used to say that the second thing mentioned is very different from the first, and is often much more difficult to do …
Sense.TRAN: 是一回事﹐…则(完全)是另一回事
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s one thing to say we have a goal; it’s another to actually act on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我们有个目标是一回事﹐真要把它付诸行动又是另一回事了。

Sense.DEF: used to introduce a reason for what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 首先﹐其一〔用来列举理由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t bring himself to say what he thought. For one thing, she seldom stopped to listen. For another, he doubted that he could make himself clear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没法说出心里的想法﹐一是因为她很少会停下来听他讲﹐二是因为他怀疑自己可能说不清楚。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be one crazy woman/be one interesting job etc
Sense.DEF: to be a very crazy woman, be a very interesting job etc
Sense.TRAN: 是个疯女人/是份有趣的工作等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re one lucky guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是个幸运的家伙。

Sense.DEF: used before the name of someone you do not know or have not heard of before
Sense.TRAN: 某个〔用于不认识或没有听到过的人的名字前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was accused of stealing a horse from one Peter Wright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控偷了一个名叫彼得•赖特的人的一匹马。

Sense.DEF: only
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her one concern was to get to the door without being seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唯一担心的就是怎样走到门口而不被人看见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire is the one person I can trust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔是我唯一能信任的人。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is very famous
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the one and only Frank Sinatra
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无人不知的弗兰克•西纳特拉

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is the only one of its kind
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于强调同类中〕仅有的﹐唯一的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I even tried my one and only French joke on them.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我甚至试着把我知道的唯一一个法国笑话讲给他们听了。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth one dollar
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t have any ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有一美元的纸币。

Sense.DEF: each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liz and I have known one another for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和利兹相识有好多年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They often stay at one another’s houses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们经常住在彼此的家里。

Sense.DEF: a machine with a long handle, into which you put money in order to try to win more money
Sense.TRAN: 吃角子老虎机﹐独臂强盗〔指用一臂状杆操纵﹑放入硬币赌博的机器〕

Sense.DEF: simple and not considering or showing all the parts of something – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: the novel’s one-dimensional characters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小说中的浅薄角色

Sense.DEF: a small and boring town
a race, competition etc which a particular person or thing looks likely to win easily
Sense.TRAN: 某人[某物]看来可以轻易获胜的比赛

Sense.DEF: a very short joke or humorous remark
Sense.TRAN: 很短的笑话﹔俏皮话﹐打趣话

Sense.DEF: performed, operated, controlled etc by one person
Sense.TRAN: 由一人表演[经营﹐控制]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does a one-man show in Las Vegas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在拉斯维加斯表演独角戏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-man business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一人经营的公司

Sense.DEF: an organization or activity in which one person does everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is really a one-man band.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司其实只有一个人在经营。

Sense.DEF: a street musician who plays several instruments at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 单人乐队〔一个同时演奏多种乐器的街头艺人〕

Sense.DEF: a peaceful feeling of being part of a whole

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sense of oneness with nature
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和自然融为一体的感觉

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when two people have sex, but do not meet each other again
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not into one-night stands.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对一夜情不感兴趣。

Subsense.DEF: a person that you have sex with once and do not see again

Sense.DEF: a performance of music or a play that is given only once in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某地〕仅表演一次的(巡回)演出

Sense.DEF: happening or done only once, not as part of a regular series
Sense.TRAN: 只发生一次的﹔一次完成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s yours for a one-off payment of only £200.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次性仅付200英镑﹐它就是你的了。

Sense.DEF: something that is done or made only once
Sense.TRAN: 只做过一次的事﹔一次性事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deal was a one-off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项交易是一次性的。

Sense.DEF: someone who is completely different from anyone else
between only two people
Sense.TRAN: 一对一的﹐仅限于两人之间的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Virtually all instruction is in small groups or one-on-one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎所有的指导都以小组或一对一的形式进行。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Often, the employer just called in the drivers and bargained with them directly, one-on-one.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主通常是把司机叫进来﹐直接和他们一对一地讨价还价。

Sense.DEF: a family in which there is only one parent who lives with the children
consisting of only one piece, not separate parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-piece bathing suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单件式泳衣

Sense.DEF: work or a responsibility that is onerous is difficult and worrying or makes you tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: an onerous task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰巨的任务

Sense.DEF: the reflexive form of one27
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is only through study that one really begins to know oneself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有通过学习﹐一个人才能真正了解自己。

Sense.DEF: happening or done only once
Sense.TRAN: 只发生一次的﹔一次完成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a one-shot deal. If it doesn’t work, it’s over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一次性的交易﹐如果不成﹐那就拉倒了。

Sense.DEF: considering or showing only one side of a question, subject etc in a way that is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 片面的﹐偏颇的﹐偏于一方的﹐不公正的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The newspapers give a very one­sided account of the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸对这场战争作了非常片面的报道。

Sense.DEF: an activity or competition that is one-sided is one in which one person or side is much stronger or does much more than the other
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或比赛〕一边倒的﹐不均衡的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very boring, one-sided game
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场乏味无趣﹑实力悬殊的比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: The conversation was very one-sided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次对话很不对等。

Sense.DEF: a one-size-fits-all attitude, method, plan etc is designed to please everyone or be suitable for every situation, often with the result that it is not successful
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑方法﹑计划等〕为满足所有的人[情况]而设计的〔往往效果不佳〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-size-fits-all public education program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一刀切的公共教育计划

Sense.DEF: one-size-fits-all clothes are designed so that people of any size can wear them
Sense.TRAN: 〔服装的设计〕适合所有人穿的﹐通用尺寸的

Sense.DEF: a one-star hotel, restaurant etc has been judged to be not of a very high standard
a shop where you can buy many different things
former
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neil McMurtry, a one-time bus driver, is the lead singer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾经当过公共汽车司机的尼尔•麦克默特里是主唱歌手。

Sense.DEF: between only two people
Sense.TRAN: 只在两人之间的﹐一对一的
Sense.EXAMPLE: tuition on a one-to-one basis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对一的授课

Sense.DEF: matching each other exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-to-one correspondence between letters and sounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 字母与读音之间完全对应的关系

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I need to discuss it with him one-to-one.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要和他单独商量此事。

Sense.DEF: to be continuously thinking about one particular thing, especially sex
Sense.TRAN: 脑子里只想着一件事〔尤指性事〕

Sense.DEF: a movement in which a boxer hits his opponent with one hand and then quickly with the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ali gives his opponent the old one-two, and it’s all over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里施展出他的惯用拳法﹐朝对手左右连击﹐比赛就此结束。

Sense.DEF: attempts to make yourself seem better than other people, no matter what they do
a one-way street is one in which vehicles are only allowed to travel in one direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: the town’s one-way system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该镇的单向交通系统

Sense.DEF: a one-way ticket is for travelling from one place to another but not back again
a one-way process, relationship etc is one in which only one person makes any effort or provides anything
a mirror which can be used as a window by people secretly watching from the other side of it
performed, operated, controlled etc by only one woman
Sense.TRAN: 只有一个女子表演[经营﹐控制]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a one-woman show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女子独角戏

Sense.DEF: continuing, or continuing to develop
Sense.TRAN: 继续进行的﹐不断发展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: their ongoing search for a new director
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任
Sense.EXAMPLE: ongoing negotiations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还在进行的谈判
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discussions are still ongoing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨论仍在继续。

Sense.DEF: a round white vegetable with a brown, red, or white skin and many layers. Onions have a strong taste and smell.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chop the onions finely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱切碎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: red onions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红皮洋葱
Sense.EXAMPLE: home-made onion soup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自制的洋葱汤

Sense.DEF: very thin light paper, used in the past especially for writing letters
Sense.TRAN: 薄光泽纸〔旧时尤用于写信〕

Sense.DEF: connected to other computers through the Internet, or available through the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the city’s schools will be online by the end of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到年底﹐市里的所有学校都会连接因特网。

Sense.DEF: directly connected to or controlled by a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: an online printer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联机打印机

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The reports are not available online yet.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些报道还没有在网上发布。

Sense.DEF: a type of website in which you can sell things to the person who offers you the highest price
a service provided by banks so that people can find out information about their bank account, pay bills etc using the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 网上银行业务〔银行提供的一种网上服务﹐可供客户查询账户﹑支付账单等〕

Sense.DEF: someone who watches something happening without being involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: A crowd of onlookers had gathered at the scene of the accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群旁观者围聚在事故现场。

Sense.DEF: not more than a particular number, age etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are only a few cars on the island.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only eight o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 才8点钟。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something or someone is not very important, serious etc
Sense.TRAN: 只是﹐不过〔表示不重要﹑不严重等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was only a joke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是个玩笑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an interesting job, but it’s only temporary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作很有意思﹐但只是临时性的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re only small cuts, nothing life-threatening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些只不过是轻微的割伤﹐不会危及生命。

Sense.DEF: nothing or no one except a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only the president can authorize a nuclear attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有总统才能授权发动核攻击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We use only the best ingredients.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只选用最佳的食材。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car park is for staff only.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个停车场只限员工使用。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens or is possible in one particular situation or place and no others, or for one particular reason
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll tell you, but only if you don’t tell anyone else.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉你﹐但条件是你不告诉别人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ate the food, but only because I was starving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃了这些食物﹐但只是因为我饿极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The transfer takes place only when the data is complete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯有当数据完整后才可以开始传输。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: You can put a phrase or clause beginning with only first, to emphasize it. You put the subject after an auxiliary in the main clause.
F2NBox.TRAN: 可将only置于短语或从句前﹐表示强调﹐主句中的主语置于助动词后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Only in London did I find a purpose in life.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有在伦敦我才找到了生活的目标。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Only by changing themselves can organizations continue to succeed.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 机构只有自我变革才能继续成功。

Sense.DEF: no earlier than a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘When did you email her?’ ‘Only yesterday.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么时候给她发电子邮件的？”“昨天刚发的。”

GramExa.PROPFORM: only then did/would/could etc sb do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: at that moment and not before
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 直到那时某人才/才会/才可以等做某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only then did she tell him about the attack.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到那时她才把袭击的事告诉他。

Subsense.DEF: a very short time ago
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s only just got up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚起来。

Subsense.DEF: almost not
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I only just finished my essay in time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我差点来不及把文章写完。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not possible to do more than hope etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can only hope it won’t rain on the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只能希望那天别下雨。

Sense.DEF: used when you are giving a reason for something, to say that you do not know something for certain but think that this is the only possible reason
Sense.TRAN: 我只能认为/假定/假设〔用于说明唯一可能的理由〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can only assume that it was a mistake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只能假设这是一个错误。

Sense.DEF: used to express a strong wish or hope
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s happening?’ ‘I only wish I knew.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “发生什么事？”“但愿我能知道。”

Sense.DEF: used to express a strong wish
Sense.EXAMPLE: If only he’d call!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿他会来电话！

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that what they want to do will have a bad effect
Sense.TRAN: 你只会〔用于告诉某人其所做的事只会带来坏结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t interfere – you’ll only make things worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别插手﹐你只会把事情搞得更糟。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you only have to read/look at/listen to etc sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is easy to know that something is true because you can see or hear things that prove it
Sense.TRAN: 你只要读一读/看一下/听一听等某事物〔用于表示要了解事实真相很容易〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You only have to look at the statistics to see that things are getting worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只要看一看统计数据就能知道情况在变糟。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone did something, with a disappointing or surprising result
Sense.TRAN: 结果只是〔用于表示结果令人失望或感到意外〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I arrived only to find that the others had already left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到了之后却发现别人都已走了。

Sense.DEF: very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices have risen sharply, as we know only too well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都很清楚价格已经急剧上涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark was only too happy to agree with her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克完全赞同她。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was the only woman there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是那里唯一的女性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is our only child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是我们唯一的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was the only one who disagreed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是唯一的反对者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cutting costs is the only solution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低成本是唯一的解决办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s the only person for this job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是担任这项工作的唯一人选。

Sense.DEF: used when you are going to mention a problem or disadvantage
Sense.TRAN: 唯有一点是…/只有一个问题是…〔用于提出问题或缺点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could take you. The only thing is Dan might need the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以送你去﹐唯一的问题是丹可能要用车。

Sense.DEF: a child who has no brothers or sisters
used like ‘but’ to give the reason why something is not possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d offer to help, only I’m really busy just now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是想帮你的﹐但眼下我实在很忙。

Sense.DEF: a politician who is on-message says things that are in agreement with the ideas of his or her political party, especially when it appears that he or she is not thinking enough about these ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治人物的言论〕与所属党派的观点一致(的)﹐支持本党政治观点(的)〔尤指本人对这些观点未经过认真思考时〕

Sense.DEF: used in advertisements to show that you are willing to sell something for slightly less money than you have said in the advertisement
Sense.TRAN: 或最接近的价格﹐可还价〔广告用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bicycle for sale: £60 o.n.o.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售自行车: 60英镑﹐可还价。

Sense.DEF: happening sometimes and not at other times
Sense.TRAN: 时断时续的﹐时有时无的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an on-off relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 断断续续的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had an on-off obsession with Mikey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对米凯伊的痴迷时断时续。

Sense.DEF: an on-off switch is the thing you press to make a piece of electrical equipment start and stop working
the use of words that sound like the thing that they are describing, for example ‘hiss’ or ‘boom’
a road for driving onto a freeway
Sense.TRAN: 〔高速公路的〕驶进坡道[匝道]﹐上匝道

Sense.DEF: a strong fast movement forward, or the sudden development of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first onrush of the epidemic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流行病的首次爆发

Sense.DEF: appearing on a computer screen, or on a television or cinema screen
Sense.TRAN: 屏幕[荧幕﹐银幕]上的﹔在屏幕[荧幕﹐银幕]上
Sense.EXAMPLE: An on-screen tutorial is included in the price of the software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套软件的售价中包含一套视频教程的价格。
Sense.EXAMPLE: onscreen violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荧幕上的暴力

Sense.DEF: the beginning of something, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 某事的开始[发作]〔尤指不好的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the onset of winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天的来临

Sense.DEF: on the land, not in the sea
Sense.TRAN: 在陆地上(的)﹐在岸上(的)﹐在近岸处(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: onshore oil production
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆上石油生产

Sense.DEF: onshore winds are moving from the sea towards the land
in a position where you are allowed to play the ball in sports such as football
at the place or on the area of land that you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: on-site car parking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就地停车
Sense.EXAMPLE: Accommodation is provided on-site.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就地提供住宿。

Sense.DEF: a large violent attack by an army

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In December they launched a full-scale onslaught on the capital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 12月他们对首都发起了全面攻击。

Sense.DEF: strong criticism of someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his public onslaught on the Conservatives
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对保守党公开的猛烈批评

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He praised his wife for her dignity under the onslaught of the tabloid press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他称赞妻子在遭到低级小报的攻击时保持了尊严。

Sense.DEF: the effect of something that is unpleasant and could cause damage
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants that will survive the onslaught of winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熬得过严冬侵袭的植物

Sense.DEF: on the stage in a theatre
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even today I get nervous before I go onstage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到今天我上舞台前还是会感到紧张。

Sense.DEF: if something new comes on stream, it starts to be used or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Costs should fall as new technology comes on-stream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采用新技术之后﹐成本应该会降低。

Sense.DEF: while working, or at work
Sense.TRAN: 正在工作的[地]﹐在职的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: on-the-job training
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在职培训

Sense.DEF: done immediately while you are at a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors can often give on-the-spot treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生常常可以给予现场治疗。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object
Sense.EXAMPLE: She watched him walk onto the platform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着他走上站台。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t jump onto into the bus while it’s moving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在公共汽车开动时跳上车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pour the syrup on to the egg mixture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把糖浆倒进鸡蛋混合料中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car rolled over onto its side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车侧翻过来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s get back onto the highway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开回到公路上去吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a room, door, or window faces towards something or allows movement into another place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dining room looks out onto a pretty garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从饭厅望出去能看到一个漂亮的花园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gate leading on to a broad track
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往宽阔道路的大门

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: to speak to someone in order to tell them or ask them something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A number of people have been onto me complaining about the noise.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些人不断地向我抱怨噪声的事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Get onto the Press Office and find out what’s happening.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去新闻办公室问问发生了什么事。

Subsense.DEF: to know that a particular person did something wrong or committed a crime
Subsense.TRAN: 发现某人做了错事﹐发现某人犯了罪
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The police are onto him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察盯上他了。

Sense.DEF: informal

Subsense.DEF: to have discovered or produced something new and interesting
Subsense.TRAN: 发现新事物﹔制作出有趣的事物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: With the new show, we were onto something big.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着这出新剧的上演﹐我们将大有作为。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be onto a good thing/a winner
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think she’s onto a real winner with this song.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这首歌会使她大获成功。

Subsense.DEF: to be dealing with something or start dealing with something
Subsense.TRAN: 处理某事﹐开始处理某事
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get onto it right away.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上着手处理这件事。

Sense.DEF: a subject of study in philosophy that is concerned with the nature of existence
the responsibility for something

GramExa.PROPFORM: the onus is on sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The onus is on the prosecution to provide proof of guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 举证责任在于控方。

Sense.DEF: moving forward or continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company offers flights to Amsterdam with onward travel to The Hague.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司开设了飞往阿姆斯特丹并续飞海牙的航班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the onward march of science
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学的不断发展

Sense.DEF: beginning at a particular time or age and continuing after that
Sense.EXAMPLE: from the 1980s onwards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从20世纪80年代起

Sense.DEF: forwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked onwards to the head of the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直向前﹐走到湖泊源头。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the development, increase, or progress of something continues
Sense.TRAN: 持续发展﹔不断增加﹔不断进步
Sense.EXAMPLE: With exports strong, the business is moving onwards and upwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着出口的走强﹐公司蒸蒸日上。

Sense.DEF: a stone with lines of different colours in it, often used in jewellery
Sense.TRAN: 缟玛瑙〔常用于珠宝首饰〕

Sense.DEF: a large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got oodles of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有很多钱。

Sense.DEF: a sound that you make when you have been hit, especially in the stomach
Sense.TRAN: 哎哟﹐哎唷〔挨打时发出的声音﹐尤用于被打中肚子时〕

Sense.DEF: said when you think something is very beautiful, unpleasant, surprising etc
Sense.TRAN: 嗬﹐哇﹐呀〔觉得某事物很美丽﹑很讨厌﹑很令人惊讶等时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ooh, that’s nice!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哇﹐真不错！

Sense.DEF: said when you think that something or someone is surprising, unusual, or sexually attractive – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 嗬啦啦〔觉得某事或某人令人惊讶﹑异乎寻常或漂亮性感时的用语﹐幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes something attractive and exciting and that shows energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not a bad song, but it needs more oomph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首歌还不错﹐但还需要更多的活力。

Sense.DEF: said when someone falls or makes a small mistake
Sense.TRAN: 哎哟﹐啊呀〔某人摔倒或出了点小差错时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oops, I’ve spelt that wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐我拼错了。

Sense.DEF: said when a child falls
Sense.TRAN: 一﹑二﹑三﹐起来〔小孩摔倒时的用语〕

Sense.DEF: if a thick liquid oozes from something or if something oozes a thick liquid, that liquid flows from it very slowly
Sense.TRAN: 〔浓稠的液体〕渗出﹐慢慢地流出

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ice cream was melting and oozing out of its wrapper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰激凌在融化﹐从包装纸里渗出来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A cut on his cheek was still oozing blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上的伤口还在渗血。

Sense.DEF: to show a lot of a particular quality or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 充满﹐洋溢着〔某种特质或情感〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew laughed gently, oozing charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁温柔地笑着﹐充满了魅力。

Sense.DEF: very soft mud, especially at the bottom of a lake or sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指湖底或海底的〕淤泥﹐软泥

Sense.DEF: a very slow flow of liquid
soft and wet like mud
Sense.EXAMPLE: a black, oozy mess
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又黑又黏的粪便

Sense.DEF: a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s had a minor heart op.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了个小小的心脏手术。

Sense.DEF: the quality that something has when it is difficult to see through
the quality that something has when it is difficult to understand
a type of white stone with changing colours in it, often used in jewellery
Sense.TRAN: 蛋白石〔常用于珠宝首饰〕

Sense.DEF: having colours that shine and seem to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opalescent sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 色彩变幻的天空

Sense.DEF: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shower with an opaque glass door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装有不透明玻璃门的淋浴间

Sense.DEF: difficult to understand
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opaque style of writing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晦涩的写作风格

Sense.DEF: art that uses patterns which seem to move or to produce other shapes as you look at them
Sense.TRAN: 欧普艺术﹐视幻艺术﹐光效应艺术

Sense.DEF: an abbreviation used in formal writing to refer to a book that has been mentioned before
Sense.TRAN: 在前面所引用的书中﹐同上〔用于正式的文章中〕

Sense.DEF: an organization of countries that produce and sell oil
Sense.TRAN: 石油输出国组织﹐欧佩克

Sense.DEF: a page in a newspaper that has articles containing opinions on various subjects, or one of these articles
not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地打开门﹐往楼下跑去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打开的窗户
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gates swung silently open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门悄悄地打开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧的门猛地弹开﹐冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the windows were wide open completely open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的窗户都大开着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked at the open suitcase with surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她惊讶地看着打开的手提箱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an open bottle of wine on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌上有一瓶打开的葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: not closed, so that your eyelids or your lips are apart
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so sleepy, I couldn’t keep my eyes open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我困得眼睛都睁不开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was fast asleep with his mouth wide open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大张着嘴﹐睡得很熟。

Sense.DEF: not enclosed, or with no buildings, walls, trees etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was open ground at the end of the lane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小巷的尽头有一片开阔地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: open spaces such as parks and gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像公园和花园这类空地

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At weekends people want to leave the town for open countryside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了周末﹐人们就想离开城镇到开阔的乡村去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A shoal of fish swam past heading for the open sea part of the sea away from land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群鱼游过﹐朝外海游去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s performance is good, especially going fast on the open road a road without traffic where you can drive fast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车性能不错﹐在畅通无阻的道路上快速行驶时尤其出色。

Sense.DEF: without a roof or cover
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president was riding with his wife in an open car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统和他的夫人乘坐一辆敞篷车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Martin was struggling with the sails on the open deck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马丁在露天甲板上费力地扯着船帆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open drain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排水明沟

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many of the tombs had been robbed and left open to the sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多坟墓被盗﹐裸露在青天白日之下。

Sense.DEF: outdoors

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dancing was outside, in the open air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞会在户外举行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane wanted to rush to the door and get out into the open air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简很想冲到门口﹐到外面去。

Sense.DEF: ready for business and allowing customers, visitors etc to enter
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The offices are also open at weekends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办事处周末照常营业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the security alert, most of the firms affected were open for business on Monday morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全警报过后﹐大多数受到影响的公司都在星期一上午恢复营业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The villagers are anxious that their local school is kept open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村民们非常希望他们当地的学校能够继续办下去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I declare this exhibition open officially say that it is now open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宣布本次展览会开幕。

Sense.DEF: allowing everyone, or everyone in a group, to take part in something, know about something, or have a chance to win something
Sense.TRAN: 人人都可参加的﹐对公众开放的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The competition is open to all readers in the UK.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的所有读者都可以参加这次比赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: In many schools, governors’ meetings are not open to the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在许多学校﹐董事会议是不对公众开放的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discussion was then thrown open for the audience’s questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场讨论后来变成开放式﹐接受听众的提问。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开放式会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men’s race appears wide open anyone could win it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场男子赛跑胜负未定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting would fetch several hundred dollars on the open market a market in which anyone can buy or sell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画在公开市场上可卖到好几百美金。

Sense.DEF: if an opportunity, a possible action, a job etc is open to you, you have the chance to do it
Sense.TRAN: 〔机会﹑可能的行动﹑工作等〕可用的﹔可拥有的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job is being kept open for her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她仍有机会得到这份工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The 1960s was a period when greater opportunities were open to women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20世纪60年代﹐女性有了更多的机会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: So what other options are open to us?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么我们还有什么其他的选择？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is only one course of action open to the local authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方当局只有一个办法可以采用。

Sense.DEF: actions, feelings, intentions etc that are open are not hidden or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her father watched her with open admiration.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲以不加掩饰的赞赏目光看着她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: open hostility between the two nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国之间公开的敌对状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was calling for more open government when the government makes information freely available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党呼吁要有更多的政务公开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case will be tried in open court in a court where everything is public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个案子将进行公开审理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is an open secret it is supposed to be secret, but most people know about it that she is having an affair with another man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和另一个男人有染已是公开的秘密。

Sense.DEF: honest and not wanting to hide any facts from other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The couple are quite open with each other about their feelings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对夫妻彼此之间开诚布公。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was quite open about her ambitions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的志向相当坦白。

Sense.EXAMPLE: his friendly, open manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那友善而坦诚的态度

Sense.DEF: not fastened
Sense.EXAMPLE: the open neck of his shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敞开的衬衫领口
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing an open jacket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她敞着身上的夹克。

Sense.DEF: needing more discussion or thought before a decision can be made
Sense.EXAMPLE: The matter remains an open question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事仍待确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new rates of pay are open to negotiation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的工资还有待商议。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The test results are open to interpretation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 化验结果有待解释。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Officers investigating her death are keeping their options open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查她死因的警员暂时未下定论。

Subsense.DEF: likely to suffer from something or be affected by something
Subsense.TRAN: 易受某事物损害的﹐容易被某事物影响的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The magazine’s editor is open to criticism in allowing the article to be printed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该杂志的编辑会因允许刊登此文而遭受批评。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The regulations are open to abuse by companies.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些法规很容易被各公司滥用。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He has left himself open to accusations of dishonesty.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使自己陷于被人指责为不诚实的境地。

Subsense.DEF: willing to consider something new or to accept something new
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Teachers need to be open to children’s ideas.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师要乐于倾听儿童的各种想法。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The committee is open to suggestions.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会乐于接受各种建议。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The owners of the building want to sell and are open to offers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 业主想要出售大楼并欢迎报价。

Sense.DEF: if a road or line of communication is open, it is not blocked and can be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: We try to keep the mountain roads open all through the winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们力图保持山路在整个冬季都畅通。

Sense.DEF: spread apart instead of closed, curled over, etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: At night the flowers were open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里花开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson raised an open hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊举起摊开的手掌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sitting in bed with a book lying open with its pages apart so it can be read on his knees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐在床上﹐腿上放着一本摊开的书。

Sense.DEF: if you have an open mind, you deliberately do not make a decision or form a definite opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 开放的思想﹐不怀有成见
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s important to keep an open mind as you study the topic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究这个题目时﹐不抱成见很重要。

Sense.DEF: if something is open to question, there are doubts about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whether the new situation is an improvement is open to question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一新局面是否算是一种改善仍令人怀疑。

Sense.DEF: to be very pleased to see someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 热烈地欢迎/迎接某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike will be welcomed back into the team with open arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克归队将受到热烈的欢迎。

Subsense.DEF: an invitation to visit someone whenever you like
something that makes it easier for criminals to steal, cheat etc
Subsense.TRAN: 容易引来犯罪分子的情况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lack of security measures provides an open invitation to crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏安全措施为犯罪分子提供了可乘之机。

Sense.DEF: to be something that you know and understand very well
Sense.TRAN: 是…非常熟悉的事物﹐是…很了解的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The natural world was an open book to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自然界了如指掌。

Sense.DEF: there is an opportunity for someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schoolgirls are being told that the door is open to them to pursue careers in science.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女学生们被告知﹐她们是有机会从事科学事业的。

Sense.DEF: to keep looking or listening so that you will notice anything that is important, dangerous etc
Sense.TRAN: 睁大眼睛看/竖起耳朵听〔以便注意到重要的﹑危险的等事情〕

Sense.DEF: cloth with an open weave or texture has wide spaces between the threads
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack opened the window.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克打开窗户。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened the drawer of the desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拉开书桌的抽屉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She heard a door open and then close.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到有扇门开了又关上。

Sense.DEF: to unfasten or remove the lid, top, or cover of a container, package etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise opened a bottle of wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝开了一瓶葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened the letter and began to read it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开信读了起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were opening their presents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在拆礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark was about to open a beer when the doorbell rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克正要开一瓶啤酒﹐这时门铃响了。

Sense.DEF: to raise your eyelids so that you can see, or to be raised in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barry was awake long before he opened his eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴里睁开眼睛之前早就醒了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carrie smelled coffee and her eyes opened reluctantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡丽闻到了咖啡的味道﹐这才勉强睁开了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: to move your lips apart, or to be moved in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened his mouth but couldn’t think what to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他张开嘴﹐但想不出该说什么。

Sense.DEF: if a place such as an office, shop, restaurant etc opens or is opened, it starts operating or providing a service
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah had recently opened an office in Genoa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉最近在热那亚开办了一个办事处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: French and Scandinavian offices are due to open in the autumn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国和斯堪的纳维亚的办事处将在秋天开始办公。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Forestry Commission has opened a plant centre selling rare plants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 林业委员会开设了一个植物中心出售稀有植物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new arts centre has been a great success since it opened its doors a year ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新艺术中心自一年前开张以来经营得很成功。

Sense.DEF: to start business, letting in customers or visitors, at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time do the banks open?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行什么时候开门营业？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bakery opens early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家面包店开门很早。

Sense.DEF: to start an activity, event, or set of actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US attorney’s office has opened an investigation into the matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国联邦检察官已对此事展开了调查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An inquest into the deaths will be opened next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死因调查将于下周开始。

Sense.DEF: to make a document or computer program ready to use
Sense.TRAN: 打开﹐开启〔计算机文件或程序〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Click on this icon to open the File Manager.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 点击这个图标打开文件管理器。

Sense.DEF: if a meeting etc opens or is opened in a particular way, it starts in that way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hughes, opening the Conference, made a dramatic plea for peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休斯在大会开幕时对和平的呼吁令人印象深刻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The concert opens with Beethoven’s Egmont Overture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐会以贝多芬的《埃格蒙特序曲》开场。

Sense.DEF: to perform a ceremony in which you officially state that a building is ready to be used
Sense.TRAN: 为〔大楼等〕举行揭幕典礼﹔宣布…落成
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new County Hall building was officially opened by the King.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 郡议会新大楼由国王正式宣布落成。

Sense.DEF: to spread something out or unfold something, or to become spread out or unfolded
Sense.EXAMPLE: She opened her umbrella.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打开伞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John opened his hand to show her he wasn’t holding anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰摊开手掌﹐给她看他什么也没拿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The flowers only open during bright weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种花只在晴朗的天气里开放。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat down and opened my book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐下来打开书本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She opened the curtains pulled the two cur­tains apart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拉开帘子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave opened his arms stretched his arms wide apart to give her a hug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫张开双臂拥抱她。

Sense.DEF: to make it possible for cars, goods etc to pass through a place
Sense.TRAN: 开通﹐开放〔使汽车﹑货物等通过〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were clearing away snow to open the tunnel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在清扫积雪使隧道能够通行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The peace treaty promises an end to war and opens the borders between the two countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份和约承诺结束战争并开放两国的边境。

Sense.DEF: to start being shown to the public
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paula and Rachael star as mother and daughter in the play, which opens tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葆拉和雷切尔在今晚首演的剧中饰演一对母女。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film opened yesterday to excellent reviews.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片昨天公映﹐获得佳评。

Sense.DEF: to start an account at a bank or other financial organization by putting money into it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary was in the bank to ask about opening a current account.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽在银行里询问开立活期存款账户的事。

Sense.DEF: to start shooting at someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops opened fire on the rioters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队向暴徒开火。

Sense.DEF: to make an opportunity for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 给某事物以机会﹐给某事物敞开方便之门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Research on genes should open the door to exciting new medical treatments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基因研究应该会为开发令人振奋的新疗法创造机会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the record is successful, it could open doors for my career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张唱片如果畅销﹐就能为我的事业打开成功之门。

Sense.DEF: to make someone realize something that they had not realized before
Sense.EXAMPLE: The purpose of the training is to open managers’ eyes to the consequences of their own behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此次培训的目的是要让管理人员认识到自身行为的后果。

Sense.DEF: to be ready to consider or accept new ideas
to tell someone your real thoughts and feelings because you trust them
Sense.TRAN: (对某人)敞开心扉﹐(向某人)倾吐心事

Sense.DEF: it started to rain heavily

Exponent.DEF: used about a door, window, container, package, letter, your eyes, or your mouth
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I opened the door quietly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我轻轻把门打开。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was nervous about opening the letter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拆信的时候很紧张。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Open your mouth wide.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把嘴张大。

Exponent.DEF: to open a door, drawer, box etc with a key
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You need a key to unlock the safe.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要钥匙才能打开保险箱。

Exponent.DEF: to open a lid on a bottle, container etc by turning it
Exponent.TRAN: 拧开﹐旋开〔瓶子﹑容器等的盖子〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I carefully unscrewed the lid of the jar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小心地旋开罐子的盖。

Exponent.DEF: to open a drawer, window, cupboard etc using force
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The door was locked so we had to force it open.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 门锁着﹐我们只好硬把它撞开。

Exponent.DEF: to open a package by removing the paper that covers it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The children were busy unwrapping their Christmas presents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们正忙着拆圣诞礼物。

Exponent.DEF: to make something no longer fastened or tied, for example a seat belt or a piece of clothing
Exponent.TRAN: 松开﹐解开〔安全带﹑衣物等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He unfastened the top button of his shirt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解开衬衫最上面的扣子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was so full I had to undo my belt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我吃得太饱了﹐只好解开腰带。

Sense.DEF: if a room, door etc opens onto or into another place, you can enter that other place directly through it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door opens onto a long balcony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇门通往一个很长的阳台。

Sense.DEF: if a road, path, or passage opens out, it becomes wider
Sense.TRAN: 〔道路﹑小径或通道〕变宽﹐变开阔

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beyond the forest the path opened out into a track.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了森林﹐这条小径变成了一条较宽的小路。

Sense.DEF: if someone opens out, they become less shy
if opportunities open up, or a new situation opens them up, they become available or possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a microscope, a whole new world of investigation opens up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了显微镜﹐科学研究开启了一个崭新的世界。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new international agreement opens up the possibility of much greater cooperation against terrorism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新的国际协定为打击恐怖主义创造了更大的合作机会。

Sense.DEF: if someone opens up an area of land, they make it easier to reach and ready for development
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new road will open up 300 acres of prime development land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了这条新路﹐300英亩的优质开发地将得以开辟。

Sense.DEF: to open something that is closed, locked, or covered
Sense.EXAMPLE: Open up, this is the police!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开门﹐我们是警察！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He opened up his case and took out a clean sweater.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开箱子﹐拿出一件干净的毛衣。

Subsense.DEF: if a shop, office etc opens up or is opened up, someone starts it
if a shop, office etc opens up at a particular time, it starts business at that time

Sense.DEF: to start a discussion or argument
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article was written with the intention of opening up a public debate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写这篇文章的目的是引发公开的讨论。

Sense.DEF: if someone opens up a lead in a competition or race, they increase the distance or number of points by which they are winning
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛中在距离或得分上〕领先

Sense.DEF: to stop being shy and say what you really think
Sense.TRAN: 〔不再羞怯地〕开始畅所欲言﹐开始倾诉心事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last night was the first time that Ken had opened up about his feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚是肯第一次敞开心扉谈论自己的感受。

Sense.DEF: to start shooting
if a hole, crack etc opens up or is opened up, it appears and becomes wider
outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the summer, we camped in the open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天我们在野外露营。

Sense.DEF: information that is out in the open is not hidden or secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: By now the whole affair was in the open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今整件事情已经公开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never let her dislike for him come out into the open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从不把对他的反感表现出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these concerns need to be brought out into the open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些担心都需要公开讲出来。

Sense.DEF: one of the important international sports competitions, especially for golf, such as the British Open Championship and the US Open Championship, or for tennis, such as the French, US and Australian Open competitions
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指高尔夫球或网球的〕公开赛

Sense.DEF: television programmes which are presented by members of the public
Sense.TRAN: 公众主持的电视节目﹐开放式电视节目

Sense.DEF: happening or existing outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLE: open-air concerts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露天音乐会
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-air swimming pool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 室外游泳池

Sense.DEF: a legal case or other matter that is easy to prove or decide because the facts are very clear
Sense.TRAN: 容易解决的案件﹔容易决定的事情〔因为事实很明显〕

Sense.DEF: a bar at an occasion such as a wedding, where drinks are served free
Sense.TRAN: 〔在婚礼等场合提供饮料的〕免费酒柜[吧台]

Sense.DEF: an opencast mine is one where coal is taken out of holes in the ground near the surface, not from deep under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: opencast mining
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露天采矿

Sense.DEF: a day when a school or an organization invites the public to come in and see the work that is done there
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校或机构允许公众参观的〕开放日﹐参观日

Sense.DEF: the principle of allowing people and goods to move into a country freely
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家的〕对外开放政策﹐门户开放政策
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re pushing forward economic reform and an open-door policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在继续推行经济改革和对外开放政策。

Sense.DEF: the principle of allowing anyone to come to a place at any time, for example in order to discuss something
Sense.TRAN: 开门政策〔指欢迎任何人随时到某个地方去进行讨论等的做法〕

Sense.DEF: something that is open-ended does not have a definite answer or definite rules about how it must be done
Sense.TRAN: 无确定答案的﹔无限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-ended question
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无确定答案的问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: These interviews are fairly open-ended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些采访相当自由随意。

Sense.DEF: without a particular ending time
Sense.TRAN: 无最终期限的﹐无时间限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-ended agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无最终期限的协议

Sense.DEF: a tool that is used to open cans, bottles etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a can opener
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开罐器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle opener
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开瓶器

Sense.DEF: the first of a series of games in a sports competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔系列比赛的〕首场比赛﹐揭幕赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are hoping to win tomorrow’s opener against New Zealand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望明天与新西兰队的首场比赛能够获胜。

Subsense.DEF: as a beginning or first stage
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For openers, the band played a couple of old Beatles songs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一开场﹐乐队演唱了几首披头士乐队的老歌。

Subsense.DEF: used to give one reason, explanation etc for something, although there are others you might mention later too
Subsense.TRAN: 首先〔用来列举理由﹑作出解释等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s tough being a reporter. For openers, there are the long hours.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当记者是辛苦的﹐首先﹐工作时间很长。

Sense.DEF: awake, or with your eyes open
Sense.TRAN: 醒着的[地]﹔睁着眼睛的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lay there open-eyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她睁着眼睛躺在那里。

Sense.DEF: a single piece of bread with meat, cheese etc on top
Sense.TRAN: 露馅三明治﹐单片三明治

Sense.DEF: generous and friendly
Sense.TRAN: 慷慨的﹐出手大方的﹔友好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-handed offer of help
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慷慨地提出帮助

Sense.DEF: done with your hand open
Sense.EXAMPLE: an open-handed slap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一记掌掴

Sense.DEF: kind, sympathetic, and friendly
Sense.TRAN: 和善的﹐有同情心的﹐友好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They gave us an open-hearted welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们亲切地欢迎我们。

Sense.DEF: a medical operation in which doctors operate on someone’s heart, while a machine keeps the patient’s blood flowing
Sense.TRAN: 心脏直视手术﹐体外循环心脏手术

Sense.DEF: a day when a school or organization invites the public to come in and see the work that is done there
Sense.TRAN: 〔学校或机构的〕开放日﹐参观日
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents are invited to attend the open house next Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生家长被邀请参加下周四的学校参观日。

Sense.DEF: if it is open house at someone’s home, people are always welcome to visit at any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept open house for a wide range of artists and writers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他家总是热情接待各类艺术家﹑作家。

Sense.DEF: a party at someone’s house that you can come to at any time during a particular period
Sense.TRAN: 〔在规定的一段时间内可随时出席的〕家庭招待会﹐家庭派对
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re having an open house Sunday, noon to 5pm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期日我们举行家庭招待会﹐时间是中午到下午5点。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone who is selling their house lets everyone who is interested in buying it come to see it
the time when a new building, road etc is used for the first time, or when a public event begins, especially when it involves a special ceremony
Sense.TRAN: 〔新建筑﹑道路等的〕落成﹐启用﹐开通﹔〔公众活动的〕开幕式

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the official opening of the new theatre
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新剧院的正式落成典礼
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the opening of the Cannes film festival
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戛纳电影节的开幕式

Sense.DEF: a hole or space in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a narrow opening in the fence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 篱笆上的一个小缺口

Sense.DEF: the beginning or first part of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: at the opening of the trial
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判伊始

Sense.DEF: a job that is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are very few openings in scientific research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学研究领域很少有职位空缺。

Sense.DEF: a chance for someone to do or say something
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人说话或做事的〕良机﹐机会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His question left an opening for me to say exactly what I thought.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的问题正好给我一个机会说出自己真实的想法。

Sense.DEF: when something opens, or is opened

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was startled by the sudden opening of the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门突然打开﹐吓了我一跳。

Sense.DEF: first or beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: the opening match of the season
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季的首场比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the opening chapter of the book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书的第一章
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chairman’s opening remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席的开场白

Sense.DEF: the hours when a shop, bank, bar etc is open to the public
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑银行﹑酒吧等的〕营业时间﹐对外开放时间

Sense.DEF: the first night that a new play, film etc is shown to the public
Sense.TRAN: 〔新的戏剧﹑电影等的〕首演之夜﹐首映之夜

Sense.DEF: the time that a business opens to the public
