Sense.EXAMPLE: We arrived at the pub just before opening time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚好在酒馆开门之前到达。

Sense.DEF: when something is made less restricted and more available to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the opening up of opportunities for women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为妇女开放更多的机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the opening up of new areas to cultivation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开拓新的地区用于耕作

Sense.DEF: the price you pay to travel on a plane, train etc when this includes travel to a place and travel back from a different place
Sense.TRAN: “开颌式”来回票价〔乘飞机﹑火车等到一地﹐再从另一地返回的票价〕

Sense.DEF: a letter to an important person, which is printed in a newspaper or magazine, usually in order to protest about something
in a way that does not hide your feelings, opinions, or the facts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah talked openly about her problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉毫不掩饰地说起自己的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was openly critical of his colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他公开批评自己的同事。

Sense.DEF: goods that are bought and sold on the open market are sold publicly rather than privately
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting would fetch millions of dollars if it was sold on the open market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画在公开市场上出售的话可能卖到数百万美元。

Sense.DEF: a system which makes it easy to buy and sell goods with other countries, because there are few restrictions
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is now an open market within the European Union.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前在欧盟内有一个自由市场。

Sense.DEF: a marriage in which both partners accept that they will have sex with other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔夫妻之间同意各自可以有婚外性关系的〕开放式婚姻

Sense.DEF: a time when anyone is allowed to tell jokes, sing etc in a bar or club
Sense.TRAN: 即兴表演时间〔酒吧或夜总会里人人可讲笑话或唱歌等的一段时间〕

Sense.DEF: willing to consider and accept other people’s ideas and opinions
Sense.TRAN: 愿意考虑不同意见的﹔思想开明的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s quite open-minded about sex.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的性观念相当开明。

Sense.DEF: with your mouth wide open, because you are very surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔因惊讶或震惊而〕张大嘴的[地]﹐吃惊的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stared open-mouthed as the plane came down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们目瞪口呆地看着飞机下降。

Sense.DEF: an open-necked shirt is worn with the top button undone
the quality of being honest and willing to talk about things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the openness of American society
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国社会的开放

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her openness about her problems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己问题的坦率态度

Sense.DEF: the quality of being willing to accept new ideas or people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the importance of openness to change
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对变革持开明态度的重要性

Sense.DEF: the quality of not being enclosed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the vast openness of the African plains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲大平原的辽阔空旷

Sense.DEF: an open-plan office, school etc does not have walls dividing it into separate rooms
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公室﹑学校等〕敞开式的﹐无隔墙的

Sense.DEF: a primary election in the US in which any voter may vote for someone from any party
a prison that does not restrict the freedom of prisoners as much as ordinary prisons
Sense.TRAN: 〔对囚犯自由限制较少的〕开放式监狱

Sense.DEF: a single piece of bread with meat, cheese etc on top
Sense.TRAN: 露馅三明治﹐单片三明治

Sense.DEF: the time each year when it is legal to kill particular animals, birds, or fish as a sport

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the open season for deer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 猎鹿开禁期

Sense.DEF: a time when a lot of people criticize someone, or a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔针对个人或团体的〕自由批评期﹐言论开放期
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems to be open season on politicians just now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下政治人物好像成了众矢之的。

Sense.DEF: an easy way to achieve something that is usually very difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A university degree isn’t always an open sesame to a good job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学学位并非总是好工作的敲门砖。

Sense.DEF: open source software is provided free, and includes the language the program is written in, so that the people who use it can make changes to the software
Sense.TRAN: 开放源代码的〔一种免费提供的软件﹐内容包括编写该程序的语言﹐以便用户对软件进行修改〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: open source software such as Linux
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: Linux之类的源代码开放软件

Sense.DEF: a computer system that can be connected with similar computer systems made by other companies
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机〕开放系统〔可与其他公司开发的类似系统相连接〕

Sense.DEF: shoes that do not cover the end of your toes
a British university that teaches adult students mainly in their own homes by means of the Internet. It also runs residential courses.
Sense.TRAN: 开放大学﹐公开大学〔英国一所通过因特网为成年学生授课的大学﹐同时也提供住校课程〕

Sense.DEF: an official decision in a British court saying that the exact cause of someone’s death is not known
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国法庭作出的〕死因未定裁决
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury returned an open verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团作出了死因不明的裁定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said there was some doubt over the way Grant had died, and recorded an open verdict.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说对格兰特的死因存在疑问﹐因此作出了死因不明的结论。

Sense.DEF: a vowel such as /a/ that is pronounced with your tongue flat on the bottom of your mouth
Sense.TRAN: 开元音〔发音时舌位较低〕

Sense.DEF: an openwork object has a pattern of open spaces between the material that it is made from
Sense.TRAN: 透雕细工的﹐透孔样式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an openwork stone screen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镂雕石屏风

Sense.DEF: a musical play in which all of the words are sung
Sense.EXAMPLE: We go to the opera go to a performance of opera regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们常去听歌剧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opera singer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌剧演员

Sense.DEF: these plays considered as a form of art
a system which is operable is working
Sense.TRAN: 可运作的﹐可施行的﹐可使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Less than half the rail network was operable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有不到半数的铁路网可以使用。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition that is operable can be treated by an operation
a theatre where operas are performed
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Sydney Opera House
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悉尼歌剧院

Subsense.DEF: to use and control a machine or equipment
Subsense.TRAN: 使用﹐操作﹐操纵〔机器或设备〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Lewis family operated a number of boats on the canal.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯一家在运河上经营着几艘船。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Clive was experienced in operating the computers.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫对操作电脑很有经验。

Subsense.DEF: if a machine operates in a particular way, it works in that way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Check that the equipment is operating in a safe manner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 检查一下设备是否安全运转。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus is designed to operate in all weather conditions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种公共汽车的设计使它能够在各种天气条件下行驶。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most freezers operate at below -18˚C.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数冰柜制冷可达零下18摄氏度以下。

Subsense.DEF: if a business or organization operates in a particular place or way, it works in that place or way
Subsense.TRAN: 〔企业或机构在某处或以某种方式〕经营﹐营业﹐活动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a design company operating from offices in Seattle
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在西雅图办公楼里运营的一家设计公司

Subsense.EXAMPLE: A playgroup operates on the campus.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校园里开办了一个幼儿游戏班。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They were trying to reduce operating costs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在设法降低经营成本。

Subsense.DEF: to control a business or organization
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Nuns are operating an emergency hospital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修女们在经营一家急救医院。

Sense.DEF: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项新法规对我们不利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

Sense.DEF: to cut into someone’s body in order to repair or remove a part that is damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors had to operate to remove the bullet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生不得不开刀取出子弹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the surgeon who operated on Taylor’s knee
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给泰勒的膝部动手术的外科医生

Sense.HINTTRAN: A doctor does not ‘operate’ a part of a person’s body. He or she operates on it. 说医生给病人身体的某部位动手术时﹐不要用operate﹐而要用operate on:They need to operate on her stomach (NOT不说operate her stomach). 他们要给她的胃部动手术。

Sense.DEF: to do your job or try to achieve things in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people just can’t operate in noisy crowded conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人都无法在嘈杂拥挤的环境里工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Older children often like to operate independently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大一些的孩子通常都喜欢独立行事。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers or police officers are operating in an area, they are working in that area
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵或警察在某地区〕行动﹐执行公务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Security patrols now operate in some of the most dangerous parts of the city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前﹐治安巡逻队正在该城市最危险的一些地区执行任务。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: enemy submarines operating in the Mediterranean
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在地中海行动的敌军潜水艇

Sense.DEF: to have a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The foam operates as a very effective filter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些泡沫材料能起到很有效的过滤作用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s service manual is designed to operate as a guide for owners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车的维护手册被设计成具有用户指南的功能。

Sense.DEF: to have an effect on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the laws of evolution operating on each species
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对每一物种都产生作用的进化法则

Sense.DEF: an operating theatre
a system in a computer that helps all the programs in it to work together
a special table in an operating theatre which a person lies on when they are having an operation
a room in a hospital where operations are done
the process of cutting into someone’s body to repair or remove a part that is damaged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s going to need an operation on her ankle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要接受脚踝手术。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an operation for cancer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症手术

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had an operation to reduce the swelling in his brain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做了个手术以减轻脑部水肿。

Sense.DEF: a business, company, or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm set up its own property development operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商行成立了自己的房地产开发公司。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a microchip manufacturing operation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微芯片生产企业
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nolan and Barnes were both involved in the operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺兰和巴恩斯都参与了公司经营。

Sense.DEF: the work or activities done by a business or organization, or the process of doing this work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many small businesses fail in the first year of operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多小企业在经营的第一年就倒闭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Education Business Partnership has been in operation since 1989.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育商业合作组织从1989年起开始运营。

Sense.DEF: a set of planned actions or activities for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了专门目的而组织的〕行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN rescue operation started shortly after dawn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国的救援行动在破晓后不久就开始了。

Sense.DEF: the way the parts of a machine or system work together, or the process of making a machine or system work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aircraft’s engine operation was normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机引擎运转正常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Protective clothing must be worn when the machine is in operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器运转时﹐必须穿着防护服。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The device has a single button, allowing for easy operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个装置只有一个按钮﹐操作简便。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Careful checks must be made before the factory commences operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂开始运营之前必须进行仔细检查。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new investment system came into operation in 1999.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这套新的投资系统于1999年开始运作。

Sense.DEF: the way something such as a principle or law works or has an effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a clear example of the law of gravity in operation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 万有引力定律产生作用的明显例子

GramExa.GLOSS: begin to have an effect
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new rule comes into operation on February 1.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新规定于2月1日起生效。

GramExa.GLOSS: make something start to work
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使某事物开始工作[生效]
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A scheme is being brought into operation to see how these changes would work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在实施一项方案以观察这些变革会产生什么作用。

Sense.DEF: a planned military or police action, especially one that involves a lot of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指涉及众多人员的〕军事行动﹐警方行动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain will carry out a joint military operation with the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国将与美国实施联合军事行动。

Sense.DEF: an action done by a computer

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Harris had a hip operation in October.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里斯在10月接受了髋部手术。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The operation was carried out by a team of surgeons at Papworth Hospital.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术由帕普沃思医院的一个外科医生小组施行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is almost back to full fitness after a knee operation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他做过一个膝部手术﹐现已几乎完全康复。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The unit cares for patients recovering from major operations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该监护室护理大手术后待恢复的病人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He had to have his spleen removed in an emergency operation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不接受紧急手术﹐切除脾脏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an operation that is often performed

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘take an operation’. Say 而要说 have an operation.
Do not say 不要说 ‘make an operation’. Say 而要说 do an operation or 或 perform an operation.

Sense.DEF: working and ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boat should be operational by this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午这艘船应该可以使用了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new system became operational in March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的系统于3月份启用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our main offices are now fully operational.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的总部现已全面投入运营。

Sense.DEF: relating to the operation of a business, government etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔企业﹑政府等〕运作的﹐操作上的﹐经营上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patco accepted full responsibility for operational management.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕科同意全面负责经营管理。

Sense.DEF: the study of the best ways to build and use machines or plan organizations
working and able to be used
Sense.TRAN: 运作中的﹐工作着的﹔可使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only one runway is operative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一条跑道可以使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the steps to be taken before the scheme can become operative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划实施之前需要采取的步骤

Sense.DEF: used when you repeat a word from a previous sentence to draw attention to its importance
Sense.TRAN: 最重要的词﹐关键词〔用于重复前一句中的某个词﹐使人注意其重要性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new system offers fast solutions. Fast being the operative word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一新体系能够提供快速起效的解决方案。“快速”是关键词。

Sense.DEF: relating to a medical operation
Sense.EXAMPLE: patients undergoing operative procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在接受手术的病人

Sense.DEF: a worker, especially a factory worker – used in business
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指工厂的〕工人﹐技工〔商业用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s overseas operatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的海外工人

Sense.DEF: someone who does work that is secret in some way, especially for a government organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为政府部门服务的〕特工﹐特务﹐间谍﹐密探

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 中央情报局/联邦调查局/情报机构等的特工

Sense.DEF: someone who works on a telephone switchboard, who you can call for help
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello, operator? Could you put me through to Room 31?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

Sense.DEF: someone who operates a machine or piece of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器或设备的〕操作者﹐操作员

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 机器/计算机/无线电等操作者

Sense.EXAMPLE: computers which can be used by untrained operators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未经训练的操作者也可使用的电脑

Sense.DEF: a person or company that operates a particular business
Sense.EXAMPLE: new regulations affecting taxi operators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对出租汽车公司有影响的新规定
Sense.EXAMPLE: Julian travelled with Caribbean Connection, the UK’s leading Caribbean tour operator company that arranges holidays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱利安在加勒比联运——英国主要的加勒比旅游服务公司报了团去旅游。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a private operator running regular passenger services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家提供定期客运服务的私营公司

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at achieving things by persuading people to help or agree with them
Sense.TRAN: 善于摆布他人的人﹐精明圆滑的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monsieur Valentin was a formidable political operator.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦伦廷先生是个令人生畏的耍弄政治手腕的高手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may not look it, but Newman is a smooth operator someone who is good at persuading people but who you feel you cannot trust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然表面看不出来﹐但纽曼的确是个八面玲珑的取巧者。

Sense.DEF: a funny or romantic musical play in which some of the words are spoken and some are sung
relating to the eyes and the illnesses that affect them
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ophthalmic surgeon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼外科医生

Sense.DEF: the study of the eyes and diseases that affect them
a drug that contains opium. Opiates can be used to reduce severe pain and help people to sleep.
Sense.TRAN: 鸦片制剂﹐麻醉剂〔用于止痛和安眠〕

Sense.DEF: something that makes people stop thinking about the problems in their lives so that they stop trying to make their lives better – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔让人忘却生活中烦恼的〕慰藉物﹐(精神)麻醉剂〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hollywood movies were seen as an opiate for the people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好莱坞影片曾被视为人们的精神鸦片。

Sense.DEF: to say what your opinion is about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The headmistress opined that the trip would make a nice change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女校长认为这次旅行会是一个换换环境的好机会。

Sense.DEF: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He asked his wife’s opinion on every important decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凡是重要的决定他都会征求妻子的意见。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two women had very diffe-rent opinions about drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两位女性对毒品的态度截然不同。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when giving your opinion
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In my opinion, the law should be changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐该法律应当修改。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say I think ... rather than my opinion is ... or in my opinion ... . In questions, people usually ask what do you think? rather than what is your opinion?
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说I think...﹐而不说my opinion is...或in my opinion...。在问句中﹐人们一般说what do you think? 而不说what is your opinion?
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: What do you think of Cathy?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得凯茜这人怎么样？

Sense.DEF: judgement or advice from a professional person about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: When choosing an insurance policy it’s best to get an independent opinion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选择保险时﹐最好听听专家的独立意见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My doctor says I need an operation, but I’ve asked for a second opinion advice from a second doctor to make sure that the first advice is right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的医生说我需要开刀﹐不过我又征询了其他医生的意见。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They took the painting to get an expert opinion an opinion from someone who knows a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把这幅画拿去征求专家的意见。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a high/low/good/bad etc opinion of sb/sth
Sense.DEF: to think that someone or something is very good or very bad
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物评价很高/很低/很好/很差等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a very high opinion of Paula’s work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对葆拉的工作评价很高。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was firmly of the opinion that we should not give Jackson any more money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坚决主张不要再给杰克逊钱了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone seemed to have a different opinion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎每个人都有不同的观点。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We asked people for their opinions about the Olympics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们询问了大家对奥运会的看法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say what your opinion is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave his opinion only when asked.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有问他时他才会发表意见。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give your opinion, especially in a formal situation
gradually decide what your opinion is
the opinion that most people have about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The general opinion seems to be that the government has made a mess of the war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎大多数人都认为政府没有打好这场战争。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what ordinary people think about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: How much do newspapers influence popular opinion?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸对公众舆论有多大的影响？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My personal opinion is that his first film was better.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我个人认为他的首部电影更好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People have strong opinions about this subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对该话题持有坚定不移的观点。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: two people disagree
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He and Luke had a difference of opinion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和卢克意见相左。

Collocate.COLLOC: sth is a matter of opinion
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to say that you disagree, or that people disagree about something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s a very nice man.’ ‘That’s a matter of opinion,’ thought Sam.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “他这人很不错。”“各人自有看法吧。”萨姆心想。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in spite of what most people think
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Contrary to popular opinion, many cats dislike milk.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 与大家以为的不同﹐许多猫并不喜欢喝牛奶。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when giving your opinion, especially when you want to emphasize what you are about to say
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 敝人以为〔尤用于强调将表达的意见〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: In my humble opinion, he is the greatest sportsman Britain has produced.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃以为﹐他是英国有史以来最伟大的运动员。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not say what you really think

Collocate.COLLOC: opinion is divided as to/on/over sth
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: people have different opinions about it
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 人们对某事物意见不一

Collocate.COLLOC: everyone is entitled to their opinion
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used especially when politely disagreeing with what someone says
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 每个人都可以有自己的观点〔尤用于礼貌地表达不同意见〕

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘according to my opinion’. Say 而要说 in my opinion.
Do not say 不要说 ‘say your opinion’. Say 而要说 give your opinion or 或 express your opinion.

Sense.DEF: expressing very strong opinions about things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found him very arrogant and opinionated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他非常傲慢和固执。

Sense.DEF: people such as politicians or journalists who have a lot of influence on the way other people think
Sense.TRAN: 舆论引导者﹐舆论制造者〔指对他人的思维方式有巨大影响的人﹐如政治家﹑新闻记者等〕

Sense.DEF: the process of asking a large group of people the same questions in order to find out what most people think about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: An opinion poll showed that 70% of adults were against legalizing drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查显示﹐有70%的成年人反对将毒品合法化。

Sense.DEF: a powerful illegal drug made from poppy seeds. Drugs made from opium are used to reduce severe pain.
one of various small animals from America and Australia that have fur and climb trees
Sense.TRAN: 负鼠〔产于美洲和澳大利亚〕
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= opposite 在…的对面；对立的

Sense.DEF: someone who you try to defeat in a competition, game, fight, or argument
Sense.TRAN: 〔竞争﹑比赛﹑打斗﹑争执等的〕对手﹐敌手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Graf’s opponent in today’s final will be Sukova.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格拉芙今天的决赛对手将是苏科娃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: During the primary elections, McCain was Bush’s leading opponent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 初选时﹐麦凯恩是布什的主要对手。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In debate he was a formidable opponent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在辩论时他是一位难以应付的对手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is admired even by his political opponents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至受到政敌的钦佩。

Sense.DEF: someone who disagrees with a plan, idea, or system and wants to try to stop or change it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rodgers was not an opponent of the new airport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰斯并不反对建设新机场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outspoken opponent of gun control
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直言不讳反对枪支管制的人

Sense.DEF: a time that is suitable for doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waited, hoping for an opportune moment to discuss the possibility of a raise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我等待着﹐希望会有一个合适的时机讨论加薪的事。

Sense.DEF: done at a very suitable time
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opportune remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合时宜的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law reforms were opportune and important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律改革适时而重要。

Sense.DEF: using every opportunity to gain power, money, or unfair advantages – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 机会主义﹐投机取巧〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He accused the diary’s publishers of blatant opportunism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他指责这本日记的出版商公然地投机取巧。

Sense.DEF: someone who uses every opportunity to gain power, money, or unfair advantages – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 机会主义者﹐机会主义分子〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Voters dislike opportunists – politicians who change their policies according to opinion polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选民不喜欢机会主义分子——那些根据民意调查结果来改变方针的政客。

Sense.DEF: someone who commits a crime because they have a chance to, and not because they planned to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most burglars are opportunists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数入室盗窃者都是临时起意的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opportunist crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时起意的罪案

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the opportunist policies of wartime leaders
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 战时领导人的机会主义政策
临时起意的车内物品盗窃案

Sense.DEF: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rare opportunity to see inside this historic building
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参观这栋历史建筑内部的难得机会
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to take this opportunity to thank you all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想借此机会感谢各位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Games and songs provide an opportunity for classroom interaction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游戏和唱歌提供了课堂互动的机会。

Sense.DEF: a chance to get a job or improve your situation at work
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I was lucky enough to have the opportunity to travel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很幸运有这个旅行机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something you have a chance to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Several employees took the opportunity to retire early.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个雇员借此机会提前退休了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: do something very eagerly when you have the chance
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She saw an opportunity to speak to him, and seized it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到一个能同他说话的机会﹐便抓住了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not do something you have a chance to do
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dwyer never missed an opportunity to criticize her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 德怀尔从不错过任何批评她的机会。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The children should be given the opportunity to make their own choices.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该给孩子们自己选择的机会。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 提供/展现/创造一个机会

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a great opportunity to try new things.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是尝试新事物的好机会。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d been wanting to try sailing, and this seemed like the ideal opportunity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直想尝试帆船运动﹐看来这次是一个极好的机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very good opportunity
a very good opportunity that you will only get once
one you do not use
a number of chances to do something
as soon as possible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He decided to leave school at the earliest opportunity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决定一有机会就离开学校。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: whenever possible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She went to the museum at every opportunity.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一有机会就去博物馆。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a time when you can do something
a country where people have a lot of good opportunities
a very good opportunity that you will only get once

Sense.DEF: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding
Sense.EXAMPLE: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

Sense.DEF: to fight or compete against another person or group in a battle, competition, or election
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is opposed by two other candidates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有另外两名候选人和他竞争。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of oppose, be opposed to, and be against in spoken and written English. 英语口语和书面语中oppose﹐be opposed to和be against的使用频率。

This graph shows that it is much more usual in spoken English to say that you are against something, rather than to say that you oppose it or are opposed to it. This is because be against is more informal and more general than oppose and be opposed to, which often suggest not only disagreeing with and disapproving of something, but also taking action to prevent it. 本图表显示﹐英语口语中说“反对某事”时﹐大多使用be against﹐而少用oppose或be opposed to。这是因为相比而言﹐be against不那么正式且语义较为笼统﹐而oppose和be opposed to通常不仅表示不同意和不赞成某事﹐而且还含有采取行动加以阻止的意思。

Sense.DEF: to disagree with something such as a plan or system
Sense.TRAN: 反对某事物﹐不赞成某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of us are opposed to the death penalty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大多数人都反对死刑。

Sense.DEF: two ideas that are opposed to each other are completely different from each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The principles of capitalism and socialism are diametrically opposed completely opposite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义的原则与社会主义的原则截然相反。

Sense.DEF: used to compare two things and show that they are different from each other
Sense.TRAN: 与某事物相反﹐而非某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students discuss ideas, as opposed to just copying from books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们讨论观点﹐而不是单纯照搬课本。

Sense.DEF: opposing teams, groups, or forces are competing, arguing, or fighting against each other
Sense.TRAN: 对抗的﹐对立的﹐反对的﹐敌对的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opposing armies were preparing for war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌对双方的军队都在备战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Socialist Party has split into two opposing camps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党分裂成了两个对立的阵营。

Sense.DEF: opposing ideas, opinions etc are completely different from each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑意见等〕相反的﹐相对立的﹐截然不同的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Throughout the negotiations Hurst and Jevons took opposing views.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个谈判过程中﹐赫斯特和杰文斯所持的观点都是对立的。

Sense.DEF: if one thing or person is opposite another, they are facing each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The people sitting opposite us looked very familiar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐在我们对面的那些人看上去很面熟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the wall opposite the door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在门对面的墙上
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say that 不要说 one thing is ‘opposite to’ or 或 ‘opposite of’ another. Say that 而要说 one thing is opposite another: There’s a car park opposite the hotel. 酒店对面有一个停车场。

Sense.DEF: to act with someone in a film, especially as the two main characters
Sense.TRAN: 〔在影片中〕和某人联袂主演﹐和某人演对手戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: a comedy in which he stars opposite Julia Roberts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和朱莉娅•罗伯茨联袂主演的一部喜剧片

Sense.DEF: as different as possible from something else
Sense.TRAN: 对立的﹐截然相反的﹐完全不同的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为这药会让他睡觉﹐但是它却起了反作用。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at the opposite end of the scale/spectrum
GramExa.EXAMPLE: two parties at opposite ends of the political spectrum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治立场截然对立的两个党派

Sense.EXAMPLE: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 截然相反的是﹐阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a political philosophy that was opposite to everything she believed in
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和她的所有信仰相悖的一种政治哲学

Sense.DEF: the opposite direction, way etc is directly away from someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned and walked off in the opposite direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转身朝反方向走掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: But the sign was pointing the opposite way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可是指示牌却指着相反的方向。

Sense.DEF: the opposite side, corner, edge etc of something is on the other side of the same area, often facing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store was on the opposite side of the street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店在街对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drawing on the opposite page
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对页上的图画
Sense.EXAMPLE: They work at opposite ends of the country a long distance apart, so only see each other at weekends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们虽在同一国家工作﹐但各在一方﹐因此只能在周末见面。

Sense.DEF: the other sex. If you are a man, women are the opposite sex
Sense.EXAMPLE: members of the opposite sex
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 异性成员

Sense.DEF: someone who has the same job in another similar organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔在另一个类似的机构中〕居相同职位的人﹐职务对等的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a meeting with her opposite number at the Department of Health
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和卫生部同级官员之间的一次会议

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the opposite of ‘optimistic’?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “乐观”的反义词是什么？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s quite shy, the exact opposite of Becky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常害羞﹐和贝姬正好相反。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men were complete opposites – Simon tall and fair, Clive short and dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两人完全相反——西蒙高而白﹐克莱夫矮而黑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anything, the opposite was true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要说什么的话﹐那就是情况正好相反。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is it sensible to think of masculine/feminine as polar opposites exactly or completely opposite?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把阳刚和阴柔看成完全的对立面是否有道理？

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is completely different from what has just been said
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t feel sleepy at all – just the opposite, in fact.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点都不困——事实上正好相反。

Sense.DEF: used to say that often people who have completely different characters become friends or are attracted to each other
in a position on the other side of the same area
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hannah lives just opposite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉娜就住在对面。

Sense.DEF: strong disagreement with, or protest against, something such as a plan, law, or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a great deal of opposition to the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这场战争反对的意见很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They face opposition from local residents as well as from environmentalists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遭到了当地居民以及环境保护主义者的反对。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is confident in his ability to overcome all opposition with his personal charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他自信有能力以个人魅力来化解一切反对力量。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposals have aroused the opposition of teachers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些建议引起了教师们的反对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strong opposition resulted in rejection of the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在强烈反对下这项议案遭到否决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans to turn the site into a £600 million leisure complex have met with stiff opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将该处改造成造价六亿英镑的综合性休闲大楼的计划遭到了激烈的反对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much public opposition to the new law remained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对这项新法律仍存在普遍的反对情绪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Workers found themselves in opposition to local interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们发现自己与当地人的利益存在冲突。

Sense.DEF: in some countries such as Britain, the main political party in the Parliament that is not part of the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: the leader of the Opposition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对党的领袖
Sense.EXAMPLE: the three main opposition parties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个主要的反对党

Sense.DEF: in some countries such as Britain, a political party that is in opposition is in Parliament, but is not part of the government
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Socialists were elected to power after ten years in opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会党在野十年后当选执政。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the people who you are competing against
Sense.EXAMPLE: They played well against good opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们面对强敌打得很出色。

Sense.DEF: when two things are completely opposite

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the opposition between capitalism and socialism
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义和社会主义的对立

Sense.DEF: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have
Sense.EXAMPLE: native tribes oppressed by the authorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel unhappy, worried, or uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The gloom in the chapel oppressed her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小教堂的阴暗气氛使她感到压抑。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who are oppressed are treated unfairly or cruelly and are prevented from having the same rights as other people have
Sense.EXAMPLE: oppressed minorities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受压迫的少数民族

GramExa.GLOSS: people who are oppressed
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 受压迫者﹐被压迫的人民

Sense.DEF: someone who is oppressed feels unhappy, worried, or uncomfortable
when someone treats a group of people unfairly or cruelly and prevents them from having the same rights as other people have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They suffered years of political oppression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遭受了多年的政治压迫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the struggle against oppression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反抗压迫的斗争

Sense.DEF: powerful, cruel, and unfair
Sense.TRAN: 暴虐的﹐残酷的﹔不公平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oppressive military regime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴虐的军事政权

Sense.DEF: weather that is oppressive is unpleasantly hot with no movement of air
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oppressive heat of the afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午后逼人的暑气

Sense.DEF: a situation that is oppressive makes you unhappy, worried, or uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oppressive silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人难受的静默
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oppressive atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压抑的气氛

Sense.DEF: a person or group that treats people unfairly or cruelly, and prevents them from having the same rights that other people in society have
strong criticism or disapproval, especially expressed publicly
to choose one thing or do one thing instead of another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We finally opted for the wood finish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们选择了用木材作为终饰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many young people are opting to go on to college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年轻人都选择上大学继续深造。

Sense.DEF: to decide to join a group or system
Sense.TRAN: 决定加入﹐选择参加〔团体或制度〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees have the choice to opt in to the scheme.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工有权选择加入该计划。

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing a duty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t just opt out of all responsibility for the child!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能就这样对孩子完全撒手不管！

Sense.DEF: to decide not to be part of a group or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Britain wants to opt out of the new European regulations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国想选择不受欧盟新规定的约束。

Sense.DEF: if a school or hospital in Britain opts out, it decides to control the money that it is given by the government, instead of being controlled by local government
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国学校或医院〕自主管理政府拨给的经费〔而非由地方政府来管理〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the eyes
Sense.EXAMPLE: the optic nerve
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 视神经

Sense.DEF: relating to machines or processes which are concerned with light, images, or the way we see things
Sense.EXAMPLE: microscopes and other optical instruments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显微镜和其他光学仪器

PIC.HEADING: OPTICAL INSTRUMENTS 光学仪器
PIC.PICCONTENT: binoculars 双筒望远镜；opera glasses 观剧镜；magnifying glass 放大镜；telescope 望远镜；microscope 显微镜

Sense.DEF: computer software that recognizes numbers and letters of the alphabet which are written on paper, so that information from paper documents can be scanned into a computer
Sense.TRAN: 光学字符识别〔指可识别书写在纸上的数字和字母﹐从而能够把信息扫描进计算机的软件〕

Sense.DEF: a long thin thread of glass or plastic along which information can be sent through a phone or computer system, using light
a picture or image that tricks your eyes and makes you see something that is not actually there
someone who tests people’s eyes and sells glasses in a shop
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼镜店的〕验光师﹐验光配镜技师﹔眼镜商

Sense.DEF: someone who makes lenses for glasses
the scientific study of light and the way we see
the best or most suitable
a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Recent results must give some cause for optimism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来的成绩一定会让人产生某些乐观情绪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new sense of optimism in the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国内新出现的一种乐观主义情绪

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was optimism that an agreement could be reached.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一种乐观情绪﹐认为能够达成一项协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t share his optimism about our chances of success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对我们成功的希望不像他那样乐观。

Sense.DEF: someone who believes that good things will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an eternal optimist he always believes that good things will happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个永远的乐观主义者。

Sense.DEF: believing that good things will happen in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bankers are cautiously optimistic about the country’s economic future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行家对该国的经济前景持谨慎乐观的态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are still relatively optimistic that the factory can be saved.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然比较乐观地认为工厂能够得到挽救。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew took a more optimistic view.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁抱有更为乐观的想法。

Sense.DEF: thinking that things will be better, easier, or more successful than is actually possible
Sense.TRAN: 过于有信心的﹐过分乐观的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an optimistic estimate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐观的估计

GramExa.EXAMPLE: somewhat over-optimistic expectations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些过于乐观的期望

Sense.DEF: to improve the way that something is done or used so that it is as effective as possible
Sense.TRAN: 使最优化﹐使尽可能完善﹐使尽量有效
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need to optimize the use of available resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要充分利用手上的资源。

Sense.DEF: the best or most suitable for a particular purpose or in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: optimum conditions for growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最适宜生长的条件
Sense.EXAMPLE: This design makes the optimum use of the available space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一设计最大限度地利用了现有的空间。

Sense.DEF: a choice you can make in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a number of options available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有多种选择。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had two options.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有两种选择。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was not the only option open to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a range of options for cutting costs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列可降低成本的选择方案

GramExa.PROPFORM: one/another option is to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Another option is to rent somewhere for six months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个选择是在哪里租六个月。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had the option of staying for an extra year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可以选择再逗留一年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Teenage mothers often have no option but to have no other choice except to live with their parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 少女妈妈往往别无选择﹐只能与父母同住。

Sense.DEF: to wait before making a decision
Sense.TRAN: 暂不作决定﹐留有选择余地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m keeping all my options open for the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前我暂时不作任何决定。

Sense.DEF: one of the possible choices you can make when using computer software
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用计算机程序时的〕选项﹐选择
Sense.EXAMPLE: Select an option from the main menu.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从主菜单上选一项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a list of options
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一列选项

Sense.DEF: the choice which will be the least difficult, least strict, or need the least effort, which someone might choose because they are lazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is community service just a soft option for criminals?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区服务是否只是罪犯的一个轻松的选择？

Sense.DEF: the right to buy or sell something in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has agreed to buy 20 planes, with an option on a further 10.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已同意购买20架飞机﹐并拥有再买10架的选择权。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Connor now owns 302,000 shares and options.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 康纳现在拥有302,000份股份和期权。

Sense.DEF: one of the subjects that you can choose to study at school for an examination, or as part of a course at a college or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: advice on choosing your options
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对选择选修课的建议

Sense.DEF: something that is offered in addition to the standard equipment when you buy something new, especially a car
Sense.TRAN: 〔购买新设备﹐尤其是汽车时提供的〕附件﹐配件

Sense.DEF: the chance to buy or get something before anyone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve agreed to give us the first option on their apartment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同意给予我们那套房子的优先购买权。

Sense.DEF: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: three optional courses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三门选修课
Sense.EXAMPLE: The other excursions are optional.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Leather seats are an optional extra.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮座椅是可选配件。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that you don’t have to do sth rather than say it is optional.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说don’t have to do sth﹐而不说optional
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔You don’t have to wear a tie.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 领带不是非系不可。

Sense.DEF: someone who tests people’s eyes and orders glasses for them
when a person or group chooses not to join a system or accept an agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某项制度或协定的〕不参与﹐退出
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opt-out clause
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退出条款

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the government’s opt-out on the euro
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府不加入欧元体系的决定

Sense.DEF: when a school or hospital in Britain chooses to control its own money, instead of being controlled by local government
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的学校或医院从地方政府的控制下〕退出﹐脱离〔以便自行管理经费〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an opt-out school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱离地方当局财政管辖的学校

Sense.DEF: very beautiful, with a lot of decoration, and made from expensive materials
Sense.EXAMPLE: evening dresses in opulent fabrics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用华丽织物做成的晚礼服

Sense.DEF: very rich and spending a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Europe’s opulent elite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲富裕的精英阶层

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the size and opulence of the rooms
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房间的宽敞和豪华

Sense.DEF: a piece of music by a great musician, numbered according to when it was written
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据创作时间先后编号的大作曲家的〕编号作品 [乐曲]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beethoven’s Opus 95
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝多芬第95号作品

Sense.DEF: an important work of art by a famous writer, painter etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔著名作家﹑画家等的〕大作﹐杰作﹐主要作品

Sense.DEF: used between two words or phrases to show that either of two things is possible, or used before the last in a list of possibilities or choices
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shall we go out to the cinema or stay at home?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是出去看电影还是待在家里？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can have ham, cheese, or tuna.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以选择火腿﹑干酪或者金枪鱼。

GramExa.GLOSS: or something of the same kind
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 或其他什么的﹐诸如此类的什么
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you like a coffee or something?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想来杯咖啡什么的吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t involved in drugs or anything like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有涉毒之类的行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grapes are usually either green or red.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 葡萄一般要么是绿色﹐要么是红色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s going to do it whether we like it or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管我们喜欢与否﹐他都会去做这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must do the job yourself or else employ someone else to do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须自己做这件事﹐或者就雇别人去做。

Sense.DEF: used after a negative verb when you mean not one thing and also not another thing
Sense.TRAN: 也不﹐也不是﹐也没有〔用于含否定意思的动词后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t have a television or a video.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有电视机﹐也没有录像机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sonia never cleans or even offers to wash the dishes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼娅从不收拾整理﹐甚至都不会说她来洗碗。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something bad could happen if someone does not do a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wear your coat or you’ll catch cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿上外套﹐要不你会着凉的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hurry up or we’ll be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抓紧时间﹐不然的话我们要迟到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to defend myself or else he’d have killed me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只得自卫﹐否则他就把我杀死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better hand over the money, or else used to threaten someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把钱交出来﹐不然的话够你受的。

Sense.DEF: used to correct something that you have said or to give more specific information
Sense.TRAN: 即﹐那就是﹐或者说〔用于更正说法或给予更确切的信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s going to snow tomorrow, or that’s what the forecast says.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天要下雪﹐确切地说﹐气象预报是这样说的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John picked us up in his car, or rather his dad’s car which he’d borrowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰开着他的车——确切地说是问他爸爸借的车来接我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve cleaned it all up, or at least most of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们全部清扫了一遍﹐或者说至少是清扫了大部分。

Sense.DEF: used to prove that something must be true, by saying that the situation would be different if it was not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He must be at home, or his car wouldn’t be here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定在家里﹐否则他的汽车就不会在这里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s obviously not urgent or else they would have called us straight away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事显然不急﹐否则他们当即就打电话给我们了。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are guessing at an amount or number because you cannot be exact
Sense.TRAN: 或﹐或者〔表示对某个数量或数字不很确定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy was three or four years of age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这男孩三四岁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Donald leaving a minute or two ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到唐纳德一两分钟前离开的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a motel a mile or so down the road about a mile or possibly a little more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿这条路一直走﹐到大约一英里的地方有家汽车旅馆。

Sense.DEF: someone who does something or is doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actor someone who acts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: an inventor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发明家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a translator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 译者

Sense.DEF: something that does something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a calculator a machine which calculates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a word processor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字处理器

Sense.DEF: someone who the ancient Greeks believed could communicate with the gods, who gave advice to people or told them what would happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊的〕宣示神谕的人﹐传神谕者

Sense.DEF: a message given by an oracle
a person or book that gives advice and information – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 提供意见[信息]的人[书籍]〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: from or like an oracle
spoken, not written
Sense.EXAMPLE: oral history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口述的历史
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oral agreement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口头协议

Sense.DEF: relating to or involving the mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: oral hygiene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口腔卫生

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The drug should be taken orally after meals.
The statement may be given orally or in writing.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 声明可以用口头形式﹐也可以用书面形式。

Sense.DEF: a spoken test, especially in a foreign language
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got my French oral tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明天有法语口试。

Sense.DEF: a spoken test for a university degree
a drug that a woman takes by mouth, so that she can have sex without having a baby
the activity of touching someone’s sex organs with the lips and tongue, to give sexual pleasure
a dentist who performs operations in the mouth
a round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: orange juice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙汁
Sense.EXAMPLE: orange peel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 橙子皮
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peel the oranges and divide them into segments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把橙子去皮﹐然后切成片。
Sense.EXAMPLE: orange groves where orange trees grow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柑橘园

Sense.DEF: a colour that is between red and yellow
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bright shade of orange
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲜艳的橘黄色

Sense.DEF: a drink that tastes like oranges
an important college football game, held every year in Miami, Florida
Sense.TRAN: 橘子杯〔美国大学橄榄球赛一重要赛事﹐每年在佛罗里达州的迈阿密举行〕

Sense.DEF: a place, usually next to a large expensive house, where orange trees are grown
a large ape with long arms and long orange-brown hair
a formal public speech
someone who is good at making speeches and persuading people
a long piece of music in which a large group of people sing
the skill of making powerful speeches
a small building or part of a church where people can go to pray
a bright ball-shaped object, especially the Sun or the Moon
Sense.TRAN: 明亮的球体〔尤指太阳或月亮〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the red orb of the Sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红彤彤的太阳

Sense.DEF: a ball decorated with gold, carried by a king or queen on formal occasions as a sign of power
Sense.TRAN: 〔国王或女王在正式场合作为王权标志携带的〕宝球

Sense.DEF: to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The satellite orbits the Earth every 48 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这颗人造卫星每48小时绕地球运行一周。

Sense.DEF: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔环绕地球﹑太阳等运行的〕轨道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Moon’s orbit around the Earth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 月球环绕地球运行的轨道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Space Shuttle is now in orbit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航天飞机现已进入轨道。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The telecommunications satellite went into orbit at the end of last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年年底这颗通信卫星进入了轨道。

Sense.DEF: the area of power and influence of a person, organization etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: countries within the orbit of the British commonwealth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英联邦范围内的国家

Sense.DEF: relating to the orbit of one object around another
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Earth’s orbital path
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的运行轨道

Sense.DEF: an orbital road goes around a large city
Sense.EXAMPLE: the M25, London’s orbital motorway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第25号高速公路﹐伦敦的外环高速公路

Sense.DEF: a road that goes around a large city to keep the traffic away from the centre
a spacecraft that is sent into space to travel around the moon or a planet without ever landing on it. It carries equipment but not people and is designed to gather information.
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lunar orbiter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环月轨道器

Sense.DEF: a place where fruit trees are grown
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cherry orchard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 樱桃园

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: a large group of musicians playing many different kinds of instruments and led by a conductor
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Berlin Symphony Orchestra
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柏林交响乐团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school orchestra
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校管弦乐队

Sense.DEF: the area of seats in a theatre close to and on the same level as the stage
relating to or written for an orchestra
Sense.TRAN: 管弦乐队的﹔为管弦乐队创作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: orchestral music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 管弦乐

Sense.DEF: the space below the stage in a theatre where the musicians sit
Sense.TRAN: 〔剧场舞台前凹陷的〕乐池﹐乐队席

Sense.DEF: to organize an important event or a complicated plan, especially secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riots were orchestrated by anti-government forces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骚乱是由反政府势力策动的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carefully orchestrated promotional campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精心策划的广告宣传活动

Sense.DEF: to arrange a piece of music so that it can be played by an orchestra
Sense.TRAN: 将〔乐曲〕编配成管弦乐曲

Sense.DEF: a plant that has flowers which are brightly coloured and usually shaped
to officially make someone a priest or religious leader
Sense.TRAN: 正式任命〔某人〕为牧师﹐授予〔某人〕圣职
Sense.EXAMPLE: Desmond Tutu was ordained in 1960.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德斯蒙德•图图于1960年被任命为牧师。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The church voted to allow women to be ordained as priests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教会投票同意授予妇女圣职。

Sense.DEF: to order that something should happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The King ordained that deer should not be hunted without a royal licence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王下令﹐没有王室颁发的许可证不许猎鹿。

Sense.DEF: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 可怕的经历﹐痛苦的折磨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She then had to go through the ordeal of giving evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 此后她不得不经历提供证词的痛苦。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was forced to face the ordeal of withdrawal symptoms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被迫面对脱瘾症状的痛苦折磨。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术﹐而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时﹐又患了脑溢血。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

Subsense.DEF: for the purpose of doing something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Samuel trained every day in order to improve his performance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞缪尔为了提高成绩天天训练。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In order to understand how the human body works, you need to have some knowledge of chemistry.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想了解人体是如何工作的﹐你需要掌握一些化学知识。

Subsense.DEF: so that something can happen or so that someone can do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sunlight is needed in order for the process of photosynthesis to take place in plants.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物需要阳光来进行光合作用。

Sense.DEF: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Make sure that you put the books back in the right order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要把书按正确顺序放回去。

GramExa.PROPFORM: out of order/in the wrong order
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The files are all out of order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件的顺序都乱了。

GramExa.GLOSS: one after another, according to a plan
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then they call out our names in order and we answer yes or no.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后他们依次喊我们的名字﹐我们回答是或否。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their names are arranged in alphabetical order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的名字是按字母顺序排列的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cities are listed in order of importance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些城市是按重要性的顺序排列的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Students learn the verbs in order of difficulty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生按难易程度的顺序学习动词。

GramExa.GLOSS: starting with the lowest or highest number
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prices are given in ascending order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格按升序排列。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She read out the names in reverse order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她按相反的顺序念出名字。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

Sense.DEF: an instruction to do something that is given by someone in authority

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The captain had to give the order to abandon ship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船长不得不发出弃船的命令。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is under orders to have a complete rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接到命令﹐要她充分休息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was thrown into the river on the emperor’s orders.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照皇帝的命令﹐他被抛进河里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company cannot be identified by order of the court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院责令不得披露该公司的身份。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which rules are obeyed and authority is respected
Sense.EXAMPLE: the breakdown of law and order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治安陷入瘫痪
Sense.EXAMPLE: The riots are a threat to public order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴乱对公共秩序构成了威胁。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop people from behaving badly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 维持秩序/迫使某人遵守秩序
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The physics teacher couldn’t keep order in any class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名物理教师根本就维持不好课堂秩序。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had trouble keeping her teenage sons in order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她管不住她那几个十几岁的儿子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The army was called in to restore order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队奉命来恢复秩序。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which everything is controlled, well organized, and correctly arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s have some order in here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把这里整理一下吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to put your financial affairs in order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要安排好自己财务上的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps her room in good order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己的房间保持得很整洁。

Subsense.DEF: a request for food or drink in a restaurant or bar
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The waiter took our orders.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务生给我们点餐。

GramExa.GLOSS: the last time you can order a drink before a bar closes
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 〔酒吧关门前的〕最后一次点酒
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last orders now please!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在请最后一次点酒啦！

Subsense.DEF: the food or drink you have asked for in a restaurant or bar
Subsense.TRAN: 〔餐厅里〕所点的菜肴饮料﹔〔酒吧里〕所点的酒
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When our order finally arrived we were very hungry indeed.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们点的东西终于端上来时﹐我们已经饿坏了。

Subsense.DEF: a request by a customer for a company to supply goods
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Goods will be sent within 24 hours of receiving your order.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 货物将于收到贵方订单后24小时内发出。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can always cancel your order if you change your mind.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如改变主意﹐可随时取消订货。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government has placed an order for asked a company to supply new weapons.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府订购了新武器。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Please complete the enclosed order form.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请填写所附订购单。

GramExa.GLOSS: asked for, but not yet received
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 订购中的﹐已订购但尚未交货的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My bicycle is on order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的自行车已经下单订购了。

GramExa.GLOSS: produce something especially for a particular customer
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 按订货要求生产/供应客户订购的货物
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They make hand-made shoes to order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们按订货要求生产手工制作的鞋子。

Subsense.DEF: goods that you have ordered from a company
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Your order has arrived – you can collect it from the store any time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你订的货品已到﹐你可以随时到店提取。

Subsense.DEF: if a machine or piece of equipment is out of order, it is not working
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The phone is out of order again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话又坏了。

Subsense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour is out of order, it is unacceptable
to be breaking the rules in a committee, court, parliament etc
Subsense.TRAN: 违反〔委员会﹑法庭﹑议会等的〕规程
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The MP’s remarks were ruled out of order.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该议员的言论被裁定为违反规程。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that a machine or piece of equipment is not working or is broken rather than out of order .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐表示机器或设备发生故障时﹐人们一般说not working或broken﹐而不说out of order
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The phone’s not working.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话坏了。

Subsense.DEF: if something is in order, it is correct or right
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everything is in order.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切正常。

Subsense.DEF: to be a suitable thing to do or say on a particular occasion
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I hear congratulations are in order.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听说该向你道喜了。

Subsense.DEF: if an official document is in order, it is legal and correct
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is your passport in order?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的护照有效吗？

Subsense.DEF: if something that you do is in order, it is allowed by the rules in a committee, court, parliament etc
Subsense.TRAN: 符合〔委员会﹑法庭﹑议会等的〕规程

Sense.DEF: in good condition or working well
Sense.EXAMPLE: She keeps her bicycle in good working order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自行车保养得很好。

Sense.DEF: the political, social, or economic situation at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He called the rioters a threat to the social order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说那些暴乱分子是对社会秩序的一种威胁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The people of South Africa wanted a new order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南非人民需要新秩序。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He dared to challenge the established traditional order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敢于挑战传统秩序。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the order of the day

Subsense.DEF: to be suitable for a particular occasion or situation
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在某场合或情况中〕适宜﹐恰当
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Casual clothes are the order of the day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休闲服装很合时宜。

Subsense.DEF: to be very common at a particular time – used especially when you disapprove of something
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在某一时期〕变得很寻常﹐非常普遍〔尤用于不赞同某事时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sexual explicitness is the order of the day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露骨地谈论性话题如今已是司空见惯。

Sense.DEF: the way that life and the world are organized and intended to be
Sense.TRAN: 自然而然的事﹐理所当然的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: People accepted the class system as part of the natural order of things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们把社会等级制度看成天经地义的事。

Sense.LEXUNIT: of a high order/of the highest order
Sense.DEF: of a very good kind or of the best kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: an achievement of the highest order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最杰出的成就

Sense.DEF: to move away from the enemy in war in an organized way
Sense.TRAN: 〔打仗时从战线上〕有序地撤退

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the order of sth/of the order of sth
Sense.DEF: a little more or a little less than a particular amount, especially a high amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: a figure in the order of $7 million
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约700万美元的一个数字

Sense.DEF: a society of monks or nuns people who live a holy life according to religious rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Benedictine Order
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本笃会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the order of Jesuits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣会

Sense.DEF: to become a priest
an organization or a society whose members meet for secret ceremonies
a group of people who have received a special official reward from a king, president etc for their services or achievements
Sense.TRAN: 获得勋位的一批人﹐勋爵士团
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Order of the Garter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 获得嘉德勋位的勋爵士团

Sense.DEF: an official piece of paper that can be exchanged for money
people who belong to the lowest social class
a group of animals or plants that are considered together because they evolved from the same plant or animal
a list of jobs that a computer has to do in a particular order
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机的〕任务排序﹐等待队列

Sense.DEF: used to ask people to stop talking in a meeting or parliament
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议或议会开会时要求人 们停止说话时说的〕安静！安静！

Crossrefto.REFLEX: put/set your own house in order

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do not fire until I give the order.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没我的命令不要开火。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He refused to obey this order.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝服从这一命令。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: obey them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The men argued that they had only been following orders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些人争辩说他们只是在执行命令。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be given orders by them and obey them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don’t take orders from you!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不受你指挥！

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Anyone who disobeys these orders will be severely punished.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 违令者将受到严惩。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The soldiers had orders to shoot anyone on the streets after 10 o’clock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵奉命射杀任何10点以后上街的人。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a clear order
Collocate.EXAMPLE: What happens to a soldier who disobeys a direct order?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵不服从直接命令会怎么样？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They had strict orders not to allow anyone through.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们被严令禁止任何人通过。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when a judge in a court says you must do something
an order from a president
when the doctor says you must do something

Sense.DEF: to ask for food or a drink in a restaurant, bar etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在餐厅﹑酒吧等〕点﹐要〔食物或饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne ordered another glass of wine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮又点了杯葡萄酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you ready to order?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你准备好点菜了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat down and ordered a meal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐下来点了餐。

Sense.DEF: to ask for goods or services to be supplied
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve ordered a new computer from the supplier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向供应商订购了一台新的电脑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll order you a taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来给你预订一辆出租车。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: The court ordered his release from prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院下令放他出狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Stay right there,’ she ordered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “待在那儿。”她命令道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom was ordered to pay £300 as compensation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆被勒令支付300英镑作为赔偿。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her doctor had ordered her to rest for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的医生嘱咐她休息一个星期。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soldiers were ordered back to their units.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵接到命令要返回各自编队。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He ordered that the house be sold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吩咐把房子卖了。

Sense.DEF: to arrange something in an order
Sense.EXAMPLE: The list is ordered alphabetically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张清单是按字母顺序排列的。

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – MEANING 义项 3

Section.SECHEADING: TO TELL SOMEONE THEY MUST DO SOMETHING 告诉某人必须做某事

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone that they must do something, using your official power or authority
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A policeman ordered him to stop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名警察命令他停下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He ordered his men to put down their weapons.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他命令手下放下武器。

Exponent.DEF: to say to someone that they must do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stop telling me what to do!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再命令我了！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The headmaster told me to wait outside his office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长叫我在他办公室外面等着。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone exactly what they must do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police chief gave orders to shoot.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警长命令开枪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor gave instructions that she should rest as much as possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生嘱咐她尽量多休息。

Exponent.DEF: used about a high-ranking person such as a general, captain, or king ordering someone to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 命令〔用于将军﹑船长﹑国王等高级别人物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The general commanded the troops to fall back.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军命令部队撤退。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone to do something, especially when you tell them exactly how it should be done
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The architect was instructed to keep the plans simple.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 建筑设计师被指示图样要简明。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She took three tablets every day, as instructed by her doctor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遵照医嘱每天服三片药。

Exponent.DEF: to give someone an official or legal order to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The judge directed the jury to find her not guilty.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官指示陪审团裁定她无罪。

Exponent.DEF: to officially order someone to appear in a court of law in order to answer questions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Another three of the President’s advisors were subpoenaed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 又有三名总统顾问受传唤出庭。

Sense.DEF: to give someone orders in an annoying or threatening way
Sense.TRAN: 不断地支使〔某人〕﹐〔专横地〕将〔某人〕差来遣去
Sense.EXAMPLE: How dare he order her about like that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怎么敢那样使唤她？

Sense.DEF: to order soldiers or police to go somewhere to stop violent behaviour by a crowd
Sense.TRAN: 下令出动〔军队或警察制止暴乱等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor decided to order out the National Guard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长决定出动国民警衞队。

Sense.DEF: a record of how many goods or services a company has been asked to provide, which shows how successful it is financially
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来显示公司业绩的〕订货记录簿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our order books are full at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们的订货记录簿已经满了。

Sense.DEF: well arranged or controlled
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ordered existence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 井井有条的生活
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-ordered household
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 井然有序的家庭

Sense.DEF: the way in which something is arranged, or the act of arranging something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a different ordering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种不同的排列方式

Sense.DEF: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tools were arranged in orderly rows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工具被整齐地摆成几排。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She needs to organize her ideas in a more orderly way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要把自己的想法组织得更有条理些。

Sense.DEF: peaceful or well behaved

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The elections were conducted in an orderly fashion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举进行得有条不紊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They waited in a dignified and orderly manner outside the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们庄重而有序地在教堂外面等候。

Sense.DEF: someone who does unskilled jobs in a hospital
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院里从事简单工作的〕护理员﹐勤杂人员

Sense.DEF: a soldier who does unskilled jobs
if something is an order of magnitude greater or smaller than something else, it is ten times greater or smaller in size or amount
Sense.TRAN: 数量级〔一种量度标准﹐以十为底数表达﹐如某物比另一物大或小一个数量级﹐就是比它大或小十倍〕

Sense.DEF: the scale of the size of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a problem but this crisis is of a different order of magnitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个问题﹐但它与这次的危机却不可同日而语。

Sense.DEF: a list of subjects to be discussed in the British Parliament
one of the numbers such as first, second, third etc which show the order of things
Sense.TRAN: 序数〔如第一﹑第二﹑第三等〕

Sense.DEF: a law, usually of a city or town, that forbids or restricts an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a city ordinance that says parks must be closed at 11 p.m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规定公园须于夜间11点钟关闭的城市条例

Sense.DEF: an order given by a ruler or governing organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔统治者或统治机构发出的〕法令﹐法规
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Royal ordinance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敕令﹐圣旨

Sense.DEF: a person who is preparing to become a priest
Sense.TRAN: 将任圣职的人﹐圣职候选人

Sense.DEF: usually
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ordinarily, he didn’t like to go to the movies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般来说他不喜欢去看电影。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is not the price at which the CD is ordinarily sold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是这张CD平时卖的价格。

Sense.DEF: in an ordinary or normal way
average, common, or usual, not different or special
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just an ordinary camera.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是普通的相机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is about ordinary people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书描写的是普通人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Art should be part of ordinary life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它很不错﹐因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

GramExa.GLOSS: unusual or unexpected
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anything out of the ordinary made her nervous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何稍不寻常的事都会使她感到惶恐不安。

GramExa.GLOSS: as normal
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money is taxed as income in the ordinary way.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱作为收入按正常方式扣税。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say someone or something is very special
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人/某物可不是一般的…
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is no ordinary car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可不是普通的汽车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ruiz is no ordinary prisoner.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲁伊斯可不是一般的囚犯。

Sense.DEF: not particularly good or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought the paintings were pretty ordinary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为这些画相当平庸。

Sense.DEF: a low rank in the British navy
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国海军的〕二等水兵﹐见习水兵

Sense.DEF: the largest part of a company’s capital, which is owned by people who have the right to vote at meetings and to receive part of the company’s profits
Sense.TRAN: 普通股〔公司资本最大的一部分。 拥有普通股的股东可在股东会上投票及在公司赢利时分享红利〕

Sense.DEF: the act or ceremony in which someone is made a priest
Sense.TRAN: 授圣职(礼)﹐圣职授予仪式
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ordination of women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 授予妇女圣职

Sense.DEF: large guns with wheels
weapons, explosives, and vehicles used in fighting
Sense.TRAN: 军械〔如武器﹑弹药﹑军车等〕

Sense.DEF: a map which shows all the roads, paths, hills etc of an area in detail
dirt, especially waste matter from the body
rock or earth from which metal can be obtained
Sense.EXAMPLE: iron ore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁矿石
Sense.EXAMPLE: veins of rich ore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富矿脉

Sense.DEF: a plant used in cooking, especially in Italian cooking
Sense.TRAN: 牛至〔可用作调味品的植物﹐尤用于意大利烹调〕

Subsense.DEF: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肝脏﹑心脏及其他内脏器官
Subsense.EXAMPLE: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的生命器官供血不足
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

Subsense.DEF: a penis – used because you want to avoid saying this directly
a large musical instrument used especially in churches, with keys like a piano and large pipes that air passes through to produce the sound
an electronic musical instrument that produces music similar to a pipe organ, but that does not have pipes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an electronic organ
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电风琴

Sense.DEF: an organization that is part of, or works for, a larger organization or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The courts are organs of government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院是政府机构。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the decision-making organs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 决策机关

Sense.DEF: a newspaper or magazine which gives information, news etc for an organization or group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the official organ of the Communist Party
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共产党的官方宣传机构

Sense.DEF: very thin stiff cotton cloth, used as dress material
a musician who plays a barrel organ in the street
relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods
Sense.TRAN: 不使用化肥的﹐有机的﹐绿色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organic farming is better for the environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有机耕作对环境更有利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: organic gardening
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有机园艺

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The shop sells organic food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店出售有机食品。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: organic wine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有机葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: change or development which is organic happens in a natural way, without anyone planning it or forcing it to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s path to success was by means of organic growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司是通过逐步发展壮大走上成功之路的。

Sense.DEF: living, or produced by or from living things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adding organic matter such as manure can improve the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 施粪肥之类的有机物能够改良土壤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bacteria act on organic waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细菌对有机废物产生作用。

Sense.DEF: an organic system or relationship is one in which the parts or people fit well and in a comfortable way with each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: an organic relationship between the individual and his community
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 个体和他所在社区之间不可分割的关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: They believe in the organic unity of the universe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相信宇宙是一个有机的整体。

Sense.DEF: relating to the organs of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: organic diseases
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 器官疾病

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 用有机方法制作的奶酪
RunOn.EXAMPLE: A writer’s style must develop organically.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个作家的创作风格必定是逐步发展而来的。

Sense.DEF: the study of substances containing carbon
an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

Sense.DEF: a system made up of parts that are dependent on each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: A society is essentially an organism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从本质上来说﹐社会是一个有机的整体。

Sense.DEF: someone who plays the organ
Sense.TRAN: 管风琴手﹐管风琴演奏家
Sense.EXAMPLE: a church organist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂管风琴手

Sense.DEF: a group such as a club or business that has formed for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: The public expect high standards from any large organization.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众对任何大型机构都期望很高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the World Trade Organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界贸易组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: a voluntary organization which helps disabled people with their transport needs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帮助残疾人士满足其交通需求的一个志愿组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: an illegal terrorist organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法的恐怖组织
Sense.EXAMPLE: international organizations such as the UN
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诸如联合国之类的国际组织

Sense.DEF: planning and arranging something so that it is successful or effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: Putting on a show of this kind involves considerable organisation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 举行这样的演出需要做大量的组织工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The college has helped Anne with the organization of the event.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学院帮助安妮进行这次活动的筹备工作。

Sense.DEF: the way in which the different parts of a system are arranged and work together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There needs to be a change in the organization of the health service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗保健服务体制需要改革。

Exponent.DEF: a group of people, companies, or countries, which is set up for a particular purpose
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Greenpeace is an international organization that protects the environment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “绿色和平”是一个国际性环保组织。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the World Health Organization
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界衞生组织

Exponent.DEF: a large important organization such as a bank, church, or university
Exponent.TRAN: 〔银行﹑教堂﹑大学等重要的大型〕机构﹐团体
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The University is an important academic institution.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该大学是一所重要的学术机构。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: financial institutions such as banks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行之类的金融机构

Exponent.DEF: an organization for people in a particular profession, sport, or activity, which officially represents its members – often used in names
Exponent.TRAN: 〔某一专业﹑运动或活动的〕协会﹐社团〔常用于名称〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I met a representative of the National Association of Teachers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我遇到了全国教师协会的一位代表。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Football Association
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球协会

Exponent.DEF: an organization of people with the same political aims which you can vote for in elections
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Which political party do you support?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你支持哪个政党？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He voted for the Republican Party’s candidate.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他投票支持共和党候选人。

Exponent.DEF: an important group of people who make the rules and advise people about what should be allowed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔制定规则并提供咨询的〕团体﹐机构
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the sport’s governing body
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项运动的管理部门
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government has set up an advisory body.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府成立了一个咨询机构。

Exponent.DEF: an organization for people who share an interest, for example a sport
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We belong to a tennis club.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们属于一个网球俱乐部。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I joined the university film society.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我加入了大学电影协会。

Exponent.DEF: an organization formed by workers in order to protect their rights
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The union ordered its members out on strike.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会命令其成员罢工。

Exponent.DEF: an organization which collects money to help people who are poor, sick etc and does not make any profit for itself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has raised a lot of money for local charities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为当地慈善机构筹集了大量资金。

Exponent.DEF: an organization set up by the government, which has official power but whose members have not been elected
Exponent.TRAN: 准自治管理机构；半官方机构
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the amount of money that is wasted on government quangos
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 浪费于政府半官方机构的金钱数额

Sense.DEF: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively
Sense.EXAMPLE: The course was organized by a training company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

Sense.DEF: to manage a group of people who are doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lawyer helped to organize a group of parents who took action for their children.
