Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位律师帮助把一群为孩子而采取行动的家长组织起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scientists need to organize themselves and work as a team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些科学家要组织起来﹐作为一个团队来工作。

Sense.DEF: to arrange something so that it is more ordered or happens in a more sensible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t need you to organize his life for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不需要你来安排他的生活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organize yourself to arrive at places on time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要安排好时间﹐准时到达预定地点。

Sense.DEF: to arrange things in a particular order or pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are learning about how genes are organized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

Sense.DEF: to form a trade union or persuade people to join one
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law gives workers the right to organize and bargain collectively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律赋予工人组织工会和集体谈判的权利。

Sense.DEF: involving people working together in an effective and well-planned way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organized groups of citizens are more successful at changing the government’s mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有组织的公民团体更能说服政府改变主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organized networks of thieves are stealing cattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有组织的盗窃网络在偷牛。

GramExa.GLOSS: a religion that has lasted for a long time with leaders and many followers

Sense.DEF: arranged or ordered well, badly, carefully etc
Sense.TRAN: 组织良好的/很糟的/周密的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a carefully organized campaign
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精心筹划的宣传活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to work with a well-organized team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想和有良好组织性的团队一起工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly organized well-organized social system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高度组织化的社会体系

Sense.DEF: achieving your aims in a way that is effective, ordered, and sensible
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will take me a few days to get organized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要花几天时间来理清思路。

Sense.DEF: a large and powerful organization of criminals
Sense.EXAMPLE: Organized crime is involved in drug trafficking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪集团介入了贩毒活动。

Sense.DEF: someone who makes the arrangements for something that is planned to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organizers had expected about 50,000 people to attend the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织者原本预计约有五万人来听这场音乐会。

Sense.DEF: a drawing that shows the different ranks of the people working in an organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构内部的〕组织架构图﹐组织系统图

Sense.DEF: the greatest point of sexual pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: women who have never had an orgasm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从未有过性高潮的女性

Sense.DEF: extremely exciting or enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 极度兴奋的﹔令人非常愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orgasmic experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其愉快的经历

Sense.DEF: relating to orgasm
a wild party with a lot of eating, drinking, and sexual activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drunken orgies of their youth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们年轻时的纵酒狂欢会

Sense.DEF: sexual activity in a group
used to emphasize that people suddenly do a lot of a particular activity, especially far too much of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orgy of spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大肆挥霍
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orgy of violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滥用暴力

Sense.DEF: to give a lot of attention to one type of activity or one type of person
Sense.TRAN: 针对某事/某人﹐围绕某事/某人﹐以某事/某人为重点
Sense.EXAMPLE: a course that is oriented towards the needs of businessmen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对商业人士需求的一门课程
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the training is orientated around communications skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 培训的许多内容以沟通技巧为重点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The organization is strongly oriented towards research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该机构非常注重研究工作。

Subsense.DEF: to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看看街名﹐试图确定自己的方位。

Subsense.DEF: to become familiar with a new situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It takes new students a while to orientate themselves to college life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生要经过一段时间才能适应大学生活。

Sense.DEF: the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
Sense.TRAN: 东方（世界）〔尤指中国和日本〕

Sense.DEF: relating to or from the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
Sense.TRAN: 东方的〔尤指中国和日本的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beautiful oriental rug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的东方地毯
Sense.EXAMPLE: oriental art
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东方艺术

Sense.DEF: a word for someone from the eastern part of the world, especially China or Japan, now considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 东方人﹐亚洲人〔尤指中国人或日本人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who studies the languages and culture of oriental countries
Sense.TRAN: 〔研究东方国家语言和文化的〕东方学专家﹐东方通

Sense.DEF: a British word for orient1
a British word for oriented
the type of activity or subject that a person or organization seems most interested in and gives most attention to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company needs to develop a stronger orientation towards marketing its products.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司需要针对其产品的营销设定一个更为明确的目标。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can we get students to adopt a serious orientation to learning?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎样才能让学生对学习采取认真的态度呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was unhappy with the commercial orientation of the organization.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对该组织的商业目的很不满意。

Sense.DEF: the political opinions or religious beliefs that someone has
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治﹑宗教方面的〕观点﹐取向﹐倾向

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The meeting is open to everyone, whatever their political or religious orientation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个会议人人都可以参加﹐不论其政治或宗教倾向如何。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The party has a broadly socialist orientation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党大体上倾向于社会主义。

Sense.DEF: the fact that someone is heterosexual or homosexual
Sense.TRAN: 性取向〔指某人是异性恋还是同性恋〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Discrimination on the grounds of sexual orientation is still far too widespread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以性取向为理由的歧视仍然太普遍了。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which people are trained and prepared for a new job or course of study
Sense.TRAN: 〔新工作或学习课程开始前一段时间的〕培训﹐训练﹔迎新
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is orientation week for all the new students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是让全体新生熟悉情况的迎新周。

Sense.DEF: the angle or position of an object, or the direction in which it is facing
giving a lot of time, effort, or attention to one particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the younger students don’t seem to be politically oriented at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多年纪稍小的学生似乎对政治毫无兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s very career orientated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常有事业心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country’s economy is export oriented.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的经济是出口主导型。

Sense.DEF: a sport in which people have to find their way quickly across an area in the countryside that they do not know, using a map and a compass
Sense.TRAN: 定向运动﹐越野识途比赛〔一种靠地图和指南针快速寻找目的地的运动〕

Sense.DEF: one of the holes in your body, such as your mouth, nose etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: various bodily orifices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体上的各种孔洞

Sense.DEF: a hole or entrance
the Japanese art of folding paper to make attractive objects
the place or situation in which something begins to exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new theory to explain the origins of the universe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解释宇宙起源的一种新理论

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most coughs are viral in origin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 咳嗽大多由病毒引发。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The word is French in origin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词源于法语。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一传统源于中世纪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: old folk tales of unknown origin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起源不明的古老民间传说

GramExa.GLOSS: where something came from
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All meat should be clearly labelled with its country of origin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有肉类都要清楚地标出原产国。

Sense.DEF: the country, race, or type of family which someone comes from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two thirds of the pupils are of Asian origin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小学生中有三分之二是亚裔。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The form asks for information about the person’s ethnic origin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张表格要求填写本人所属族裔的信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Immigrants rarely return to their country of origin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民很少有人会返回出生国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She never forgot her humble origins low class or social position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从未忘记自己的卑微出身。

Sense.DEF: existing or happening first, before other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land was returned to its original owner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地归还给了原主。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen still has many original features parts that were there when the house was first built.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这间厨房仍保留着当初的许多特点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the original meaning of the word
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词的原意
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original plan was to fly out to New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原先的计划是飞往纽约。

Sense.DEF: completely new and different from anything that anyone has thought of before
Sense.TRAN: 新颖的﹐独特的﹔与众不同的﹐独创的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think George is capable of having original ideas!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为乔治不会有别出心裁的主意！
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s not a very original suggestion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个建议没什么新意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly original design
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常独特的设计
Sense.EXAMPLE: His work is truly original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品是真正原创的。

Sense.DEF: an original work of art is the one that was made by the artist and is not a copy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The original painting is now in the National Gallery in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原作现藏于伦敦的国家美术馆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an original Holbein drawing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍尔拜因的画作真迹

Sense.DEF: a work of art or a document that is not a copy, but is the one produced by the writer or artist
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术作品或文件的〕原作﹐原稿﹐原件
Sense.EXAMPLE: The colours are much more striking in the original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原作的色彩要鲜艳得多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll keep a copy of the contract, and give you the original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我将留一份合同副本﹐把原件给你。

Sense.DEF: in the language that a book, play etc was first written in, before it was translated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d prefer to read it in the original.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我更喜欢读它的原作。

Sense.DEF: someone whose behaviour, clothing etc is unusual and amusing
Sense.TRAN: 〔举止﹑服装等〕怪异滑稽的人﹐独特有趣的人

Sense.DEF: when something is completely new and different from anything that anyone has thought of before
Sense.TRAN: 独创性﹔创见﹔创造力﹔新颖

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was impressed by the originality of the plan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这个计划的新意印象深刻。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her earlier work shows a lot of originality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的早期作品显示出丰富的独创性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of his designs lack originality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的很多设计都缺乏创意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young writer of great originality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位极富创意的年轻作家

Sense.DEF: in the beginning, before other things happened or before other things changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The family originally came from France.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个家族最初来自法国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building was originally used as a prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑最初用作监狱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We originally intended to stay for just a few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们原先打算只逗留几天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Originally, we had planned a tour of Scotland but we didn’t go in the end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起先我们计划到苏格兰旅游﹐但最后没有成行。

Sense.DEF: the tendency to behave in bad or evil ways, which is in all people according to the Christian religion

Sense.GRAM: I always + adv/prep, not in progressive
Sense.DEF: to come from a particular place or start in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did the plan originate?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划最早是怎么想到的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of our medicines originate from tropical plants.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的许多药物源自热带植物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many Christmas traditions originated in Germany.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节的许多传统起源于德国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The idea originated with the ancient Greek philosophers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种观念起源于古希腊哲学家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town originated as a small fishing port.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市最初是一个小渔港。

Sense.DEF: to have the idea for something and start it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The technique was originated by an Italian artist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种技艺由一位意大利艺术家首创。

Sense.DEF: the person who first has the idea for something and starts it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Professor Adams was the originator of the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当斯教授是该项目的发起人。

Sense.DEF: a North American bird that is black with a red and yellow stripe on its wing
Sense.TRAN: 拟黄鹂〔产于北美洲﹐羽毛为黑色﹐翅膀带红黄色条纹〕

Sense.DEF: a European bird with black wings and a yellow body
Sense.TRAN: 金黄鹂〔产于欧洲﹐身体为黄色﹐翅膀为黑色〕

Sense.DEF: a gold-coloured mixture of metals that does not contain real gold
Sense.TRAN: 镀金用金箔﹐仿金箔(涂料)
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ormolu clock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镀金的时钟

Sense.DEF: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful
Sense.TRAN: 装饰品﹐点缀物﹐饰物﹐摆设
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shelf covered with books and ornaments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摆满书籍和装饰品的架子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cabinet in which she kept her collection of china ornaments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放置瓷器摆设收藏品的柜子

Sense.DEF: decoration that is added to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building style is plain, with very little ornament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该建筑风格朴素﹐极少使用装饰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coins were only ever used for ornament, not as currency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些硬币从来只用于装饰﹐而不作为货币使用。

Sense.DEF: to be decorated with something
Sense.TRAN: 用某物装饰﹐装饰有某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a silver goblet ornamented with pearls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缀有珍珠的银制高脚酒杯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a table richly ornamented with carvings
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雕刻繁复的桌子

Sense.DEF: designed to make something look attractive rather than to be used for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: ornamental gardens
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装饰性花园
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pillars in the centre are purely ornamental.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于中心的那些柱子纯粹是作装饰用的。

Sense.DEF: decoration on an object that makes it look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bronze plate with gold ornamentation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有金饰的青铜盘子

Sense.DEF: covered with a lot of decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ornate gold mirror
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华丽的金镜子

PIC.HEADING: ORNATE 华美的
PIC.PICCONTENT: an ornate mirror 华美的镜子

Sense.DEF: behaving in an unreasonable and often angry way, especially by doing the opposite of what people want you to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ornery kid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个坏脾气的小孩

Sense.DEF: someone who studies birds
the scientific study of birds
a child whose parents are both dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war has left thousands of children as orphans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场战争使成千上万的孩子成为孤儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a poor little orphan girl
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名可怜的小孤女

Sense.DEF: to become an orphan
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was orphaned when her parents died in a plane crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父母死于空难后﹐她便成了孤儿。

Sense.DEF: a large house where children who are orphans live and are taken care of
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was raised in an orphanage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是在孤儿院里长大的。

Sense.DEF: the skill or job of helping teeth to grow straight when they have not been growing correctly
a dentist whose job is to help teeth to grow straight when they have not been growing correctly
orthodox ideas, methods, or behaviour are accepted by most people to be correct and right
Sense.TRAN: 〔观念﹑方法或行为〕传统的﹐正统的
Sense.EXAMPLE: orthodox medical treatments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统疗法
Sense.EXAMPLE: He challenged the orthodox views on education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对传统的教育观念提出了质疑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is orthodox has the opinions and beliefs that are generally accepted as being right, and does not have new or different ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Orthodox economists believe that a recession is now inevitable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正统的经济学家认为经济衰退现在是无法避免了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orthodox Marxist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正统的马克思主义者

Sense.DEF: believing in all the traditional beliefs, laws, and practices of a religion
Sense.TRAN: 正统信仰的﹐正宗教义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orthodox Jew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正统的犹太教徒

Sense.DEF: an idea or set of ideas that is accepted by most people to be correct and right
Sense.TRAN: 正统观念﹐普遍接受的观点
Sense.EXAMPLE: He challenged the political orthodoxy of his time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对同时代的正统政治观念提出了质疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These ideas have now become part of educational orthodoxy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些观点现已成为正统教育理念的一部分。

Sense.DEF: the way in which words are spelled
relating to the medical treatment of problems that affect a people’s bones or muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: an orthopaedic surgeon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矫形外科医生
Sense.EXAMPLE: the orthopedic ward in the hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院的矫形外科病房

Sense.DEF: one that is designed to help treat medical problems that affect people’s bones or muscles
Sense.TRAN: 矫形床/矫形椅/矫形鞋等

Sense.DEF: the part of medicine that treats illnesses or injuries that affect people’s bones or muscles
a doctor with special train­ing in orthopedics
a place or thing that is used for doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an observatory a place from where people watch something, especially the stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天文台﹔观象台

Sense.DEF: describes something that does a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: an explanatory note that gives an explanation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注释
Sense.EXAMPLE: a congratulatory telegram that congratulates someone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贺电

Sense.DEF: a prize that is given each year in the US for the best film, actor etc in the film industry. It is officially called an Academy Award.
Sense.TRAN: 奥斯卡金像奖〔一年一度颁发的美国电影奖〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who got the Oscar won it for best actress?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁获得了奥斯卡最佳女演员奖？

Sense.EXAMPLE: The film won five Oscars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片荣获五项奥斯卡奖。

Sense.DEF: to keep changing between two extreme amounts or limits
Sense.TRAN: 〔在数量或限度之间剧烈地〕波动﹐摇摆﹐变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stock market is oscillating wildly at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票市场现在正急剧波动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His income oscillated between £1,500 and £2,000 a month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的月收入在1,500到2,000英镑之间浮动。

Sense.DEF: to keep changing between one feeling or attitude and another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her attitude towards me oscillated between friendship and hostility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对我的态度时而友好﹐时而敌对。

Sense.DEF: to move backwards and forwards in a regular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The needle on the dial began to oscillate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仪表盘上的指针开始来回摆动。

Sense.DEF: if an electric current oscillates, it changes direction very regularly and very frequently
oscillations are frequent changes between two extreme amounts or limits
Sense.TRAN: 〔数量或限度之间剧烈的〕波动﹐摇摆﹐变化

GramExa.EXAMPLE: oscillations in the value of the dollar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元价格的波动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: oscillations between growth and decline
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在增长和衰退之间的波动

Sense.DEF: formal oscillations are frequent changes between one feeling or attitude and another
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感或态度上的〕摇摆不定﹐犹豫不定
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug causes oscillations of mood in some people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药在一些人身上会引起情绪波动。

Sense.DEF: a regular movement of something from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: the oscillations of a pendulum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钟摆的摆动

Sense.DEF: a regular change in direction of an electrical current
a machine that produces electrical oscillations
a piece of equipment that shows changes in electrical voltage as a line on a screen
the plural form of the SUFFIX -osis
a willow tree whose branches are used for making baskets
a diseased condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: silicosis a lung disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矽肺
Sense.EXAMPLE: neuroses medical conditions that affect the mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经症

Sense.DEF: a condition or process
Sense.EXAMPLE: a metamorphosis change from one state to another
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 变形﹔变态

Sense.DEF: if you learn facts or understand ideas by osmosis, you gradually learn them by hearing them often

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Children learn new languages by osmosis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童在耳濡目染中学会新语言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems to absorb information through a process of osmosis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎是通过耳濡目染来吸收信息的。

Sense.DEF: the gradual process of liquid passing through a membrane
a type of large bird that kills and eats fish
to become unwilling to consider new ideas or change your behaviour
to change into bone or to make something change into bone
seeming to be the reason for or the purpose of something, but usually hiding the real reason or purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔理由或动机〕表面上的﹐貌似真实的﹐诡称的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ostensible reason for his resignation was ill health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 表面上他辞职的理由是身体欠佳。

Sense.DEF: if something is ostensibly true, people say that it is true but it is not really true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stayed behind at the office, ostensibly to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她留在办公室里不走﹐假装要工作。

Sense.DEF: when you deliberately try to show people how rich or clever you are, in order to make them admire you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her lifestyle was remarkably free from ostentation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的生活方式毫不张扬。

Sense.DEF: something that is ostentatious looks very expensive and is designed to make people think that its owner must be very rich
Sense.TRAN: 摆阔气的﹐讲排场的﹐铺张的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She carried her car keys on an ostentatious gold key ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把汽车钥匙挂在一个夸张的金钥匙圈上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ostentatious display of wealth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 张扬地炫耀财富

Sense.DEF: someone who is ostentatious likes to show everyone how rich they are
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was vain and ostentatious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很虚荣﹐爱摆阔。

Sense.DEF: relating to bones
a medical condition which makes your knees and other joints stiff and painful
someone who is trained to treat people using osteopathy
a way of treating medical problems such as back pain by moving and pressing the muscles and bones
a medical condition in which your bones become weak and break easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: the risk of developing osteoporosis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引发骨质疏松的危险

Sense.DEF: a man who took care of guests’ horses at a hotel in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔昔日旅店里照料客人马匹的〕马夫

Sense.DEF: if a group of people ostracize someone, they refuse to accept them as a member of the group
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was afraid that if she spoke up her colleagues would ostracize her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她担心﹐如果她说出来﹐同事们就会孤立她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was ostracized by the other students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受到其他学生的排斥。

Sense.DEF: a large African bird with long legs, that runs very quickly but cannot fly
someone who does not deal with difficult problems but tries to pretend that they do not exist
Sense.TRAN: 逃避现实者﹐不愿正视现实的人
the abbreviation of 缩写=over-the-counter〔股票交易〕场外的

Sense.DEF: used in advertisements for jobs to say that the employee will receive the complete pay only if they succeed in doing as much work or selling as many things as the employer wants them to, and will get less pay if they do not succeed
Sense.TRAN: 完成指标薪金﹐按指标薪金〔用于招聘广告中〕

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the second of two people or things, which is not the one you already have or the one you have already mentioned

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can’t find my other shoe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我找不到另一只鞋。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One man was arrested, but the other one got away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人被捕﹐但另一个逃脱了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He kept shifting awkwardly from one foot to the other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直笨拙地来回倒换双脚。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took it for granted that each knew who the other was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想当然地认为这两人互相认识。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to all the people or things in a group apart from the one you have already men­tioned or the one that is already known about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other hotels are all full.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的宾馆均已客满。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s much brighter than all the other children in her class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比班上所有其他孩子都要聪明得多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I chose this coat in the end because the other ones were all too expensive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我选择了这件外套﹐因为其他的都太贵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can see Julie, but where have all the others gone?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到朱莉了﹐可是其他人都去哪儿了？

Sense.DEF: used to refer to additional people or things of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are one or two other problems I’d like to discuss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有一两个别的问题我想讨论一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got some other friends I’d like to invite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还想邀请一些其他的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you any other questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还有别的什么问题吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: used when mentioning one or more examples
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The guests included, among others, Elizabeth Taylor and Michael Jackson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘉宾包括伊丽莎白•泰勒和迈克尔•杰克逊。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a different person or thing from the one you have already mentioned or the one that is already known about
Sense.EXAMPLE: David and Jessica were playing with two other children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维和杰茜卡在和另外两个小孩一起玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better change into some other clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好换别的衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you envy other women who seem to manage their lives better?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你羡慕其他看似能更好地安排自己生活的女人吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we discuss this some other time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能否换个时间讨论这个问题？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no other job I would rather do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有别的工作是我想干的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Saudi Arabia produces more oil than any other country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙特阿拉伯的石油产量高于其他任何国家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you will learn to show more respect for others other people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能学会更加尊重别人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some people are at greater risk than others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些人的风险比另一些人更大。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the thing that is opposite you, furthest from you, or moving away from you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can park on the other side of the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以在街对面停车。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lives at the other end of the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在这条路的另一头。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She drove off in the other direction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往相反的方向开走了。

Sense.DEF: apart from a particular person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth was known to no one other than herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了她自己之外﹐没有人知道真相。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t eat pork, but other than that he’ll eat just about anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不吃猪肉﹐但除此之外他几乎什么都吃。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the person involved in something is famous, impressive, or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 正是某人﹐恰恰是某人﹐居然是某人〔强调所说到的当事人很出名﹑令人敬佩﹑让人感到意外等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson’s defence lawyer was none other than Joe Beltrami.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊的辩护律师不是别人﹐正是乔•贝尔特拉米。

Sense.DEF: the opposite of what you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always thought that rugby was a rougher game than football, but in fact it’s the other way round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直以为橄榄球比足球粗野﹐但事实正好相反。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students practise translating from French to English and the other way around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们练习法语和英语互译。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happened recently, without saying exactly when
Sense.TRAN: 那天/那天早上/那个星期等〔表示发生在最近的某个时候﹐但不说明具体是什么时候〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw Rufus the other day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前些天我看见了鲁弗斯。

Sense.DEF: used when you are not being specific about which thing, person, place etc you mean
Sense.TRAN: 某事物/某人/某个地方等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be here somewhere or other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它会在这里的某个地方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll get the money somehow or other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会有办法弄到这笔钱的。

Sense.DEF: used when you are expressing an idea or opinion again in a different and usually simpler way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tax only affects people on incomes of over $200,000 – in other words, the very rich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项税只影响收入在20万美元以上的人﹐也就是说非常有钱的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: So he is a fraud, a common thief in other words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所以他是个骗子﹐也就是说﹐是个惯偷。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a woman with whom a man is having a sexual relationship, even though he already has a wife or partner
Sense.TRAN: 〔和已婚或有女友的男人发生性关系的〕那个女人﹐第三者
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left his wife and child and moved in with the other woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他离开妻儿﹐搬去和那个女人住了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: on the one hand...on the other hand

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use other after ‘an’. Use another.
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要用an other﹐要用another
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There must be another way of doing it.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 做此事肯定还有其他的方法。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not add ‘s’ to other when using it before a plural noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: other用在复数名词之前时﹐不能加s
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: children from other countries (NOT 不说 others countries)
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自其他国家的孩子

Sense.DEF: when something is strange and different
used when saying what bad thing will happen if something is not done
Sense.TRAN: 否则﹐要不然 〔指如果不做某事﹐就会发生不好的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to go now, otherwise you’ll miss your bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在就得走﹐要不然就赶不上公共汽车了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put your coat on, otherwise you’ll get cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿上外套﹐不然你会着凉的。

Sense.DEF: used when saying what would have happened or might have happened if something else had not happened
Sense.TRAN: 否则﹐要不然〔指如果某事没有发生﹐就会发生另一事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were delayed at the airport. Otherwise we would have been here by lunch time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在机场耽搁了﹐否则午饭前就可以到这里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got two free tickets to Canada, otherwise they’d never have been able to afford to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得到两张去加拿大的免费机票﹐不然的话他们根本没有钱去。

Sense.DEF: to say, think, or decide something different
Sense.TRAN: 并非如此说/认为/决定等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government claims that the economy is improving, but this survey suggests otherwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府宣称经济状况在好转﹐但这份调查显示情况并非如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people think otherwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人并不这么认为。

Sense.DEF: except for what has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他除了累身体很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能听见远处车流的声音﹐除此之外﹐一切都很安静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to the opposite of what has just been mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: We welcome any comments from viewers, favourable or otherwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对观众的任何意见﹐或褒或贬﹐都表示欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truth or otherwise of this diagnosis would be revealed in the future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一诊断是否正确将来总会明了。

Sense.DEF: busy doing something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid I will be otherwise engaged that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕那天我要忙别的事情。

Sense.DEF: also called
Sense.EXAMPLE: Albert DeSalvo, otherwise known as the Boston Strangler
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伯特•德萨尔沃﹐又称“波士顿杀人魔”

Sense.DEF: in a different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who smoke or otherwise abuse their bodies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟或以其他方式糟蹋自己身体的人

Sense.LEXUNIT: it cannot be otherwise/how can it be otherwise?
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is impossible for something to be different from the way it is
Sense.TRAN: 不可能是别的/怎么可能会是别的？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life in the military is hard – how can it be otherwise?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队生活是艰苦的﹐怎么可能不艰苦呢？

Sense.DEF: relating to religious thoughts and ideas rather than with normal daily life
unnecessary
Sense.TRAN: 多余的﹐无用的﹐不必要的

Sense.DEF: remarks, behaviour etc that are OTT are so extreme or unreasonable that they seem stupid or offensive
Sense.TRAN: 〔言行等〕过于夸张的﹐过分的﹐荒唐的

Sense.DEF: an animal with smooth brown fur that swims in rivers and eats fish
a piece of furniture like a large box with a soft top, used as a seat, for resting your feet on when you are sitting, or for storing things
Sense.TRAN: 褥榻﹐〔可存放东西的〕软垫椅

Sense.DEF: a small room in an old castle where prisoners were kept for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔古堡中长期关押囚犯的〕土牢﹐地牢

Sense.DEF: a sound that you make when you feel sudden pain
Sense.TRAN: 哎唷〔突然感到疼痛时的叫声〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ouch! That hurt!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎唷！ 好疼！

Sense.DEF: a way of saying ‘ought to’ – used especially in writing to show how it is pronounced by some people
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐应当〔ought to的一种说法﹐尤用于书面﹐表示某些人如此发音〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You oughta tell your mom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该告诉你妈妈。

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式=‘ought not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: You oughtn’t to drive if you’re tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你累了就不该开车。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something because it is the best or most sensible thing to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really ought to quit smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的应该把烟戒了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company ought to be making changes in its marketing strategy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司应该在营销策略上作出改变了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What sort of crimes ought the police to concentrate on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方应当集中打击哪一类罪案？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You were out enjoying yourself when you ought to have been studying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该学习的时候你却在外面玩。

Sense.DEF: used to make a suggestion about something you think is a good idea, especially in a social situation
Sense.TRAN: 应该〔用于提出建议﹐尤在社交场合〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ought to get together some time soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该尽快聚一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You ought to meet him; he’s really nice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该见见他﹐他真的不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We ought to get her some flowers for her birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应当送她些花祝贺她的生日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I ought to call Brian.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该给布赖恩打个电话。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something or something should happen, because it is morally right or fair
Sense.TRAN: 应该﹐应当〔做符合道德规范或公平的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You ought to be ashamed of yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应当感到羞耻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The courts ought to treat black and white defendants in exactly the same way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭应当对黑人和白人被告一视同仁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many people felt that America ought not to take part in the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人认为美国不应该加入这场战争。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think something will probably happen, is probably true etc
Sense.TRAN: 应该〔表示某事可能会发生﹑可能属实等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left two hours ago, so he ought to be there by now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是两小时前离开的﹐所以现在应该到那里了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They ought to win – they’ve trained hard enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该能赢﹐他们训练得够刻苦的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That ought to be enough potatoes for eight people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些土豆应该够八个人吃了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: New technology ought to make this easier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术应当能使这事变得容易些。

Sense.DEF: a board with letters and signs on it, which some people believe can be used to receive messages from dead people
Sense.TRAN: 灵应牌﹐通灵板〔一种上面有字母和符号的乩板﹐一些人相信它能接收亡灵信息〕

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 28.35 grams. There are 16 ounces in a pound.
Sense.TRAN: 盎司〔等于28.35克﹐一磅为16盎司〕

Sense.DEF: any sense, truth etc at all
Sense.TRAN: 一点头脑/真实性/体面等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you had an ounce of sense you wouldn’t believe him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是有一点头脑就不会相信他！

Sense.DEF: all the courage, energy etc that you have
Sense.TRAN: (最后剩下的)全部勇气/精力/力量等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every ounce of attention was focused on our common goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把全部的精力集中于共同的目标上。

Sense.LEXUNIT: an ounce of prevention (is worth a pound of cure)
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to prevent a problem before it happens than to try to solve it after it has happened

Sense.LEXUNIT: not an ounce of fat (on sb)
Sense.DEF: if there is not an ounce of fat on someone, they are thin and usually look healthy
Sense.TRAN: (某人身上)没有多余的肉﹐(某人)瘦得很健康

Sense.DEF: belonging to or connected with us
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of our grandchildren
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们孙辈的一张照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can stay at our house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以住在我们家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must preserve our natural environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须保护我们的自然环境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must each take responsibility for our own actions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都必须对自己的行为负责。

Sense.DEF: used to show that the person mentioned is your child, brother, or sister – used in northern England
Sense.TRAN: 我们的﹐我家的〔英格兰北部使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our Sharon did really well in her exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家莎伦考试考得非常好。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with us
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll show you to your room. Ours is next door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我带你去你的房间﹐我们的房间在你的隔壁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main difference between our brains and those of monkeys is that ours are bigger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的大脑和猴子的大脑之间的主要差别在于我们的要大些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, that’s not ours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐那不是我们的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Thackers are friends of ours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 撒克一家是我们的朋友。

Sense.DEF: used by the person speaking to show that they and one or more other people are affected by their own action
Sense.EXAMPLE: We prepared ourselves for the long journey ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为将要开始的长途旅行做好了准备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was strange seeing ourselves on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在电视上看到自己感觉很奇怪。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize ‘we’ or ‘us’
Subsense.TRAN: 我们自己﹐我们亲自〔用于强调we或us〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We built the house ourselves.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们自己盖了这房子。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As parents ourselves, we understand the problem.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身为家长﹐我们理解这个问题。

Subsense.DEF: used after ‘as’, ‘like’, or ‘except’ instead of ‘us’
Subsense.EXAMPLE: More help is needed for people like ourselves.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像我们这样的人需要更多的帮助。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We weren’t supposed to play by ourselves near the pond.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不可以独自在池塘边玩耍。

Subsense.DEF: without help from anyone else
Subsense.TRAN: 我们独力地﹐单靠我们自己地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I knew that Tim and I wouldn’t be able to do the whole job by ourselves.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道单靠蒂姆和我是无法完成全部工作的。

Sense.DEF: without having to share something with any other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had the house to ourselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们完全拥有这栋房子。

Sense.DEF: describes something that has a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: dangerous full of danger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的
Sense.EXAMPLE: spacious with a lot of space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽敞的

Sense.DEF: to force someone out of a position of power, especially so that you can take their place
Sense.TRAN: 强迫〔某人〕放弃职权﹐把…撵走〔尤指为取而代之〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were finally ousted from power.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最终被赶下了台。

Sense.DEF: when someone is removed from a position of power or from a competition – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 罢免﹐废黜﹐撤职〔用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ouster of the brutal dictatorship
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 推翻残暴的独裁统治

Sense.DEF: from inside an object, container, building, or place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She opened her suitcase and took out a pair of shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她打开手提箱﹐拿出一双鞋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lock the door on your way out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你出去时把门锁上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Out you go used to order someone to leave a room!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我出去！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The keys must have fallen out of my pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙一定是从我口袋里掉出去的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Get out of here!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚出去！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone had torn several pages out of her diary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人从她的日记本上撕去了几页。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I’d have the courage to jump out of a plane.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我是没有勇气从飞机里往外跳的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the roads out of the city were snowbound.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出城的所有道路都被大雪封住了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The egg cracked open and out came a baby chick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋壳裂开了﹐出来一只小鸡。

Sense.DEF: not inside a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the homeless have been sleeping out for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多无家可归者常年露宿街头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children were out playing in the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在外面雪中玩耍。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brrr, it’s cold out there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呵﹐外面好冷啊。

Subsense.DEF: away from your home, office etc, especially for a short time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Did anyone call while I was out?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不在时有人来过电话吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My parents are both out at the moment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这会儿我父母都出去了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He went out at 11 o’clock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他11点出去的。

Subsense.DEF: to or in a place that is not your home, in order to enjoy yourself
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You should get out and meet people.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该出去认识些人。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Let’s eat out tonight eat in a restaurant.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们出去吃吧。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: At first he was too shy to ask her out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起先他很害羞﹐不敢约她出去。

GramExa.GLOSS: go to places where you can meet people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most teenagers would rather be out and about with their friends.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数青少年都宁愿和朋友们出去玩。

Subsense.DEF: in or to a place that is far away or difficult to get to
Subsense.TRAN: 在[到]很远的地方去﹔在[去]很难到达的地方
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He went out to New Zealand.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他远赴新西兰。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They’ve rented a farmhouse right out in the country.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在偏僻的乡下租了一间农舍。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how far away something is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The Astra Satellite is travelling some 23,000 miles out in space.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿斯特拉卫星在2.3万英里以外的太空中运行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a little village about five miles out of Birmingham
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离伯明翰大约五英里远的一座小村庄

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is given to many people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The examination will start when all the question papers have been handed out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试卷全发完后考试就开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you sent out the invitations yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把请柬发出去了吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone gets rid of something or makes it disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you thrown out yesterday’s paper?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把昨天的报纸丢掉了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mother used washing soda to get the stains out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈用洗涤碱除去污迹。

Sense.DEF: a fire or light that is out is no longer burning or shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the lights out when you go to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你上床前把灯关掉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firefighters arrived, and within minutes the fire was out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防员赶到﹐几分钟后火就被扑灭了。

Sense.DEF: if the sun, moon, or stars are out, they have appeared in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the sun came out, a rainbow formed in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳出来时﹐天空中出现了一道彩虹。

Sense.DEF: if the flowers on a plant are out, they have opened
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s still February and already the primroses are out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 才2月份﹐报春花就已经开放了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is done carefully or completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent all morning cleaning out the kitchen cupboards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了一个早上清理厨房里的橱柜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the summer months the soil dries out quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天的时候土壤干得很快。

Sense.DEF: not included in a team, group, competition etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Welsh team was surprisingly knocked out in the semi finals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔士队出人意料地在半决赛中被淘汰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Daniels will be out of the team until he recovers from his injury.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔斯要到养好伤以后才能归队。

Sense.DEF: used to say where something comes from or is taken from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of good music came out of the hippy culture in the 1960s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多优秀音乐来源于20世纪60年代的嬉皮士文化。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money is automatically taken out of your bank account every month.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这钱每月自动从你的银行账户里转出。

Sense.SIGNPOST: AWAY FROM THE EDGE OF STH
Sense.DEF: away from the main part or edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swam out into the middle of the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我游到湖中央。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A long peninsula juts out into the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座长长的半岛伸入海中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stuck her head out of the window to see what was happening.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把头探出窗外看看发生了什么事。

Sense.DEF: if a machine, piece of equipment etc is out, it is not working
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑设备等〕出了毛病的﹐发生故障的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t believe it – the elevator’s out again!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直无法相信﹐电梯又坏了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that a product is available to be bought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the new Harry Potter book out yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一部《哈利•波特》出版了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sony have brought out a new portable music system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼公司推出了一款新式的便携式音响系统。

Sense.DEF: no longer in a particular state or situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s not completely cured, but at least she’s out of danger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她尚未痊愈﹐但至少已经脱离了危险。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This whole situation is getting out of control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个形势正在失控。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How long have you been out of work now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在已经失业多久了？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Karen waved until the car was out of sight too far away to be seen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦挥着手﹐直到汽车再也看不见了。

Subsense.DEF: having left the institution where you were

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a kid just out of college
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个刚刚大学毕业的年轻人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife isn’t out of hospital yet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子还未出院。

Subsense.DEF: no longer in prison
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Once he was out, he returned to a life of crime.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一出狱就再次走上了犯罪道路。

Sense.DEF: no longer fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t wear that – maxi skirts have been out for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能穿那个﹐长裙早就过时了。

Sense.DEF: no longer a secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her secret was out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的秘密已经公开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word’s out that Mel Gibson is in town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有消息透露说梅尔•吉布森在城里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eventually the truth came out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真相终于大白。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a voice that is loud enough for others to hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone called out my name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人大声喊我的名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all listened as he read the statement out loud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声宣读声明的时候我们都听着。

Sense.DEF: not conscious
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fainted – she was out for about ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她晕倒了﹐昏迷了大约十分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How hard did you hit him? He’s out cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把他打得有多重？他完全昏迷了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is none of something left because you have used it all, sold it all etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The album was sold out within minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑没几分钟就卖完了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re out of milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没牛奶了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve run out of ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想不出主意了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: before the day/year etc is out
Sense.DEF: before the day, year etc has ended
Sense.TRAN: 在一天/一年等过去之前
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t cry, I’ll be back before the week’s out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别哭﹐我不出一周就回来了。

Sense.DEF: if a measurement, result etc is out, it is wrong because the numbers have not been calculated correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was out in his calculations, so there was a lot of carpet left over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他算错了﹐所以地毯还剩下很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill was out by over £10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单算错了十多英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their forecast was way out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的预测完全不准。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be out for sth/be out to do sth
Sense.DEF: to have a particular intention
Sense.TRAN: 试图得到某物/力图做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Andrew’s just out for a good time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德鲁很想痛快地玩一玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was convinced he was out to cheat me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信他想欺骗我。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone, especially a political party, no longer has power or authority
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we voted the Republicans out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是我们把共和党选下台的时候了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party has been out of office for a long time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党已经在野很久了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has stopped working as a way of protesting about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The railway workers have come out in sympathy with the miners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路工人也起来罢工支持矿工。

Sense.DEF: if a homosexual is out, they have told people that they are homosexual
Sense.TRAN: 公开承认自己是同性恋者

Sense.DEF: if a particular suggestion or activity is out, it is not possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t have enough money to rent a car, so that’s out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有足够的钱租车﹐所以那样不行。

Sense.DEF: when the tide is out, the sea by the shore is at its lowest level
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can walk across the sands when the tide is out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 退潮后你可以从沙滩上走过去。

Subsense.DEF: a player or team that is out in a game such as cricket or baseball is no longer allowed to bat
Subsense.TRAN: 〔板球或棒球比赛中选手或球队〕出局
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sussex were all out for 365.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨塞克斯队得了365分后便全部出局了。

Subsense.DEF: a ball that is out in a game such as tennis or basketball is not in the area of play
Subsense.TRAN: 〔网球或篮球运动等的球〕出界

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to say something which they have been unwilling to say or have difficulty saying
Sense.TRAN: 说出来！〔要某人说出难以启齿的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, out with it! What really happened?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐说呀！到底出了什么事？

Sense.DEF: because of a particular feeling that you have

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They obeyed him out of fear rather than respect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们服从他是出于畏惧而不是尊敬。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just out of curiosity, why did you take that job?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只是因为好奇问一问﹐你为什么接受那份工作？

Sense.DEF: used to say what substance or mate­rials a particular thing is made of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tombstone carved out of black marble
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用黑色大理石雕刻成的墓碑
GramExa.EXAMPLE: toy boats made out of old tin cans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用旧锡罐做的玩具小船

Sense.DEF: used to say how common something is, or how large a part of a group you are talking about

GramExa.PROPFORM: nine out of ten/three out of four etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nine out of ten students pass the test first time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门考试十个学生中有九个第一次就通过了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Apparently they’ve lost three games out of seven already.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来他们已经输了七场比赛中的三场。

Subsense.DEF: slightly unhappy because you feel different from the rest of a group of people and cannot share their fun, conversation etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因为和周围的人格格不入而觉得〕不自在﹐不是滋味
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit out of it because I was the only one who couldn’t speak French.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到有点不自在﹐因为我是唯一不会说法语的人。

Subsense.DEF: unable to think clearly because you are tired or drunk, or have taken drugs
Subsense.TRAN: 〔因疲惫﹑酒醉或吸毒而〕神志不清﹐昏昏沉沉
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You were really out of it last night. What were you drinking?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你昨晚脑子很不清醒。你喝了什么？

Subsense.DEF: in a place that could be anywhere except here
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My real father is out there and one day I plan to find him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的生父就在某个地方﹐我打算哪天去找他。

Subsense.DEF: where someone or something can be noticed by many people
Subsense.TRAN: 在那里〔在大家都会注意到的地方〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jerry Lewis is out there all the time raising money for disabled kids.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里•刘易斯总是在那里为残疾孩子募捐。

Subsense.DEF: an idea, work of art etc that is out there is so unusual that it might seem silly or extreme
Subsense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑艺术作品等〕古怪的﹐出格的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s brilliant, but some of his ideas are really out there.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很聪明﹐但有些想法真的很出格。

Subsense.DEF: in front of something, especially a building, where everyone can see you
Subsense.TRAN: 前面〔人人都能看到的地方﹐尤指大楼前面〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s a blue car out front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前面有一辆蓝色的汽车。

Subsense.DEF: taking a leading position
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As a civil rights leader, he was always out front.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一位民权领袖﹐他一直承担着领导责任。

Subsense.DEF: very honest and direct
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Molly is very out front in talking about her mistakes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫莉讲到自己的错误时非常坦率。

Sense.DEF: from the inside to the outside of something – many teachers of British English consider it incorrect to use ‘out’ as a preposition
Sense.TRAN: 从…里面出去﹐离开…〔许多英国英语教师认为把out作为介词使用是不正确的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen looked out the window at the back yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯伦从窗口往后院看去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get out the car and push with the rest of us!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下车﹐和我们一起来推！

Sense.DEF: to publicly say that someone is homosexual when that person would prefer to keep it secret
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several gay politicians have been outed in recent months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几个月有好几名政客被曝光是同性恋。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is difficult to hide a murder, the truth etc
Sense.TRAN: 谋杀案/真相等终将水落石出！

Sense.DEF: an excuse to avoid doing an activity or to avoid being blamed for something
Sense.TRAN: 推托的借口﹐逃脱的托词
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m busy on Sunday, so that gives me an out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天我很忙﹐这就给了我一个借口。

Sense.DEF: an act of making a player in baseball lose the chance to score a point
arguing or not agreeing with someone
Sense.TRAN: (与某人)不和的﹐(和某人)争吵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wilson is on the outs with his family because of his relationship with that woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊因为和那个女人的关系而与家人不和。

Sense.DEF: used to form nouns and adjectives from verbs that are followed by ‘out’
Sense.TRAN: 〔与后接out的动词构成名词和形容词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outbreak of flu from ‘break out’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 流感的爆发
Sense.EXAMPLE: outspoken comments from ‘speak out’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直言不讳的评论

Sense.DEF: outside or beyond something
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outbuilding small building away from the main building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔附属于正屋的〕外屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: outlying areas far from the centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边远地区

Sense.DEF: being or becoming bigger, further, greater etc than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s outgrown his clothes become too big for them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他个子长高了﹐衣服都穿不下了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She outlived her brother he died before her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比她哥哥活得久。

Sense.DEF: doing better than someone, so that you defeat them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can out-argue you any day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我任何时候都辩得过你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She outran him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比他跑得快。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which a service such as the electricity supply cannot be provided
Sense.EXAMPLE: a power outage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停电期

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone is definitely a particular kind of person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s an out-and-out liar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个十足的骗子。

Sense.DEF: the Australian countryside far away from cities, where few people live
Sense.TRAN: 〔澳大利亚远离城市﹑人烟稀少的〕内地

Sense.DEF: to offer a higher price than someone else, especially at an auction
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在拍卖中〕出价高过〔别人〕

Sense.DEF: a motor attached to the back end of a small boat
moving away from you or away from a town, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 向外去的﹔向城外的﹔向国外的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outbound traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出城的车流
Sense.EXAMPLE: the outbound flight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离港航班

Sense.DEF: the place in a computer email program where messages that you have not sent yet are stored
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机中储存未发送电子邮件的〕发件箱﹐寄件箱

Sense.DEF: a container on an office desk that is used to hold letters, documents etc that have been dealt with and are ready to be taken away by someone such as a secretary
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公桌上专门存放已处理﹑待发送文件的〕发文匣﹐发件盘

Sense.DEF: if there is an outbreak of fighting or disease in an area, it suddenly starts to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔战争或疾病的〕爆发﹐突然发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cholera outbreak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍乱的爆发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: outbreaks of fighting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗的爆发
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the outbreak of World War II
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二次世界大战的爆发

Sense.DEF: a building near a main building, for example a barn or shed
Sense.TRAN: 〔谷仓﹑棚屋等位于主要建筑物旁的〕附属建筑﹐外屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a farmhouse with a few outbuildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带几间外屋的农舍

Sense.DEF: something you say suddenly that expresses a strong emotion, especially anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: He later apologized for his outburst.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后来为自己发脾气而道歉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his father’s violent outbursts of temper
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他父亲的大发雷霆

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outburst of anger
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 怒火的爆发

Sense.DEF: a sudden short increase in an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outburst of creative energy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 创作力的勃发
GramExa.EXAMPLE: outbursts of violence
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力行为的剧增

Sense.DEF: someone who is not accepted by the people they live among, or who has been forced out of their home
Sense.TRAN: 被〔家庭﹑社会等〕遗弃[排斥]的人﹔被逐出者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smokers often feel as though they are being treated as social outcasts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟者常常觉得自己遭到社会排斥。

Sense.DEF: to be or do something much better than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He won his next race, completely outclassing his rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在接下来的比赛中完胜对手。

Sense.DEF: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑讨论﹑战争等无法预知的〕结果﹐后果

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to predict the outcome of the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次选举的结果无法预测。

Sense.EXAMPLE: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Outcome is slightly formal and is used mostly in writing. In everyday English, people are more likely to talk about what happened.
F2NBox.TRAN: outcome 稍显正式﹐多用于书面语中。在日常英语中﹐人们较多使用what happened
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to predict what would happen in the election.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次选举的结果无法预测。

Sense.DEF: a rock or group of rocks above the surface of the ground
Sense.TRAN: 露出地面的岩石[岩层]﹐露头
Sense.EXAMPLE: Below us was a pool surrounded by rocky outcrops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的下面是一个岩石围绕的水塘。

Sense.DEF: an angry protest by a lot of ordinary people
Sense.TRAN: 公众的强烈抗议[反对]﹐呐喊
Sense.EXAMPLE: The closure of the local hospital has caused a huge public outcry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地医院的关闭激起了大规模的公众抗议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a national outcry about the lack of gun control laws
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对枪支管控无法可依的全国性抗议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The proposed changes caused an angry outcry from residents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议的变革引起了居民的愤怒抗议。

Sense.DEF: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists
Sense.TRAN: 过时的﹐陈旧的﹐不合潮流的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outdated teaching methods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合时宜的教学方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a factory with outdated equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设备陈旧的工厂
Sense.EXAMPLE: His writing style is now boring and outdated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

Sense.DEF: outdated information is not recent and may no longer be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: This estimate was made on the basis of outdated figures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一估价是根据过时的数据算出来的。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of outdo
to run, ride etc faster than other people, especially in a race, so that you are far ahead
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在赛跑﹑赛车等中〕遥遥领先于﹐远远超过
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lewis quickly outdistanced the other runners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刘易斯很快就遥遥领先于其他选手。

Sense.DEF: to be better or more successful than someone else at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: When it comes to speed of response, a small firm can outdo a big company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到反应速度﹐小公司会胜过大公司。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: skaters trying to outdo each other in grace and speed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想在动作的优美程度及速度方面胜过他人的滑冰者

Sense.DEF: in order not to let someone else do better or seem better than you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not to be outdone, other computer manufacturers are also donating machines to schools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的计算机生产商也不甘落后﹐纷纷向学校捐赠计算机设备。

Sense.DEF: existing, happening, or used outside, not inside a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge outdoor market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个规模庞大的露天市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: outdoor recreational activities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 户外娱乐活动
Sense.EXAMPLE: outdoor clothing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 户外装
Sense.EXAMPLE: a healthy outdoor life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有益健康的户外生活

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys camping, walking in the countryside etc

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: outdoor, outdoors
F2NBox.EXPL: Outdoor is an adjective and outdoors is an adverb.
F2NBox.TRAN: outdoor是形容词﹐outdoors是副词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They could play outdoors (NOT 不说 outdoor) all year round.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一年四季都能在户外玩。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: an outdoor (NOT 不说 outdoors) swimming pool
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 室外游泳池

Sense.DEF: outside, not in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s warm enough to eat outdoors tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚很暖和﹐可以在户外用餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He likes to work outdoors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢在户外工作。

Sense.DEF: the countryside far away from buildings and cities
Sense.TRAN: 〔远离建筑物和城市的〕旷野﹐野外
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman with a taste for adventure in the great outdoors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名喜欢到野外探险的女子

Sense.DEF: an outdoorsy person enjoys outdoor activities
on the outside of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Remove the tough outer leaves before cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹煮之前先把外面的老叶子去掉。

Sense.DEF: further from the centre of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the outer suburbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 远郊

Sense.DEF: relating to objects, activities etc that are part of the world, as opposed to your own thoughts and feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: His inner conflict is related to struggles in the outer world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他内心的矛盾和外部世界的争斗有关。

Sense.DEF: furthest from the middle
Sense.TRAN: 最外面的﹐离中心最远的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the outermost stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最远的恒星

Sense.DEF: the space outside the Earth’s air, where the planets and stars are
Sense.EXAMPLE: creatures from outer space from another planet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自外太空的生物

Sense.DEF: clothes such as coats that are worn over other clothes
to deal bravely with a difficult situation or opponent
Sense.TRAN: 勇敢地面对〔困境或对手〕

Sense.DEF: a place where water flows out, especially from a drain or river
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sewage outfall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排污口

Subsense.DEF: the part of a cricket or baseball field furthest from the player who is batting
the players in this part of the field

Sense.DEF: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在特殊场合穿着的〕全套服装
Sense.EXAMPLE: She bought a new outfit for the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cowboy outfit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套牛仔服装

Sense.DEF: a group of people who work together as a team or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔一起工作的〕一群人﹐全班人马
Sense.EXAMPLE: My outfit was sent to Italy during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一班队友在战争期间都被派往意大利。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small advertising outfit in San Diego
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣迭戈的广告人员小组

Sense.DEF: a set of equipment that you need for a particular purpose or job
Sense.TRAN: 〔特定目的或工作所需的〕全套设备
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tyre repair outfit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理轮胎的全套设备

Sense.DEF: to provide someone or something with a set of clothes or equipment, especially ones that are needed for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 为…提供全套服装[设备]﹐配备﹐装备

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a car outfitted with dual controls for driver training
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 驾驶员培训用的配有双重控制系统的汽车

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Members outfit themselves in Civil War clothing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 成员身穿内战时期的服装。

Sense.DEF: a shop that sells men’s clothes
a shop that sells equipment for outdoor activities such as camping
Sense.TRAN: 旅行用品商店﹐户外活动〔如露营〕用品商店

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage over an opponent, especially in politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在政治上〕出奇制胜﹐占得先机
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Tories found themselves outflanked by Labour on the issue of law and order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党人发现他们在法律和秩序问题上输给了工党。

Sense.DEF: to go around the side of a group of enemies during a battle and attack them from behind
when money, goods etc leave a bank, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔钱﹑货物等从银行﹑国家等的〕外流

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the outflow of capital from the developed countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发达国家的资金外流

Sense.DEF: the flow of water or air from something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outflow of gas escaping from the main duct
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤气从主管道的泄漏

Sense.EXAMPLE: the outflow valve
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外流阀﹐排放阀

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage over someone by using your intelligence
Sense.TRAN: 智胜﹐〔在计谋上〕比…棋高一着

Sense.DEF: someone who is outgoing likes to meet and talk to new people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re looking for someone with an outgoing personality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在找一个性格外向的人。

Sense.DEF: someone who will soon finish their time as president etc
Sense.TRAN: 即将卸任的总统/总理等

Sense.DEF: going out or leaving a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the tray for outgoing mail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放置外发信件的公文格
Sense.EXAMPLE: outgoing phone calls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外拨电话

Sense.DEF: the money that you have to spend regularly, for example on rent or food
Sense.TRAN: 〔经常性的〕支出﹐开销〔如租金或食物支出〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: List all your outgoings for a month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 列出你一个月所有的经常性开销。

Sense.DEF: to grow too big for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They outgrow their clothes so quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们长得这么快﹐衣服很快就穿不下了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry outgrew his cot when he was about two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里差不多两岁时就睡不下婴儿床了。

Sense.DEF: to no longer do or enjoy something that you used to do, because you have grown older and changed
Sense.TRAN: 因长大而不再…﹐因改变而不再…
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most children eventually outgrow a tendency toward travel sickness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数儿童长大后就不会再晕车晕船了。

Sense.DEF: if a business outgrows a building, it begins to have too many people or too much work to fit into the building
Sense.EXAMPLE: His furniture-making business soon outgrew his garage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的家具制作业务发展起来﹐车库很快就不够用了。

Sense.DEF: to grow or increase faster than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a population outgrowing its resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 增长速度超过资源承载力的人口

Sense.DEF: something that develops from something else, as a natural result of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crime is often an outgrowth of poverty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪常常是贫穷的产物。

Sense.DEF: something that grows out of something else
a small building which is near to and belongs to a larger main building
Sense.TRAN: 〔主建筑物的〕附属建筑物﹐外围建筑

Sense.DEF: a small building over a hole in the ground that is used as a toilet, in a camping area or, in the past, behind a house
a short trip that a group of people take for pleasure

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a class outing to the ballet
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 外出观看芭蕾舞的班级

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outing to the beach
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去海滩的短途旅游

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They had gone on an outing to the pool for Robert’s birthday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去游泳池玩了﹐为罗伯特庆贺生日。

Sense.DEF: when someone publicly says that someone else is homosexual, when that person does not want anyone to know
Sense.TRAN: 〔在当事人不愿意别人知道的情况下〕公开指出某人是同性恋(的行为)

Sense.DEF: strange and unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: outlandish clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇装异服
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her story seemed so outlandish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的故事太不寻常了。

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist or be effective for a longer time than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smith outlasted his rivals in the council to become leader in 1996.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史密斯比对手坚持得更久﹐于1996年成了委员会的领导人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A leather sofa will usually outlast a cloth one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮沙发一般要比布沙发耐用。

Sense.DEF: to completely stop something by making it illegal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill would have outlawed several types of guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法案将全面禁用几种枪支。

Sense.DEF: someone who has done something illegal, and who is hiding in order to avoid punishment – used especially about criminals in the past
Sense.TRAN: 不法之徒﹐逃犯〔尤指旧时的不法分子〕

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that you have to spend in order to start a new business, activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于开设新商号﹑进行某活动等的〕花费﹐开支

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a relatively small outlay, you can start a home hairdressing business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只需相对较少的一笔钱就可以开始做家庭美发生意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: House buyers usually have a large initial outlay on carpets and furniture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 购房者第一笔大的开销通常是购买地毯和家具。

Sense.DEF: a way of expressing or getting rid of strong feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is football a good outlet for men’s aggression?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球是男人宣泄好斗情绪的有效途径吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outlet for creativity
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发挥创造力的一种途径

Subsense.DEF: a shop, company, or organization through which products are sold
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Benetton has retail outlets in every major European city.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝纳通公司的零售店遍及欧洲各主要城市。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a fast-food outlet
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快餐店

Subsense.DEF: a shop that sells things for less than the usual price, especially things from a particular company or things of a particular type
Subsense.TRAN: 廉价经销店﹐〔尤指销售某公司或某类型产品的〕折扣店

Sense.DEF: a place on a wall where you can connect electrical equipment to the supply of electricity
a pipe or hole through which something such as a liquid or gas can flow out
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体或气体的〕出口﹔排水口﹔通风口
Sense.EXAMPLE: a waste water outlet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污水排放口

Sense.DEF: a shopping mall where clothes are sold for less than the usual price, often because they are no longer fashionable or are slightly damaged

a store where clothes or other goods are sold for less than the usual price, often because they are no longer fashionable or are slightly damaged, or because the factory made too many of them to sell in normal stores
an area, usually outside a town or city, where there are a lot of outlet stores all in one place
Sense.TRAN: 特价商店区〔通常位于城镇或市区外﹐集中了许多特价商店〕

Sense.DEF: the main ideas or facts about something, without the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: a research proposal outline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究计划梗概

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outline of world history
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界史纲

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a broad outline of the committee’s plans
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会计划的一个粗略纲要

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A debt reduction scheme was agreed in outline people agreed on its main points.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 债务削减计划大致已经商定。

Sense.DEF: a line around the edge of something which shows its shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outlines of animals were cut into the rock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物轮廓被刻在岩石上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an outline map of Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲略图

GramExa.EXAMPLE: figures drawn in outline
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人物的轮廓

Sense.DEF: a plan for a piece of writing in which each new idea or fact is separately written down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always write an outline for your essays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 写文章一定要先列个提纲。

Sense.DEF: to describe something in a general way, giving the main points but not the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new president outlined plans to deal with crime, drugs, and education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新总统概述了解决犯罪﹑毒品和教育问题的计划。

Sense.DEF: to show the edge of something, or draw around its edge, so that its shape is clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: a map with our property outlined in red
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用红色勾画出我们住宅轮廓的地图
Sense.EXAMPLE: trees outlined against the sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空映衬下的树木轮廓

Sense.DEF: to remain alive after someone else has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: She outlived her husband by 20 years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她比她丈夫多活了20年。

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist after something else has ended or disappeared
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good books have a way of outliving those who want to ban them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优秀的书籍总是比那些想要禁掉它们的人更长寿。

Sense.DEF: to become no longer useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The docks have outlived their usefulness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些码头已经没用了。

Sense.DEF: your general attitude to life and the world
Sense.TRAN: 〔对生活和世界的〕看法﹐观点﹐态度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s got a good outlook on life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有积极的人生观。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She still has an optimistic outlook for the future.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对未来仍抱有乐观的态度。

Sense.DEF: what is expected to happen in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outlook for the weekend is unsettled, with periods of heavy rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末的天气情况不稳定﹐会有阵发性的大雨。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outlook for sufferers from this disease is bleak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病的患者痊愈的希望渺茫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a gloomy economic outlook in Western Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西欧惨淡的经济前景

Sense.DEF: a view from a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very pleasing outlook from the bedroom window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从卧室窗户看出去的宜人景色

Sense.DEF: far from the centre of a city, town etc or from a main building
Sense.TRAN: 边远的﹔远离市中心的﹔远离主要建筑物的
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the outlying suburbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边远郊区之一

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage over someone by using cleverer or more skilful plans or methods
Sense.TRAN: 智胜〔对手〕﹐比〔对手〕技高一筹
Sense.EXAMPLE: He believed he could outmanoeuvre and trap the English King.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相信自己能够智胜英格兰国王﹐让他落入圈套。

Sense.DEF: no longer fashionable or useful
Sense.TRAN: 过时的﹐不再流行的﹔废弃的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outmoded ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过时的观点

Sense.DEF: to be more in number than another group
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flats outnumber houses in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区公寓房比独栋房子多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His troops were hopelessly outnumbered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的军队在数量上远远不及对方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In nursing, women still outnumber men by four to one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在护理行业﹐女性人数仍然以四比一的比例超过男性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Men in prison vastly outnumber women.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐牢的男性人数远远高于女性。

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you are outside your body and looking down on it from above, which people sometimes have when they are close to death
Sense.TRAN: 灵魂离体体验〔一些人濒临死亡时灵魂出窍﹑俯视自己躯体的感觉〕

Sense.DEF: an agreement to end a legal argument, in which one side agrees to pay money to the other so that the problem is not brought to court
if information is out-of-date, it is not recent and may no longer be correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The information in the tourist guide is already out-of-date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游指南上的资料已经过时。

Sense.DEF: if something is out-of-date, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their manufacturing methods are hopelessly out-of-date.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的生产方法已经完全过时了。

Sense.DEF: an official document that is out-of-date cannot be used because the period of time for which it was effective has finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: an out-of-date passport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过期的护照

Sense.DEF: outside, not in a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids spent all their time out of doors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些小孩成天待在户外。

Sense.DEF: small amounts of money that you have to spend as part of your job, and get back from your employer
Sense.TRAN: 先自掏腰包的开销〔指在工作上须先行支付但可向雇主报销的小额开支〕

Sense.DEF: to, from, or in another state
Sense.EXAMPLE: an out-of-state driver’s license
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外州的驾驶执照

Sense.DEF: an out-of-the-way place is in an area where there are few people
Sense.EXAMPLE: an out-of-the-way spot for a picnic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偏僻的野餐地点
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a great little pub, but a bit out of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是家很不错的小酒馆﹐只是位置有点偏僻。

Sense.DEF: unusual or strange
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her taste in music is a bit out-of-the-way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的音乐品位有点奇特。

Sense.DEF: to, from, or in another town
Sense.EXAMPLE: out-of-town visitors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城外的来客

Sense.DEF: on the edge of a town
Sense.EXAMPLE: out-of-town shopping centres
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城郊的购物中心

Sense.DEF: unemployed
Sense.EXAMPLE: out-of-work actors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 待业的演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been out of work for six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经失业六个月了。

Sense.DEF: to go faster, do better, or develop more quickly than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Job openings were outpacing the supply of qualified workers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职位空缺越来越多﹐合格工人供不应求。

Sense.DEF: someone who goes to a hospital for treatment but does not stay for the night
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outpatient clinic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门诊诊所
Sense.EXAMPLE: a routine examination in outpatients the outpatient department of a hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在医院门诊部的例行检查

Sense.DEF: to be more successful than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stocks generally outperform other investments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票总体上要优于其他投资。

Sense.DEF: a service that a company provides to help its workers find new jobs when it cannot continue to employ them
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司解雇员工后的〕新职介绍﹐再就业服务

Sense.DEF: to beat an opponent in a game by playing with more skill than they do
to defeat an opponent in boxing by gaining more points
a group of buildings in a place far from cities or towns, usually established as a military camp or a place for trade
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常作为军营或贸易点而建的〕边远村落﹐偏远居民区
Sense.EXAMPLE: a remote outpost of the empire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帝国的一个偏远村镇

Sense.DEF: an expression of strong feelings

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outpouring of grief
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤心事的倾吐

Sense.DEF: a lot of something that is produced suddenly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an outpouring of creative energy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 创造力的迸发

Sense.DEF: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Output is up 30% on last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产量比去年提高了30%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: California’s agricultural output
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加利福尼亚的农业产量

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the world’s output of carbon dioxide
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界的二氧化碳排放量

Sense.DEF: the information produced by a computer
the amount of electricity produced by a generator
if a computer outputs information, it produces it
a feeling of great anger and shock
Sense.EXAMPLE: The response to the jury’s verdict was one of outrage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团的裁决引发了愤慨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sense of moral outrage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种义愤填膺的感觉

GramExa.EXAMPLE: environmentalists’ outrage at plans to develop the coastline
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护主义者对海岸地区开发计划的愤慨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The case generated public outrage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这案件激起了公愤。

Sense.DEF: an event that produces great anger and shock, especially because it is cruel or violent
Sense.TRAN: 令人震惊而愤慨的事件﹔〔尤指〕暴行
Sense.EXAMPLE: bomb outrages in London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人震惊的伦敦炸弹事件
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is an outrage!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这简直是暴行！

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very angry and shocked
Sense.TRAN: 激起〔某人〕的愤慨﹔使〔某人〕震怒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers were outraged by the price increases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格上涨使顾客感到愤怒。

Sense.DEF: very shocking and extremely unfair or offensive
Sense.TRAN: 骇人的﹔极不公正的﹔蛮横的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outrageous prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骇人的价格
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outrageous attack on his policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他政策的蛮横攻击

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s outrageous that the poor should pay such high taxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要穷人缴纳如此高的税很过分。

Sense.DEF: extremely unusual and slightly amusing or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 极不寻常的﹐有点可笑[吓人]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outrageous hairstyle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怪里怪气的发型
Sense.EXAMPLE: He says the most outrageous things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他总是语出惊人。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of outrun
to have a higher rank than someone else in the same group
Sense.TRAN: 级别高于﹐地位高于〔同一团体中的某人〕

Sense.DEF: to be more important than something else
strange, unusual, and slightly shocking
when help, advice, or other services are provided for people who would not otherwise get these services easily
Sense.TRAN: 外展服务﹐扩大范围的服务

GramExa.EXAMPLE: outreach centers for drug addicts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒毒外展中心

Sense.DEF: to ride faster or further than someone else
a guard or police officer who rides on a motorcycle or horse beside or in front of a vehicle in which an important person is travelling
Sense.TRAN: 〔为重要人物的车辆开路的〕摩托车护卫﹔骑马护卫

Sense.DEF: a long piece of wood that is attached to the side of a boat, especially a canoe,to prevent it from turning over in the water
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指独木舟的〕舷外浮木〔固定在船侧以防船在水中倾覆〕

Sense.DEF: a boat with an outrigger
clear and direct
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outright refusal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 断然拒绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outright attack on his actions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的行为直截了当的抨击

Sense.DEF: complete and total
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outright victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彻底的胜利
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outright ban on the sale of tobacco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全面禁止销售烟草

Sense.DEF: someone who has definitely and easily won
clearly and directly, without trying to hide your feelings or intentions
Sense.EXAMPLE: If she asked me outright, I’d tell her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果她坦率地问我﹐那我会告诉她。

Sense.DEF: clearly and completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won outright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大获全胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They rejected the deal outright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们断然拒绝了这笔交易。

Sense.DEF: to own something such as a house completely because you have paid the full price with your own money
Sense.TRAN: 一次性付款买下/完全拥有某物

Sense.DEF: immediately and without any delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: The passenger was killed outright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名乘客当场死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They fired her outright.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们当即开除了她。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of outride
to run faster or further than someone else
to develop more quickly than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s spending was outrunning its income.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司入不敷出。

Sense.DEF: to be sold in larger quantities than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: It may outsell his previous novels.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它的销量有可能超过他以前的几本小说。

Sense.DEF: to sell more goods or products than a competitor
Sense.EXAMPLE: Australia now outsells the US in wines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在澳大利亚的葡萄酒销量超过了美国。

Sense.DEF: at or from the beginning of an event or process
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A person with higher qualifications can get a better paid job at the outset of their career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学历较高的人就业之初就能得到薪水较高的工作。

Sense.DEF: to be better or more impressive than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several new players outshone the veterans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名新选手使老将们黯然失色。

Subsense.DEF: not inside a building
Subsense.EXAMPLE: When we got up, it was still dark outside.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们起床时﹐外面天还没亮。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Go and play outside.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到外面去玩。

Subsense.DEF: not inside a building or room but close to it
Subsense.TRAN: 在外面〔指在建筑物﹑房间外面不远处〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Could you wait outside please.
