Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你在外面等。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll meet you outside the theatre at two o’clock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我两点钟在剧院外面等你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several people were standing in the hallway outside of his room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个人站在他房间外面的走廊上。

Subsense.DEF: out of a building or room
Subsense.TRAN: 在〔建筑物或房间的〕外面
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We went outside to see what was happening.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到外面去看看发生了什么事。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I opened the door and looked outside.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打开门往外看。

Subsense.DEF: not in a particular city, country etc
Subsense.TRAN: 超出〔城市﹑国家等的〕界限
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She often travels outside the UK.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常离开英国出去旅行。

Subsense.DEF: close to a place, city etc but not in it
Subsense.TRAN: 在 〔某地﹑某城市等的〕外围
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We camped a few miles outside the town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在城外几英里的地方露营。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bolton is a mill town just outside Manchester.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博尔顿是一座磨坊之城﹐就在曼彻斯特边上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Maritza, 19, lives in Everett, outside of Boston.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马里察﹐19岁﹐居住在波士顿城外的埃弗雷特。

Sense.DEF: beyond the limits or range of a situation, activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 超出〔情况﹑活动等的〕界限﹐在…范围之外
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s outside my experience, I’m afraid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕我没有这方面的经验。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: children born outside of marriage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非婚生子

Sense.DEF: if someone is outside a group of people, an organization etc, they do not belong to it
Sense.TRAN: 不属于〔某群体﹑组织等〕﹐在…之外
Sense.EXAMPLE: Few people outside the government realized what was happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府之外的人员很少有人知道发生了什么事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The university administrators ignored criticism from outside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学行政人员对外界的批评置若罔闻。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Management consultants were brought in from outside the company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从公司外面请来了管理顾问。

Sense.DEF: apart from a particular person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 除了某人/某物﹔某人/某物除外
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside of love, the best thing you can give a child is attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了爱﹐你能给予孩子最好的东西就是关注。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m taking one big trip this summer, but outside of that I’ll be around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年夏天我要去长途旅行﹐但其他时候我都在这里。

Sense.DEF: if the time that someone takes to do something, especially finish a race, is outside a particular time, it is greater than that time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指完成比赛所用的时间〕超越〔某个时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finished in 10 minutes 22.4 seconds, 4 seconds outside the record.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到达终点时的成绩是10分22.4秒﹐比纪录快了4秒钟。

Exponent.DEF: not inside a building, but usually close to it
Exponent.TRAN: 在〔建筑物的〕外面〔通常指与之相距不远处〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you go outside and play?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们为什么不去外面玩呢？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was standing outside, smoking a cigarette.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站在外面﹐吸着烟。

Exponent.DEF: outside – used mainly before the following prepositions or adverbs
Exponent.TRAN: 在外面﹐在户外〔主要用于以下介词或副词前〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We slept out under the stars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们露宿在星空下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t stand out in the rain – come inside.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别站在外面淋雨——快进来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can hear somebody out there.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到外面有人。

Exponent.DEF: away from buildings and in the open air – used especially when talking about pleasant or healthy things you do outside
Exponent.TRAN: 在户外﹐在野外 〔尤用于谈到愉悦身心的活动〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In the summer, we like to eat outdoors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐我们喜欢在户外用餐。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kids should spend as much time out of doors as possible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子应该尽可能多地待在户外。

Exponent.DEF: outside where the air is fresh
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s good to exercise in the open air.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 户外锻炼很好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Leave the wood to dry slowly in the open air.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 将木头置于露天里慢慢晾干。

Exponent.DEF: outside – used when talking about eating outside
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We prefer to dine alfresco.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们更喜欢在外面吃饭。

Sense.DEF: not inside a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: We turned off the outside lights and went to bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们关掉外头的电灯﹐上床睡觉了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house will need a lot of outside repairs before we can sell it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子的外部需要好好修一修﹐之后我们才能把它卖出去。

Sense.DEF: involving people who do not belong to the same group or organization as you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside observers said the election was free and fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外部观察员说此次选举自由而公正。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Consultants were brought in to provide some outside advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾问被请来提供一些外部的建议。

Sense.DEF: the rest of the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city is largely cut off from the outside world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市在很大程度上与外界隔绝了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: computers linked by modems to the outside world
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过调制解调器连通外部世界的电脑

Sense.DEF: interests, experiences etc that are not part of your work or studying
Sense.TRAN: 业余爱好/工作以外的经历等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children should be encouraged to take up outside interests, such as music or sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 应该鼓励儿童培养课堂以外的爱好﹐比如音乐或体育。

Sense.DEF: a very small possibility that something will happen
Sense.TRAN: 极小的可能性﹐不大可能的希望
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ireland still have an outside chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱尔兰队仍然有一线获胜的希望。

Sense.DEF: a telephone line or telephone call which is to or from someone who is not inside a particular building or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dial ‘9’ before the number when making outside calls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨打外线请在号码前加拨“9”。

Sense.DEF: a number or amount that is the largest something could possibly be
Sense.TRAN: 最大限度的数目/估计等

Sense.DEF: the lane that is nearest the middle of the road

Subsense.DEF: the part or surface of something that is furthest from the centre

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The outside of the house was painted white.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子的外墙刷成了白色。

Subsense.DEF: the area around something such as a building, vehicle etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔建筑物﹑车辆等的〕周围﹐周边地带﹐外围

GramExa.EXAMPLE: From the outside, it looked like any other big warehouse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从外面看﹐它就跟别的大仓库一样。

Subsense.DEF: someone who is on or from the outside is not involved in an activity or does not belong to a particular group, organization etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Influences from the outside can undermine the values you want to teach your children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自外界的影响会削弱你想要教给自己孩子的价值观。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To anyone on the outside, our marriage seemed perfect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在外人看来﹐我们的婚姻似乎很完美。

Subsense.DEF: used to describe the way someone appears to be or to behave
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Ken was furious, but forced himself to appear calm on the outside.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯十分愤怒﹐但表面上仍强装镇静。

Subsense.DEF: not in prison
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Life on the outside was not as easy as he’d first thought.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出狱后的生活并非像他原来想的那样容易。

Subsense.DEF: if a car passes another car on the outside, it passes on the driver’s side

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular number or amount is the largest something could possibly be, and it might be less
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only a 20-minute walk, half an hour at the outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 步行只要20分钟﹐最多半个小时。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not accepted as a member of a particular social group
Sense.TRAN: 〔不被某一社会团体接受的〕局外人﹐外人﹐非成员
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是个外人﹐是这群人里唯一的外国女人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To an outsider, the system seems complex and confusing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对局外人来说﹐这套体系似乎复杂而难懂。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not belong to a particular company or organization or who is not involved in a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司或组织的〕外部人士﹐外来者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a political outsider who is running for governor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加州长竞选的一个外来政客

Sense.DEF: someone who does not seem to have much chance of winning a race or competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛中〕赢面不大的人﹐不被看好的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Last year he was a rank outsider for the title.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他争夺过该项冠军﹐却不被看好。

Sense.DEF: larger than normal
Sense.TRAN: 超过正常尺寸的﹐特大号的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a woman in outsize glasses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个戴着特大号眼镜的女人

Sense.DEF: made for people who are very large or fat
Sense.TRAN: 为非常高大的人裁制的﹐超大号的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outsize clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特大号服装

Sense.DEF: the parts of a town or city that are furthest from the centre
Sense.TRAN: 远离城市中心的地区﹐市郊﹐郊区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They live on the outskirts of Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在巴黎的郊区。

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage over someone using tricks or your intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLE: The older kids outsmart the young ones when trading cards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交换集换卡的时候﹐大些的孩子比小一点的孩子更精明。

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of outsell
when a company uses workers from outside the company to do a job
Sense.TRAN: 外包﹐外办〔使用公司外员工的做法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the outsourcing of the marketing to a specialist firm
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把市场营销外包给一家专业公司

Sense.DEF: to spend more money than another person or organization
Sense.TRAN: 花费超过〔他人或其他团体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the Senate race, the Republican outspent his rival by nearly $2 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在竞选参议员的过程中﹐共和党候选人比对手多花费近200万美元。

Sense.DEF: expressing your opinions honestly and directly, even when doing this might annoy some people
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outspoken critic of the education reforms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育改革直言不讳的批评者

Sense.DEF: spread out flat or completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was lying on the beach with arms outspread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摊开双臂躺在沙滩上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird with its wings outspread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只张开翅膀的鸟

Sense.DEF: extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outstanding success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 了不起的成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: His performance was outstanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表演相当出色。

Sense.DEF: not yet done, solved, or paid
Sense.TRAN: 尚未完成的﹔有待解决的﹔未付的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got quite a few debts still outstanding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有许多债务尚未偿还。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outstanding issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未解决的问题

Sense.DEF: very great or clear
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question of who is in charge is of outstanding importance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由谁负责是一个非常重要的问题。

Sense.DEF: extremely well
Sense.EXAMPLE: He played outstandingly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他演奏得极为出色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She performed outstandingly well in her examinations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在考试中表现得非常出色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an outstandingly talented musician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位才华出众的音乐家

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere longer than someone else
stretched out to full length

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ran to meet them with outstretched arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她张开双臂跑去迎接他们。

Sense.DEF: to do something better than someone else or be more successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: We outstripped all our competitors in sales last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年我们的销售额超过了所有竞争对手。

Sense.DEF: to be greater in quantity than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Demand for new aircraft production is outstripping supply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新飞机产量目前供不应求。

Sense.DEF: to run or move faster than someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 跑步[移动]快于…﹐把…抛在后面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Speeding at 90 mph, Denny outstripped police cars for an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼以90英里的时速疾驰﹐将警车甩在后面达一小时之久。

Sense.DEF: used in writing to represent the spoken form ‘out of’
Sense.TRAN: 出去﹐离开〔用于书面语﹐表示out of的口语形式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to get outta here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得离开这里。

Sense.DEF: a piece of a film or television show that is removed before it is broadcast, especially because it contains a mistake
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因内容有错而在播放前〕被临时撤掉的电影 [电视节目]片段

Sense.DEF: a box on an office desk where you put work and letters which are ready to be posted or put away
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公桌上存放待发信件等的〕发文格﹐发件盘

Sense.DEF: to defeat a person by winning more votes than them
Sense.TRAN: 以更多票数击败…﹐比…得到更多选票
Sense.EXAMPLE: France was outvoted on that issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在那个问题上法国因得票较少而被击败。

Sense.DEF: relating to how a person or situation seems to be, rather than how it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy and outward appearance of the area have changed considerably.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的经济和面貌发生了很大的变化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His clenched fist was the only outward sign of his anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那紧握的拳头是他内心愤怒的唯一外在表现。

Sense.DEF: a journey in which you are travelling away from home
directed towards the outside or away from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the outward flow of oil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油的外流

Sense.DEF: according to the way people or things seem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Calvin remained outwardly calm, but inside he was very angry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔文外表保持冷静﹐但内心极为愤怒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outwardly, at least, he was an optimist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少从表面看﹐他是个乐观的人。

Sense.DEF: towards the outside or away from the centre of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door opens outwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门是朝外开的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand with your elbows pointing outwards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 站立时肘部外展。

Sense.DEF: to be more important or valuable than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The benefits of the scheme outweigh the disadvantages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划利大于弊。

Sense.DEF: to gain an advantage over someone using tricks or clever plans
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wolf that had outwitted hunters for years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一头多年来智胜猎人的狼

Sense.DEF: work for a business that is done by people at home
old-fashioned, and no longer useful or important
Sense.TRAN: 过时的﹐废弃了的﹔不再重要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: outworn traditions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈腐的传统

Sense.DEF: a Greek alcoholic drink that is drunk with water
the plural form of ovum
a shape like a circle, but wider in one direction than the other
the office of the US President, in the White House in Washington D.C.
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国华盛顿特区白宫内的〕椭圆形办公室﹐总统办公室

Sense.DEF: relating to the ovary
Sense.EXAMPLE: ovarian cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卵巢癌

Sense.DEF: the part of a female that produces eggs
the part of a female plant that produces seeds
if a group of people give someone an ovation, they clap to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Chancellor’s entrance was greeted with a standing ovation everyone stood up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总理进来时﹐全体起立鼓掌欢迎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fans gave the rock group a thunderous ovation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 歌迷对这个摇滚乐队报以雷鸣般的掌声。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that food is cooked inside, shaped like a metal box with a door on the front
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把烤箱预热至200摄氏度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press the mixture onto the bread and bake in a hot oven for ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把混合料抹在面包上﹐然后在烤箱内高温烘烤10分钟。

Sense.DEF: uncomfortably hot

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a bun in the oven

Sense.DEF: ovenproof dishes, plates etc will not be harmed by the high temperatures in an oven
Sense.TRAN: 〔碟子﹑盘子等〕耐热的﹐烤箱适用的

Sense.DEF: oven-ready food is already prepared when you buy it, so you only have to cook it
Sense.TRAN: 〔购买时已加工好的食物〕可即入炉烤制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-pound oven-ready turkey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五磅加工好的待烤火鸡肉

Sense.DEF: cooking pots that can be put in a hot oven without cracking
Sense.TRAN: 〔经得起烤箱高温烘烤的〕耐热器皿

Sense.DEF: above or higher than something, without touching it
Sense.TRAN: 在…上面[上方]〔但未碰触〕﹐在…上空
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lamp hung over the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盏灯悬挂在桌子上方。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She leaned over the desk to answer the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身子探过桌面接电话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sign over the door said ‘Mind your head’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上方的警示牌写着“小心碰头”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We watched a helicopter flying low over the harbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着一架直升机在港口低空飞行。

Sense.DEF: on something or covering it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the body lay a thin white sheet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体上盖着一层薄薄的白布单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wore a large jacket over her sweater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在毛衣外面穿了件宽大的夹克。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind you don’t spill coffee over my best tablecloth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心别把咖啡洒在我最好的桌布上。

Sense.DEF: from one side of something to the other side of it
Sense.TRAN: 从〔某物的〕一边到另一边
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somehow the sheep had jumped over the fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知怎么﹐那只羊跳过了围栏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road over the mountains is steep and dangerous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条翻越山区的路陡峭而危险。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bridge over the River Thames
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 横跨泰晤士河的一座桥
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their house has a magnificent view over the bay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从他们家能看到海湾的壮美景致。

Sense.DEF: on the opposite side of something from where you already are
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a bus stop just over the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在路对面有一个公共汽车站。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live over the river in Richmond.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在河对面的里士满区。

Sense.DEF: down from the edge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car plunged over a cliff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车从悬崖边上冲了下去。

Sense.DEF: in or to many parts of a particular place, organization, or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used to wander over the moors, losing all track of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过去常在旷野上漫步﹐完全忘记了时间。

GramExa.GLOSS: in every part
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They said they had cleaned up but there were bottles all over the place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说已经清扫过了﹐但那里到处都是瓶子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists from all over the world gather here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自世界各地的科学家聚集在这里。

Sense.DEF: if you are over an illness or a bad experience or situation, you are no longer affected by it
Sense.TRAN: 〔从疾病或糟糕的经历或情形中〕恢复过来﹐熬过来
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’re over the worst of the crisis now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们现在已经熬过了最危急的关头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a fever last night, but he seems to be over it now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚他发烧﹐但现在好像已经好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sybil has never got over the shock of her mother’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西比尔一直未能从母亲去世的打击中恢复过来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m over him now I am no longer in love with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在已经不在乎他了。

Sense.DEF: more than a particular number, amount, or level
Sense.TRAN: 超出〔某一数目﹑数量或程度〕﹐比…多
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Japanese were producing over 100 million tons of steel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本的钢产量超过了1亿吨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: toys suitable for children over the age of three
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合3岁以上儿童的玩具
Sense.EXAMPLE: drivers who go over the speed limit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超速驾驶的司机

GramExa.GLOSS: people who are more than a particular age
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a social club for the over-60s
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为60岁以上人士设立的联谊俱乐部

Sense.DEF: during
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you be home over the summer vacation?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暑假期间你在家吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over a period of ten years he stole a million pounds from the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在10年间从公司偷走了100万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we talk about this over dinner?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能否边吃饭边谈这个问题？

Sense.DEF: about a particular subject, person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s having problems over his income tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在所得税方面有些问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a row over public expenditure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关公共开支的争论
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is concern over the bad image of the legal profession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家对法律界的不良形象甚为担忧。

Sense.DEF: in control of or influencing someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He ruled over an empire that stretched from Europe across to Asia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他统治着一个横跨欧洲和亚洲的帝国。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had great personal influence and power over her followers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己的追随者有强大的个人影响力和操纵力。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is more successful or better than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ipswich’s 3-1 win over Manchester City
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊普斯威奇队对曼彻斯特城队3比1的胜利
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can Labour maintain its lead over the Conservatives?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党能否保持相对保守党的领先地位？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It has one great advantage over its rivals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和对手相比﹐它具有一个很大的优势。

Sense.DEF: using something such as a telephone or radio
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to talk about this over the telephone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想在电话里谈这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard the news over the radio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是在收音机里听到这个消息的。

Sense.DEF: in addition to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gets a travel allowance over and above his existing salary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他除现有的薪水以外﹐还有一份出差补助。

Sense.DEF: making a sound louder than another sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What?’ he yelled over the noise of the engine and the wind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “什么？”他高喊道﹐声音盖过了引擎声和风声。

Sense.DEF: if you choose one thing over another, you choose that thing rather than the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is your main reason for choosing one restaurant over another?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在选择餐厅时考虑的主要因素是什么？

Sense.DEF: from an upright position into a position of lying on a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was so drunk he fell over in the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝得烂醉﹐跌倒在马路上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mind you don’t knock the candle over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心别把蜡烛碰倒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Engineers are working to prevent the tower from toppling over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程师在设法防止这座塔倒塌。

Sense.DEF: so that someone or something is no longer straight or flat, but is bent or folded in the middle
Sense.EXAMPLE: As Sheila bent over, a sudden pain shot up her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉弯腰时﹐突然感到背部一阵疼痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He folded the paper over and put it in his pocket.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把纸折起来放入口袋。

Subsense.DEF: from one side of an object, space, or area to the other side
Subsense.TRAN: 从…的一边到另一边﹐穿越
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are only three canoes so some people will have to swim over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅有三条独木舟﹐所以一部分人得游过去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The wall was crumbling where children had climbed over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上孩子们爬过的地方正在崩坍。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I went over crossed the room, street etc to say hello, but Vincent didn’t recognize me.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走过去打招呼﹐但文森特没有认出是我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We flew over to the US to visit my Aunt Polly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘飞机去美国探望了波莉姨妈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of my cousins is coming over from France with his wife and daughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的一个表亲和他的妻子女儿要从法国过来。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Come over here and see what I’ve found.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这里来﹐看看我找到了什么。

Subsense.DEF: in a place that is on the other side of a space or area
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Bill lives over on the other side of town.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔住在镇子的另一边。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She was standing over by the window.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在那一边的窗前。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Do you see that building over there?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到那边的那幢建筑了吗？

Sense.DEF: in or to a particular house, city etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really should come over and see our new house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的该过来看看我们的新房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent the whole day over at Gabby’s place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一整天都在加比家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could drive over to Oxford this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我们可以开车到牛津去。

Sense.DEF: if an event or period of time is over, it has finished
Sense.TRAN: 〔一件事或一段时间〕完结(的)﹐结束(的)
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the meeting over yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议结束了吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: used about something unpleasant
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m so glad the mid-term exams are over and done with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴期中考试总算结束了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’d better give them the bad news. Do it now – get it over with.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好把这个坏消息告诉他们。现在就去﹐把这件事情了结。

Sense.DEF: towards one side
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus pulled over to the side of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车开到路边停了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you move over, so I can sit next to you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你挪过去一点好吗﹐让我坐在你身边。

Sense.DEF: from one person or group to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The attacker was ordered to hand over his weapon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击者被命令交出武器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the money has been signed over to his children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分的钱都签字移交给了他的子女。

Sense.DEF: from one position or system to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guards change over at midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫兵在午夜换岗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We switched over from electricity to gas because it was cheaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从用电改为用煤气﹐因为煤气较便宜。

Sense.DEF: so that the bottom or the other side of something can now be seen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the box over and open it at that end.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把盒子翻过来﹐从那头打开。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Josh rolled over and went back to sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔希翻了个身又睡了。

Sense.DEF: more than or higher than a particular number, amount, or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Almost 40% of women are size 14 or over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 差不多40%的女性穿14码或14码以上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People earning £33,000 and over will pay the higher rate of tax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收入3.3万英镑或以上者将缴纳更高的税。

Sense.DEF: used before an adjective or adverb to mean ‘very’ or ‘too’
Sense.TRAN: 很﹐太〔用于形容词或副词前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t seem over pleased when I asked her to wait.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫她等一下﹐她好像不大高兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps we were all over enthusiastic about the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们对此项目太有热情了。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is over is what remains after some of it has been used
Sense.EXAMPLE: There should be some money over when I’ve paid all the bills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 付完所有的账单后我应该还会剩下一些钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a little food left over from the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对上剩下了一点点食物。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something is completely covered with a substance or material
Sense.TRAN: 覆盖在上面﹐涂抹在上面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the windows have been boarded over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分窗户都用木板封死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parts of the river were iced over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分河面结冰了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The door had been painted over with a bright red varnish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上刷了一层鲜艳的红漆。

Sense.DEF: above someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood on the roof watching the planes fly over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站在屋顶上看飞机从头顶飞过。

Sense.DEF: in a detailed and careful way
Sense.EXAMPLE: After talking it over with my wife, I’ve decided to retire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和妻子仔细地商量过后﹐我决定退休。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll need time to read the contract over before I sign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要时间仔细阅读合同后再签字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Think it over carefully before you make a decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细考虑后再作决定。

Sense.DEF: if you start or do something over, you do it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got mixed up and had to start over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搞混了﹐只得重新开始。

Sense.DEF: many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: The way to learn the script is to say it to yourself over and over again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 背熟剧本的办法是自己反复地念。

Subsense.DEF: used to say how many times the same thing happens
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He sings each song twice over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每首歌唱两遍。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The pattern is repeated many times over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一模式被照搬了许多次。

Subsense.DEF: used to say by how much an amount is multiplied
Subsense.TRAN: 两倍/三倍等﹐乘以二/三等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Trade between the two countries has increased five times over.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的贸易量增加了五倍。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do the whole of something again from the beginning, or that the same thing happens again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their first plan had gone wrong, so they had to start all over again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的第一个计划出了错﹐因此只得从头再来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had quarrelled about the money before, and now it was happening all over again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前就为这笔钱的事争吵过﹐现在又开始吵了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is now someone else’s turn to do something, to speak etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve done my best. Now it’s over to the professionals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经尽了最大的努力﹐现在该交给专业人员了。

Sense.DEF: spoken used when communicating by radio to show that you have finished speaking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you hearing me loud and clear? Over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说话你听得清楚吗？完毕。

Sense.DEF: used to say what something is compared to or preferred to
Sense.TRAN: 与某物相比﹐与某物相对
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Celtic Church maintained the Greek calendar over against that of Rome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔特教会一直沿用古希腊历法﹐而不用古罗马历法。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s not over until the fat lady sings

Variant.LEXVAR: it’s not over until it’s over

Sense.DEF: used during a game, election etc to say that, although a particular result seems likely, the situation could still change
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛﹑选举等〕直到最后才能见分晓

Sense.DEF: the period of time in the game of cricket during which six or eight balls are thrown by the same bowlerin one direction
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球比赛中投球手连续投出六次或八次的〕一轮投球

Sense.DEF: too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: overpopulation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口过剩
Sense.EXAMPLE: overcooked vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮过头的蔬菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: overweight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超重的

Sense.DEF: above; beyond; across
Sense.EXAMPLE: overhanging branches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬垂的树枝
Sense.EXAMPLE: overhead telephone wires
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 架空的电话线
Sense.EXAMPLE: the overland route not by sea or air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陆路

Sense.DEF: outer
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overcoat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大衣

Sense.DEF: additional
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were working overtime working beyond the usual time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在加班。

Sense.DEF: someone who works very hard to be successful, and is very unhappy if they do not achieve everything they want to
Sense.TRAN: 成功欲望过强者﹐一味追求成功的人

Sense.DEF: to act in a play with too much emotion or movement – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 表演得过火[过于夸张]〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: too active, in a way that produces a bad result
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overactive thyroid gland
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甲状腺功能亢进
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such fears are nothing more than the product of an overactive imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种恐惧纯粹是因为想象力太丰富了。

Sense.DEF: too old for a particular purpose or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leyton was over-age for recruitment into the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱顿要参军已超龄了。

Sense.DEF: considering or including everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The overall result is an increase in population.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的结果是人口增加。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我们不需要全部细节﹐只要知道大致的情况。

Sense.DEF: considering or including everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Williams came fifth overall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉斯的总排名是第五。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What will it cost, overall?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这总共要花多少钱？

Sense.DEF: generally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Overall, prices are still rising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的来说﹐价格仍在上涨。

Sense.DEF: a loose-fitting piece of clothing like a coat, that is worn over clothes to protect them
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿在其他衣服外面的〕宽大罩衫

Sense.DEF: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
a piece of clothing like a shirt and trousers in one piece that is worn over other clothes to protect them
more votes than all the other political parties together
Sense.TRAN: 压倒性多数票〔指得票数多于所有其他政党的总和〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Conservatives had a huge overall majority in the House of Commons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保守党在下议院获得了压倒性多数票。

Sense.DEF: the difference between the number of votes gained by the winning party and the total votes gained by all the other parties
Sense.TRAN: 总计多数票〔指获胜党得票数与所有其他政党得票数总和之间的差额〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overall majority of 28
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 28票的总计多数票

Sense.DEF: including or influencing every part of something
Sense.TRAN: 包罗万象的﹔支配一切的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crisis gave an overarching justification to the government’s policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场危机为政府的政策找到了能解释一切的正当理由。

Sense.DEF: an overarm throw in a sport is when you throw the ball with your arm high above your shoulder
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育运动中投掷球时〕挥臂[举手]过肩的[地]

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel respect or fear, so that they are nervous or unable to say or do anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was totally overawed by his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对父亲非常敬畏。

Sense.DEF: to fall over or nearly fall over because you lose balance
to defeat someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is independent-minded enough not to be easily overborne by her husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很有主见﹐不会轻易被她丈夫压倒。

Sense.DEF: always trying to control other people without considering their wishes or feelings
Sense.TRAN: 专横的﹐好指使人的﹔飞扬跋扈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bossy overbearing wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专横霸道的妻子

Sense.DEF: to offer too high a price for something, especially at an auction
to offer more than the value of your cards in a card game such as bridge
Sense.TRAN: 〔在桥牌等纸牌戏中〕叫牌超过(手上牌的实力)

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone’s upper teeth are too far in front of their lower teeth
made to seem greater or more impressive than something really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not really a scientist; he’s just an overblown technician.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本不是科学家﹐只是个装模作样的技师而已。

Sense.DEF: over the side of a ship or boat into the water
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the crew fell overboard and drowned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一个船员从船上落水淹死了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Man overboard said when someone falls off a boat!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人落水了！

Sense.DEF: to do or say something that is too extreme for a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope politicians will not go overboard in trying to control the press.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望政客们在控制媒体方面不要做得太过分。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of an idea, system etc that is considered to be useless or unnecessary
Sense.TRAN: 抛弃某事物﹐去除某事物

Sense.DEF: to sell more tickets for a theatre, plane etc than there are seats available
Sense.TRAN: 超量售出[订出](戏票﹑机票等)
Sense.EXAMPLE: overbooked hotels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超额预订的宾馆

Sense.DEF: to give an organization, person, or system more work or problems than they can deal with
Sense.TRAN: 使负担过多﹔使负荷过重
Sense.EXAMPLE: Health services have been overburdened and are unable to care for many older people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共医疗保健服务已经负担过重﹐无法顾及许多老年人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a manager overburdened with work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作量超负荷的经理

Sense.DEF: the past tense of overcome
the situation in which an industry or factory cannot sell as much as it produces
dark with clouds
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chilly overcast day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个寒冷的阴天
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was overcast and a light rain began to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空阴云密布﹐并下起了小雨。

Sense.DEF: to charge someone too much money for something
Sense.TRAN: 索以高价﹐对〔某人〕索价过高
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were being overcharged for cheap beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们买的是便宜的啤酒﹐却被收取了高价。

Sense.DEF: to put too much power into a battery or electrical system
Sense.TRAN: 使〔电池〕充电过度﹔使〔电路系统〕超负荷

Sense.DEF: full of emotion or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 情绪激昂的﹐群情激奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stadium’s overcharged atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育馆内群情激昂的气氛

Sense.DEF: a long thick warm coat
to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

Sense.DEF: if smoke or gas overcomes someone, they become extremely sick or unconscious because they breathe it
Sense.TRAN: 被〔烟或气体〕熏得失去知觉﹔被呛晕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engineer was working on the freezer when he was overcome by gas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程师在修理冰柜时被煤气熏倒了。

Sense.DEF: if an emotion overcomes someone, they cannot behave normally because they feel the emotion so strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种情绪〕控制…﹐对…产生极大的影响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Charles was overcome with grief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯悲痛欲绝。

Sense.DEF: to fight and win against someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

Sense.DEF: to try to correct a weakness or mistake by doing too much of the opposite thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔为弥补缺陷或过失而〕矫枉过正﹐过度补偿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Zoe overcompensates for her shyness by talking a lot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佐伊为了克服羞怯而说话太多。

Sense.DEF: to cook food for too long
Sense.EXAMPLE: overcooked chicken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮过头的鸡肉

Sense.DEF: filled with too many people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Staff had to work in overcrowded conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工们只得在过度拥挤的环境中工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: overcrowded housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过度拥挤的住房

Sense.DEF: when there are too many people or things in one place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plans to relieve overcrowding in the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划要缓解村子里过度拥挤的状况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the prison’s chronic overcrowding problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱中长期存在的过度拥挤问题

Sense.DEF: if a city or area is overdeveloped, too many houses, buildings, roads etc have been built there
Sense.TRAN: 〔某城市或地区〕发展过度的﹐过度开发的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overdeveloped country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展过度的国家

Sense.DEF: too great or large
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have an overdeveloped sense of duty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的责任感强得过分了。

Sense.DEF: to do something more than is suitable or natural
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某事〕做得过火[过于夸张]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Analysts believe that worries about the economy are overdone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分析人士认为对经济的担忧有些过火了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a few drawings and photographs, but don’t overdo it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可使用一些图画和照片﹐但不要太多。

Sense.DEF: to work too hard or be too active so that you become tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: You mustn’t overdo it – if you’re tired, just sit down and start again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别太劳累了﹐如果感到累了就坐下来﹐稍后再重新开始。

Sense.DEF: to use too much of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I overdid the salt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我盐放多了。

Sense.DEF: cooked too much
Sense.TRAN: 煮得过度的﹐烧得太久的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beef was overdone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉煮过头了。

Sense.DEF: too much of a drug taken at one time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a massive overdose of heroin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重过量吸食海洛因

Sense.EXAMPLE: She took an overdose and died two days later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她服药过量﹐两天后死了。

Sense.DEF: too much of something, especially something harmful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an overdose of sun
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴晒

Sense.DEF: to take too much of a drug at one time, so that it harms you or kills you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She overdosed on sleeping pills.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她服用了过量的安眠药。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money you owe to a bank when you have spent more money than you had in your account
Sense.EXAMPLE: a £250 overdraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 250英镑的透支额
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many students have a free overdraft facility agreement with their bank to have an overdraft up to a particular limit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学生都能享受免费透支服务。

Sense.DEF: if you are overdrawn or your bank account is overdrawn, you have spent more than you had in your account and so you owe the bank money
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try not to go overdrawn if possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽可能不透支。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My account is overdrawn by £300.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的账户透支了300英镑。

Sense.DEF: dressed in clothes that are too formal for the occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某种场合来说〕穿着过于正式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt overdressed in her smart suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己穿着这身漂亮套装显得过于正式了。

Sense.DEF: an additional gear which allows a car to go fast while its engine produces the least power necessary
to start being very active or working very hard
Sense.TRAN: 变得活跃﹔加倍努力﹐拼命工作
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her career has gone into overdrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的事业开始突飞猛进。

Sense.DEF: not done, paid, returned etc by the time expected
Sense.TRAN: 过期未完成的﹔过期未付的﹔过期未还的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overdue gas bill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 逾期未付的煤气账单
Sense.EXAMPLE: The library books are overdue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图书馆的书过期未还。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby was a week overdue it was expected to be born a week ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝超过预产期有一周了。

Sense.DEF: something that is overdue should have happened or been done a long time ago
Sense.TRAN: 早该发生的﹔早该完成的﹔期待已久的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was overdue for a shave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早该刮胡子了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We welcome this announcement and think it’s long overdue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们欢迎这个声明﹐并且对此期待已久。

Sense.DEF: to eat too much, or eat more than is healthy
to do more than is necessary, or add something that is not needed
Sense.TRAN: 做不必要的事﹔画蛇添足

Sense.DEF: to give something more importance than it deserves or than is suitable
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the past the exam had been overemphasized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过去﹐考试受到了过分的重视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The importance of adequate preparation cannot be overemphasized used to say that something is very important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做好充足准备的重要性怎么强调也不过分。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: There has been an overemphasis on content rather than methodology.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的做法是过分重视内容而忽略了方法。

Sense.DEF: to think something is better, more important etc than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 对…估计过好﹐对…估计过高
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tends to overestimate his own abilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往往高估自己的能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The importance of training in health and safety cannot be overestimated is extremely important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对健康和安全方面的培训极为重要。

Sense.DEF: to guess an amount or value that is too high
Sense.TRAN: 对〔数额或价值〕估计过高
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most patients overestimated how long they had had to wait to see a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数病人对看医生所需的等待时间估计过长了。

Sense.DEF: a calculation, judgement, or guess that is too large
Sense.EXAMPLE: The figure of 30% is clearly an overestimate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30%这个数字显然是估计过高了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is overexcited is very excited and not behaving sensibly
Sense.TRAN: 过于激动的﹐过度兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the boys became overexcited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些男孩变得兴奋过度了。

Sense.DEF: to allow too much light to reach the film when taking or developing a photograph
Sense.TRAN: 使〔底片或胶片〕过度感光[曝光]

Sense.DEF: to appear too many times on television, in the newspapers etc, so that people lose interest in you and you become less popular
Sense.TRAN: 曝光率过高〔指在电视﹑报纸上等出现次数过多而导致受欢迎程度下降〕

Sense.DEF: when too much light, radiation etc reaches someone’s skin, a photographic film etc and is harmful
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮肤的〕过度照射﹔〔胶片的〕过度曝光

Sense.DEF: when someone receives too much attention from television, the newspapers etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人在电视﹑报纸上等的〕曝光率过高

Sense.DEF: to try to do or use too much of something, causing problems, illness, or damage
Sense.TRAN: 把…做得过分﹔把…使用过头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to overextend yourself. You’ve been very ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意不要让自己太劳累﹐你刚生过大病。

Sense.DEF: to spend more money than you actually have
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackson’s company became overextended financially.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊的公司财务上开支过大了。

Sense.DEF: to give someone too much food
Sense.TRAN: 给…吃得过多﹐给…喂食过多

Sense.DEF: to put too much of something into a container
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had overfilled the jug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把罐子装得太满了。

Sense.DEF: the process of taking too many fish from the sea, a river etc, so that the number of fish in it becomes too low
Sense.TRAN: 〔对海﹑河等中鱼类的〕过度捕捞

Sense.DEF: if a river, lake, or container overflows, it is so full that the liquid or material inside flows over its edges
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drains flooded and water overflowed down the main street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下水道被淹﹐水溢到了大街上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river had overflowed its banks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水漫堤了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: waste bins overflowing with plastic cups
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞满塑料杯的垃圾箱

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden overflows with colour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里色彩缤纷。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was overflowing with good ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有满脑子的好主意。

Sense.DEF: if a place overflows with people or people overflow into a place, there are too many of them to fit into it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hospitals were reported to be overflowing with dead and wounded.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据报道﹐医院里到处是死伤者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was full and people were overflowing into the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子已经挤满了﹐人们排到了大街上。

Sense.DEF: to have a very strong feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My heart was overflowing with gratitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我心里充满了感激之情。

Sense.DEF: to be completely full
Sense.EXAMPLE: One wall was filled to overflowing with books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一面墙上摆满了书。

Sense.DEF: the amount of something or the number of people that cannot be contained in a place because it is already full
Sense.TRAN: 容纳不下的东西[人]﹔溢出物﹔超出的数额
Sense.EXAMPLE: The overflow will be accommodated in another hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接纳不了的人将被安排下榻另一家宾馆。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the overflow of water from the lake
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从湖里外溢的水

Sense.DEF: a pipe through which water flows out of a container when it becomes too full
to fly over an area or country in an aircraft
Sense.TRAN: 在〔某地区或国家〕的上空飞行

Sense.DEF: used to describe a train system that runs on the surface of the ground rather than below it
Sense.TRAN: 〔铁路系统〕在地面上的﹐高出地面的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overground railway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面铁路系统

Sense.DEF: covered with plants that have grown in an uncontrolled way
Sense.TRAN: 植物蔓生的﹐杂草丛生的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden will be overgrown with weeds by the time we get back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们回来的时候﹐花园里将会长满杂草。

Sense.DEF: when grass or plants are overgrown, they have grown in an uncontrolled way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lawn with overgrown grass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂草丛生的草地

Sense.DEF: an adult who behaves like a child – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 大男生/大孩子〔用于形容孩子气的成人﹐含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop acting like an overgrown schoolboy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再幼稚得像个大孩子似的。

Sense.DEF: plants and branches of trees growing above your head, usually in a forest
Sense.TRAN: 蔓生的植物〔通常指森林里长得比人高的植物或树枝〕

Sense.DEF: an overhand throw in a sport is when you throw the ball with your arm above the level of your shoulder
Sense.TRAN: 〔体育运动中投掷球时〕举手[挥臂]过肩的[地]

Sense.DEF: to hang over something or stick out above it
a rock, roof etc that hangs over something else
Sense.TRAN: 悬垂物﹐外垂物〔如岩石﹑屋顶等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood under the overhang while it rained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下雨时我们站在突出的遮挡物下面。

Sense.DEF: the amount by which something hangs over something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-foot overhang
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五英尺的悬垂量

Sense.DEF: to repair or change the necessary parts in a machine, system etc that is not working correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: A mechanic is coming to overhaul the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名机修工要来彻底检修引擎。

Sense.DEF: to change a system or method in order to improve it
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the community’s decision-making institutions need to be overhauled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区的所有决策机构都需要进行彻底改革。

Sense.DEF: necessary changes or repairs made to a machine or system
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car needs a complete overhaul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车需要大修。

Sense.DEF: when a system or method is changed in order to improve it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an overhaul of the tax system
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 税制的全面改革

Sense.DEF: above your head or in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bullets whizzed overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 子弹嗖嗖地掠过头顶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A plane flew overhead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架飞机从头顶飞过。

Sense.DEF: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating
Sense.TRAN: 〔企业的〕经常性支出﹐运营费用〔如租金﹑保险费﹑电费等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their offices are in London so the overheads are very high.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的办事处在伦敦﹐所以经常性开支非常大。

Sense.DEF: a piece of transparent material used with an overhead projector to show words, pictures etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用高射投影仪时用以显示文字﹑图片等的〕透明胶片

Sense.DEF: a piece of electrical equipment used when giving a talk, which shows words or pictures on a wall or large screen so that many people can see them
to accidentally hear what other people are saying, when they do not know that you have heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: I overheard part of their conversation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我碰巧听到了他们谈话的部分内容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She overheard the management discussing pay rises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无意中听到管理层在讨论加薪的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We overheard the teacher say there would be a pop quiz today.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无意中听到老师说今天有突击测验。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t help overhearing your argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无意中听到了你们的争吵。

Sense.DEF: to become too hot, or to make something too hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think the engine’s overheating again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想引擎又过热了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to overheat the sauce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意别把调味汁热过头了。

Sense.DEF: if a country’s economy overheats, or if something overheats it, it grows too fast and this leads to increases in prices, salaries, interest rates etc
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔国家经济〕发展过热﹐(使)发展过快〔导致物价﹑工资﹑利率等飞涨〕

Sense.DEF: too hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overheated waiting room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过热的等候室

Sense.DEF: an overheated economy grows too fast, leading to increases in prices, salaries, interest rates etc
too full of anger or excitement
Sense.TRAN: 充满愤怒的﹔过于兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: her overheated imagination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她过于丰富的想象力

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of overhang
to eat or drink too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hard not to overindulge at Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节期间很难避免大吃大喝。

Sense.DEF: to let someone have everything they want, or always let them do what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Penny was overindulged by her parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彭妮被她的父母宠坏了。

Sense.DEF: extremely pleased or happy
Sense.TRAN: 极为高兴的﹐十分开心的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was overjoyed to see his mother again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又见到了他母亲﹐非常开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t exactly overjoyed at the prospect of looking after two small boys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要照看两个小男孩﹐她一点也不开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents were overjoyed that she’d been found alive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现她还活着﹐她的父母欣喜若狂。

Sense.DEF: more of something than is necessary or desirable
Sense.EXAMPLE: More television coverage of the election would be overkill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对选举作更多的电视报道就显得过分了。

Sense.DEF: filled with too many people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: overladen buses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超载的公共汽车

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of overlay
across land, not by sea or air
Sense.EXAMPLE: They plan to travel overland to China.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们计划经陆路去中国。

Sense.DEF: if two or more things overlap, part of one thing covers part of another thing
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某物〕部分重叠﹐交搭﹐叠盖
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of Jilly’s front teeth overlaps the other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉里的一颗门牙与另一颗有些交叠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tiles on the roof overlap.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶的瓦片相互叠搭在一起。

Sense.DEF: if two subjects, ideas etc overlap, they include some but not all of the same things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maxwell’s responsibilities overlap yours, so you will be sharing some of the work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯韦尔的职责和你的有重叠﹐所以有些工作你们将共同承担。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The study of sociology overlaps with the study of economics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会学研究和经济学研究有共通之处。

Sense.EXAMPLE: two great men with overlapping interests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位兴趣有共同之处的伟人

Sense.DEF: if two activities or periods of time overlap, the second one starts before the first one has finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The second phase of development overlaps the first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发展的第二阶段和第一阶段有重叠。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My vacation overlaps with yours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的假期和你的有重叠。

Sense.DEF: the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap
Sense.TRAN: 〔两种活动﹑观点﹑事物等〕交叉的数量﹐重叠部分

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is considerable overlap between the girls’ and boys’ test results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩和男孩的测试结果有相当多的共同之处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an overlap of about two centimetres
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约两厘米的交叠部分

Sense.EXAMPLE: a large degree of overlap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很大程度上的重叠

Sense.DEF: to cover or be on top of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wood is overlaid with silver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木头上包了一层银。

Sense.DEF: if one quality, sound etc overlays another, it is added to it and is often stronger or more noticeable
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roar of the engines was overlaid by a loud banging.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎的轰鸣被巨大的砰砰声盖过了。

Sense.DEF: something which covers something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: the brass fire surround with its decorative overlay
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有装饰覆盖物的铜质壁炉围饰

Sense.DEF: a transparent sheet with a picture or drawing on it which is put on top of another picture to change it
Sense.TRAN: 〔上有图片或画样﹐用于覆盖在另一图片上使其有变化的〕套图塑料膜

Sense.DEF: an additional quality or feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: sad stories with an overlay of humour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带点幽默的悲伤故事

Sense.DEF: on the other side of the page
Sense.TRAN: 在一页的另一面﹐在一页的背面
Sense.EXAMPLE: See the diagram overleaf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参见背面的示意图。

Sense.DEF: to lie over something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clay overlies chalk in the southern mountains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在南部山脉﹐黏土层覆在白垩层之上。

Sense.DEF: to put too many things or people on or into something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful not to overload the washing machine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意别让洗衣机负荷过重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus was overloaded with tourists and their luggage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车载着满满的游客和行李。

Sense.DEF: to put too much electricity through an electrical system or piece of equipment
Sense.TRAN: 使〔电路系统或设备〕超负荷
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t overload the lighting circuit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让照明电路超负荷。

Sense.DEF: to give someone too much work or information to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某人〕过多的工作[信息]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the staff are overloaded with work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的员工都在超负荷工作。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: an overload of urgent daily business
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 过多的需紧急处理的日常事务

Sense.DEF: continuing for too long
Sense.TRAN: 持续过久的﹐时间太长的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overlong performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时间过长的表演

Sense.DEF: to not notice something, or not see how important it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody could overlook the fact that box office sales were down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也无法忽视票房销售额在下降这个事实。

Sense.DEF: to forgive someone’s mistake, bad behaviour etc and take no action
Sense.TRAN: 不计较﹐宽恕〔某人的过失﹑坏行为等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得他很有趣﹐足以让她包容他的缺点。

Sense.DEF: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our room overlooks the ocean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

Sense.DEF: someone with great power over a large number of people, especially in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指昔日的〕封建君主﹔大领主

Sense.DEF: too or very
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your views on economics are overly simplistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对经济学的看法过于简单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not overly fond of cats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不大喜欢猫。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which a company, industry etc has more workers than are needed
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑行业等的〕人员过多﹐人浮于事

Sense.DEF: too much or very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: At his age, he didn’t care overmuch about impressing people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个岁数﹐他不大在乎能否给别人留下好印象了。

Sense.DEF: for or during the night
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pam’s staying overnight at my house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕姆要在我家过夜。

Sense.DEF: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He became a millionaire overnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reputations are not changed overnight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 声誉不是一夜之间就能改变的。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not talk about ‘an overnight’ because overnight is never a noun. It is either an adverb or an adjective. 不要说an overnight﹐因为overnight不是名词﹐而是副词或形容词。

Sense.DEF: happening during the night or for the night
Sense.TRAN: 夜间的﹐晚上的﹔只供一夜的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overnight flight to Chicago
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞往芝加哥的夜间航班
Sense.EXAMPLE: overnight accommodation in London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的一夜住宿

Sense.DEF: happening surprisingly quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was an overnight success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场演出一举成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his overnight decision to become a vegetarian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要做素食者的突然决定

Sense.DEF: a bag containing everything you need for a night away from home
Sense.TRAN: 〔适用于在外住宿一晚的〕小旅行包﹐手提包
Sense.EXAMPLE: He packed an overnight bag and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收拾好一只小旅行包就离开了。

Sense.DEF: expecting that things will be better than is possible or likely
Sense.TRAN: 过分乐观的﹐盲目乐观的
Sense.EXAMPLE: over-optimistic forecasts of economic growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对经济增长过于乐观的预测

Sense.DEF: given more money for a job than you deserve
Sense.TRAN: 多付了钱的﹐多给了报酬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: grossly overpaid football players
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收入高得离谱的足球运动员

Sense.DEF: a structure like a bridge that allows one road to go over another road
to pay someone more money than they deserve
Sense.TRAN: 多付给〔某人〕钱﹐多给〔某人〕报酬
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most big companies continue to overpay their top executives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多数大公司继续给高管支付过高的薪水。

Sense.DEF: to pay too much money for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to recover any tax you have overpaid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要想办法收回任何多付的税款。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important than it is
Sense.TRAN: 夸大…的重要性﹐把…做得过头
Sense.EXAMPLE: His role in the group’s success has been overplayed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对团队成功所起的作用被夸大了。

Sense.DEF: to behave too confidently because you think you are in a stronger position than you actually are
Sense.TRAN: 高估自己的力量﹐不自量力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The unions overplayed their hand in the end and failed to get the pay rise they wanted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最终工会高估了自己的力量﹐未能实现他们希望的加薪。

Sense.DEF: when there are too many people living in a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to reduce overpopulation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低过高人口密度的努力

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们人口密度过高的城市

Sense.DEF: to take control of someone physically because you are stronger
Sense.TRAN: 〔以更强的力量〕打败﹐制服〔某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The security guards soon overpowered the man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保安迅速制服了那名男子。

Sense.DEF: if a smell, taste, or emotion overpowers you, it affects you very strongly
Sense.TRAN: 〔气味﹑味道或情感〕强烈地影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her scent overpowered his senses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身上的香味强烈地刺激着他的感官。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was overpowered by grief.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她痛不欲生。

Sense.DEF: very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overpowering smell of rotten flesh
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓烈的腐肉气味
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt an overpowering desire to slap her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他恨不得打她一记耳光。

Sense.DEF: someone who is overpowering has such a strong character that they make other people feel uncomfortable or afraid
something that is overpriced is more expensive than it should be
to print additional words over a document, stamp etc that already has printing on it
Sense.TRAN: 在〔已印有图文的文件﹑邮票等〕上加印〔文字〕

Sense.DEF: the act of producing more of something than people want or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: the systematic overproduction of food
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有计划的食物生产过剩

Sense.DEF: so anxious to protect someone from harm that you restrict their freedom
Sense.EXAMPLE: overprotective parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对子女过分保护的父母

Sense.DEF: if you are overqualified for a particular job, you have more experience or training than is needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m having trouble finding another job – everyone says I’m overqualified.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在找另一份工作﹐但遇到了困难——每个人都说我资历太高。

Sense.DEF: the past tense of overrun
not as good or important as some people think or say
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vastly overrated film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被大肆吹捧的一部电影

Sense.DEF: to try to do more than you have the power, ability, or money to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company overreached itself financially.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司的做法超出其经济实力。

Sense.DEF: to react to something with too much emotion, or by doing something that is unnecessary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You always overreact to criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对批评总是反应过激。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many investors overreacted to the stock market crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多投资者对股市的崩溃反应过激。

Sense.DEF: to use your power or authority to change someone else’s decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔以权力或权威〕否决﹔改变〔别人的决定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The EU commission exercised its power to override British policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟委员会行使其权力来否决英国的政策。

Sense.DEF: to be regarded as more important than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The needs of the mother should not override the needs of the child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲的需要不应优先于孩子的需要。

Sense.DEF: to stop a machine doing something that it does by itself
Sense.TRAN: 超驰控制﹐超控﹐使用手动控制让〔自动控制的机器〕停下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you override the automatic locking system?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以通过手动控制让这个自动锁定系统解除锁定吗？

Sense.DEF: more important than anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a question of overriding importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高于一切的重要问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their overriding concern is with efficient crime control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最为关心的是如何有效控制犯罪。

Sense.DEF: overripe fruit and vegetables are past the point of being ready to eat and are too soft
Sense.TRAN: 〔水果和蔬菜〕过熟的﹐熟到快要烂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: overripe bananas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过熟的香蕉

Sense.DEF: to change an order or decision that you think is wrong, using your official power
Sense.TRAN: 〔用职权〕推翻﹐否决〔认为是错误的命令或决定〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The House of Lords overruled the decision of the Court of Appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上议院推翻了上诉法院的判决。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have the power to overrule the local council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有权否决地方议会的决定。

Sense.DEF: if unwanted things or people overrun a place, they spread over it in great numbers
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨厌的事物或人〕在…泛滥﹐横行于

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a tiny island overrun by tourists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挤满了游客的小岛
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was overrun with mice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里鼠患成灾。

Sense.DEF: to take more time or money than intended
Sense.TRAN: 超出﹐超过〔预期的时间或金钱〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The final speaker overran by at least half an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一名发言人至少超时半小时。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers overrun a place, they take control of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poland was overrun by the Russian army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波兰被苏军占领。

Sense.DEF: an amount of time or money that is larger than was planned or intended
Sense.TRAN: 超出的时间﹔超出的成本[费用]
Sense.EXAMPLE: cost overruns of £2 billion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20亿英镑的超额费用

Sense.DEF: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris is going to work overseas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯要去国外工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most applications came from overseas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分申请来自海外。

Sense.DEF: coming from, existing in, or happening in a foreign country that is across the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: overseas students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国留学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: overseas investment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海外投资

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily
Sense.EXAMPLE: A team leader was appointed to oversee the project.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任命了一位组长来监管该工程。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a project, group of workers etc, and who makes sure that the job is done properly
to praise someone or something too much
Sense.TRAN: 对〔某人或某事〕赞扬过多﹐吹捧
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tourism on the island is oversold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个岛上的旅游业被吹嘘得过头了。

Sense.DEF: to sell more of something than is actually available
easily upset or offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you think you’re being a bit oversensitive?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没觉得自己有点过分敏感了吗？

Sense.DEF: having more interest in or desire for sex than is usual
Sense.TRAN: 性欲过强的﹐性欲过盛的

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something else seem less important
Sense.TRAN: 使〔别的人或事〕显得较不重要﹐使相形见绌[黯然失色]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her interest in politics began to overshadow her desire to be a poet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对政治的兴趣开始盖过了想当诗人的愿望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The achievement of the men’s team was overshadowed by the continuing success of the women’s team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男子组的成绩在女子组的连连胜利面前相形见绌。

Sense.DEF: to make an occasion or period of time less enjoyable by making people feel sad or worried
Sense.TRAN: 〔因使人感到难过或忧虑而〕给〔某一场合或某段时间〕蒙上阴影
Sense.EXAMPLE: The threat of war overshadowed the summer of 1939.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的威胁给1939年的夏天蒙上了阴影。

Sense.DEF: if a tall building, mountain etc overshadows a place, it is very close to it and much taller than it
Sense.TRAN: 〔高楼﹑高山等〕遮蔽﹐遮挡〔周围某处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark valley overshadowed by towering peaks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被高耸的山峰遮蔽的幽暗山谷

Sense.DEF: a rubber shoe that you wear over an ordinary shoe to keep your feet dry
Sense.TRAN: 〔穿在普通鞋子外面的〕橡胶套鞋﹐罩靴

Sense.DEF: to accidentally go a little further than you intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane overshot the runway and plunged into a ditch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机冲出跑道﹐一头扎进沟里。

Sense.DEF: to spend more money than you had intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school has overshot its cash limit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校的开支超出了预计的现金额度。

Sense.DEF: a mistake in which you forget something or do not notice something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I assure you that this was purely an oversight on my part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向你保证﹐这纯粹是我的一时疏忽。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has general oversight of all training courses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他全面负责所有的培训课程。

Sense.DEF: to describe something in a way that is too simple and ignores many facts
Sense.TRAN: 陈述过于简略﹐使…过于简单化
Sense.EXAMPLE: To describe all these people as refugees is to oversimplify the situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将所有这些人都称为难民是把情况过于简化了。

Sense.DEF: bigger than usual or too big
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oversized jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太大的夹克

Sense.DEF: to sleep for longer than you intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry I'm late. I overslept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉我迟到了﹐我睡过头了。

Sense.DEF: to spend more money than you can afford
Sense.TRAN: 支出超过〔自己的财力〕﹐超支
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital has overspent its budget by £70,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家医院的开支超出预算7万英镑。

Sense.DEF: people who move out of a big city because there are too many people living there, and go to live in new houses outside the city
Sense.TRAN: 〔因城市人口过多而迁移到市外新居的〕过剩人口
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overspill of workers from London
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自伦敦的过剩的工人

Sense.DEF: an overstaffed company, organization etc has more workers than it needs
to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: To say that all motorists speed in residential areas is overstating the case.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说所有驾驶员都在住宅区内超速行驶是言过其实了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The importance of a child’s early years cannot be overstated is very important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童幼年期的重要性怎么强调也不为过。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It’s an overstatement to say that the man’s a fool.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 说那男人是傻瓜有点过分。

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere longer than you are allowed to
Sense.EXAMPLE: They overstayed their visas and were arrested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们因居留超过签证期限而被逮捕。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is not acceptable or allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has overstepped the bounds of acceptable behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为超出了可接受的限度。

Sense.DEF: to offend someone by doing or saying things that you should not do or say
Sense.EXAMPLE: She overstepped the mark and lost her job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的言行太过分﹐结果丢了工作。

Sense.DEF: to obtain more of something than is needed
to try to do more than you are able to, or to use more money, supplies etc than you have
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overstretched social services department
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捉襟见肘的社会服务部门

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Problems only arise when people overstretch themselves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有当人们超出自己能力所及时才会出现问题。

Sense.DEF: if something is oversubscribed, too many people have said that they want to use it or have it
Sense.TRAN: 被超额预订[订购]的﹐供不应求的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All good schools are oversubscribed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有好学校的入学申请都超额了。

Sense.DEF: the state of having more of something than you need or can sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oversupply of computers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机供应过量

Sense.DEF: overt actions are done publicly, without trying to hide anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overt attempt to silence their political opponents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想压制政敌言论的明显企图
Sense.EXAMPLE: Overt race discrimination is illegal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公然的种族歧视是非法的。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有明显政治色彩的信息

Sense.DEF: to go past a moving vehicle or person because you are going faster than them and want to get in front of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He pulled out to overtake the van.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车驶出所在车道想超过那辆小货车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never try to overtake on a bend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝不要在转弯处超车。

Sense.DEF: to develop or increase more quickly than someone or something else and become more successful, more important, or more advanced than them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Television soon overtook the cinema as the most popular form of entertainment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视很快就超过了电影﹐成为最大众化的娱乐方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hingis has now overtaken her in the world tennis rankings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在辛吉斯的世界网球排名已经超过了她。

Sense.DEF: if something bad, especially a feeling, overtakes you, it happens to you suddenly and has a strong effect on you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was overtaken by emotion and started to cry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然情绪激动﹐哭了起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A terrible sense of panic overtook him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然产生了一种可怕的惊慌感。

Sense.DEF: if you are overtaken by events, the situation changes, so that your plans or ideas are not useful any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: The diplomatic negotiations were soon overtaken by events.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交谈判不久就遭遇变故。

Sense.DEF: to make someone do more than they are really able to do, so that they become very tired
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕负担过重[过度疲劳]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be careful you don’t overtax yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心别让自己过度劳累。

Sense.DEF: to make people pay too much tax
over-the-counter drugs can be obtained without a prescription a written order from a doctor
Sense.TRAN: 〔药品〕无医生处方也可买到的﹐非处方的

Sense.DEF: over-the-counter business shares are ones that do not appear on an official stock exchange list
Sense.TRAN: 〔股票〕场外买卖的﹐买卖双方直接交易的﹐非挂牌的

Sense.DEF: remarks, behaviour etc that are over-the-top are so extreme or unreasonable that they seem stupid or offensive
Sense.TRAN: 〔言行等〕过于夸张的﹐过分的﹐荒唐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit over-the-top to call him a fascist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说他是法西斯分子有点夸张了。

Sense.DEF: to remove a leader or government from power, especially by force
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用武力〕颠覆﹐推翻〔某领导或政府〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebels were already making plans to overthrow the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反叛者已在密谋颠覆政府。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of the rules, ideas, or systems of a society
Sense.TRAN: 背弃﹐摒弃〔规则﹑观念或社会制度〕

Sense.DEF: the defeat and removal from power of a leader or government, especially by force
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用武力对某领导或政府的〕打倒﹐推翻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The organization was dedicated to the overthrow of capitalism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该组织致力于推翻资本主义。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the overthrow of Mussolini
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墨索里尼的垮台

Sense.DEF: time that you spend working in your job in addition to your normal working hours
Sense.TRAN: 超时工作﹐加班时间﹐额外工作时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: six hours’ overtime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 六小时的加班
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re working overtime to get the job finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在加班赶工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been doing a lot of overtime recently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他近来加班很多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many employees work countless hours of unpaid overtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多员工无偿加班无数个小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of our offices will be working on overtime until the end of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的许多办事处都要加班到年底。

Sense.DEF: the money that you are paid for working more hours than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: He earns £450 a week, including overtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他周薪450英镑﹐包括加班费。

Sense.DEF: to be very active
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she put down the phone, her brain was working overtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她放下电话听筒﹐飞快地开动脑筋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His senses were working overtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的感官高度紧张。

Sense.DEF: a period of time added to the end of a sports game to give one of the two teams a chance to win

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steve Smith scored all nine of the Hawks’ points in overtime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫•史密斯在加时赛中拿下了鹰队的全部九分。

Sense.DEF: very tired, so that you cannot think or do things normally and become annoyed easily
signs of an emotion or attitude that is not expressed directly
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感或态度〕含蓄的表示﹐暗示﹐弦外之音

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were overtones of anger in his voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气里含着怒意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: football songs with violent overtones
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有暴力意味的足球歌曲

GramExa.GLOSS: having a connection to politics or religion that is not directly expressed
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The decision may have political overtones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一决定可能带有政治意味。

Sense.DEF: a higher musical note that sounds together with the main note
the past tense of overtake
to be higher or more important than something
a short piece of music written as an introduction to a long piece of music, especially an opera
an attempt to begin a friendly relationship with a person, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔试图与某人﹑某国等建立友好关系的〕主动表示﹐姿态
Sense.EXAMPLE: They began making overtures to the Irish government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开始向爱尔兰政府表示友好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had rejected his overtures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝了他的示好。

Sense.DEF: if an event is an overture to a more important event, it happens just before it and makes you expect it
Sense.TRAN: 是一个序幕〔表示某事是另一更为重要之事的开端〕

Sense.DEF: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leslie jumped to her feet, overturning her chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯莉一跃而起﹐碰倒了椅子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His car overturned, trapping him inside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的汽车发生侧翻﹐把他困在了里面。

Sense.DEF: to change a decision or result so that it becomes the opposite of what it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: His conviction was overturned by the Court of Appeal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的有罪裁决被上诉法院推翻了。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly remove a government from power, especially by using violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用暴力突然〕推翻﹐颠覆〔政府〕

Sense.DEF: to use something too much, especially so that it is not effective any more or it is damaged
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students tend to overuse certain words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生往往会滥用某些词语。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自然资源的过度使用

Sense.DEF: to believe or say that something is more valuable or more important than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 对…估价过高﹔高估…的重要性

Sense.DEF: a short description of a subject or situation that gives the main ideas without explaining all the details

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an overview of the issues involved
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有关问题的概述

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The document provides a general overview of the bank’s policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份文件对银行政策作了概述。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This chapter gives a broad overview of the main concerns facing employers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一章对雇主最为关心的问题作了粗略概述。

Sense.DEF: too proud and confident – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 傲慢自大的﹐自负的﹐过于自信的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: overweening ambition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂妄的野心

Sense.DEF: someone who is overweight is too heavy and fat
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕体重超常的﹐过重的﹐肥胖的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally was 50 pounds overweight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉超重50磅。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is slightly overweight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他略微超重。

Sense.DEF: something such as a package that is overweight weighs more than it is supposed to weigh
Sense.EXAMPLE: My luggage was overweight by five kilos.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的行李超重五公斤。

Sense.DEF: if someone is overwhelmed by an emotion, they feel it so strongly that they cannot think clearly
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情上〕使〔某人〕感到不能自持﹐使不知所措

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harriet was overwhelmed by a feeling of homesickness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特心中充满思乡之情﹐不能自已。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were overwhelmed with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们激动万分。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Grief overwhelmed me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我悲痛不已。

Sense.DEF: if work or a problem overwhelms someone, it is too much or too difficult to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 〔问题等〕使无法解决﹐使应接不暇﹐压垮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were overwhelmed by the number of applications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 申请多得让我们应接不暇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They would be overwhelmed with paperwork.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的文书工作将使他们疲于应付。

Sense.DEF: to surprise someone very much, so that they do not know how to react

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was completely overwhelmed by his generosity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的慷慨使我惊讶万分。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were overwhelmed by the sheer size of the place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那地方超大的面积让我们非常惊讶。

Sense.DEF: to defeat an army completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: In 1532 the Spaniards finally overwhelmed the armies of Peru.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1532年﹐西班牙人最终打垮了秘鲁军队。

Sense.DEF: if water overwhelms an area of land, it covers it completely and suddenly
having such a great effect on you that you feel confused and do not know how to react
Sense.TRAN: 难以抗拒的﹐令人不知所措的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overwhelming sense of guilt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵不能自制的内疚感
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt an overwhelming desire to hit him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她恨不得揍他一顿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found the city quite overwhelming when she first arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她初来时觉得这座城市令她不知所措。

Sense.DEF: very large or greater, more important etc than any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is overwhelming evidence that smoking damages your health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有难以辩驳的证据表明吸烟有损健康。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An overwhelming majority of the members were against the idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 占压倒性多数的成员反对这项主张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal has been given overwhelming support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一提议得到了压倒性多数的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British Air Force succeeded despite overwhelming odds against them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国空军虽然处境极为不利﹐但还是完成了任务。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Congress voted overwhelmingly in favor of the bill.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 国会以压倒性多数票支持这个议案。

Sense.DEF: to live through the winter, or to make it possible for something to live through the winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: These birds generally overwinter in tropical regions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸟通常在热带地区过冬。

Sense.DEF: to work too much or to make someone work too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve been overworking – why don’t you take a week off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最近在超强度工作——为什么不休息一周呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have they been overworking you again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们又让你超负荷工作了？

Sense.DEF: too much hard work
Sense.TRAN: 过于繁重的工作﹔过分劳累
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heart attack brought on by overwork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因过度劳累导致的心脏病发作

Sense.DEF: made to work too hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: an overworked doctor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳累过度的医生
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re overworked and understaffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们工作繁重﹐人手短缺。

Sense.DEF: a word or phrase that is overworked is used too much and has become less effective
Sense.TRAN: 〔词语〕使用过度的﹐陈词滥调的
Sense.EXAMPLE: overworked metaphors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用滥了的隐喻

Sense.DEF: to replace the information in a computer document with new information from another document
Sense.TRAN: 盖写﹐覆盖〔计算机文件的内容〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to overwrite the file?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要把文件内容覆盖掉吗？

Sense.DEF: very upset, nervous, and worried
Sense.TRAN: 非常烦恼的﹔神经很紧张的﹔十分忧虑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clara was tired and overwrought after all the problems of the last few days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历了过去几天的重重困难之后﹐克拉拉既疲惫又紧张。

Sense.DEF: too eager about something you believe in strongly
Sense.TRAN: 过分热心的﹐过分热情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: overzealous fans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过分热情的仰慕者

Sense.DEF: one of the two tubes in a woman or female animal through which eggs pass to the womb
an animal, a fish, a bird etc that is oviparous produces eggs that develop outside its body
shaped like an egg
when a woman or female animal ovulates, she produces eggs inside her body
an egg, especially one that develops inside the mother’s body
used to express sudden pain
Sense.TRAN: 哎〔用于表示突然的疼痛〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Ow, that hurts!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “哎哟﹐好痛！”

Sense.DEF: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I owe my brother $50.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我欠弟弟50美元。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I still owe you for the taxi.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还欠你出租车费呢。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How much do I owe you often used to show that you want to pay for something?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该付你多少钱？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the money owed to credit card companies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欠信用卡公司的钱

Sense.DEF: to feel that you should do something for someone or give someone something, because they have done something for you or given something to you
Sense.TRAN: 应该做﹔应给予﹔对…负有…的义务
Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked for help from a colleague who owed him a favour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他请了一个同事帮忙﹐那人曾欠他一个情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I owe Shaun a letter; I must write soon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我欠肖恩一封信﹐我得尽快写。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks a lot for being so understanding about all this – I owe you one used to thank someone who has helped you, and to say that you are willing to help them in the future!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常感谢你对这一切这么理解——我欠你一个人情！

GramExa.GLOSS: be in a position in which someone has helped you, so that you should help them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s go and see Joe – he owes me!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去找找乔看——他欠我的情呢！

Sense.DEF: to feel that you should give someone an explanation of why you did something, or say you are sorry
Sense.EXAMPLE: You owe him an apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该向他道歉。

Subsense.DEF: to have something or achieve something because of what someone else has done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He probably owes his life to her prompt action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很可能是因为她行动迅速﹐才救了他一命。

Subsense.DEF: to know that someone’s help has been important to you in achieving something

GramExa.PROPFORM: owe sb a lot/owe sb a great deal
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I owe my parents a lot,’ he admitted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我非常感激我的父母。”他承认道。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He owes a great deal to his publishers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常感激他的出版商。

GramExa.PROPFORM: owe it all to sb/owe everything to sb
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I owe it all to you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切都多亏了你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the debt that we owe to our teachers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对老师们的感激之情

Sense.DEF: to be successful because of the good effect or influence of something or someone
