GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their success owes more to good luck than to careful management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的成功更多靠的是好运气﹐而不是苦心经营。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pearson’s work owed much to the research of his friend, Hugh Kingsmill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮尔逊的工作成果很大程度上应该归功于他朋友休•金斯米尔的研究。

Sense.LEXUNIT: owe it to sb to do sth
Sense.DEF: to feel you should do something for someone, because they have helped you or given you support
Sense.EXAMPLE: You owe it to your supporters not to give up now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了对得起你的支持者﹐你现在不应该放弃。

Sense.LEXUNIT: owe it to yourself to do sth
Sense.DEF: to feel you should try to achieve something because it is what you deserve
Sense.EXAMPLE: You owe it to yourself to take some time off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该让自己休息一下了。

Sense.DEF: to have a duty to obey someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: provinces owing allegiance to the Emperor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须效忠皇帝的各省

Sense.LEXUNIT: think that the world owes you a living
Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to work in order to get things, and expect them to be provided for you – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 认为生来就该过舒服的日子〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: if money is owing, it has not yet been paid to the person who should receive it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to pay the amount owing, plus the interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要付清欠款﹐外加利息。

Sense.DEF: because of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Owing to a lack of funds, the project will not continue next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺乏资金﹐该项目明年将不再继续推进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flight BA213 has been delayed owing to fog.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: BA213次航班因雾延误。

Sense.DEF: a bird with large eyes that hunts at night
a young owl
looking like an owl and seeming serious and clever
Sense.TRAN: 像猫头鹰的﹔看上去严肃而聪明的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was an owlish man, with little round glasses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他戴着小小的圆眼镜﹐一副严肃而睿智的样子。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring your own equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带上你自己的装备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Every dance has its own rhythm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was only a few inches from her own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have problems of our own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也有自己的困难。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to have a place of my own my own home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想有个属于自己的地方。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to add more emphasis
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 完全属于自己的〔用于强调〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One day I want to have a horse of my very own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总有一天我要有一匹完全属于我自己的马。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sth to call your own/which you can call your own
GramExa.GLOSS: something that belongs to you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She just wanted a place to call her own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她只是想要个属于她自己的地方。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone did or made something without the help or involvement of anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 自己的〔强调没有别人的帮助或介入〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She makes a lot of her own clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她许多衣服都自己做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We encourage students to develop their own ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们鼓励学生要有自己的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s your own fault for leaving the window open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是你自己不好﹐没把窗户关上。

Subsense.DEF: alone
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been living on my own for four years now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经独自生活了四年。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to be left on his own.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想被独自留下。

Subsense.DEF: without anyone’s help
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You can’t expect him to do it all on his own.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能指望全部由他一个人来做。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can manage on my own, thanks.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己能行﹐谢谢。

Sense.DEF: if you do something for someone’s own good etc, you do it to help them even though they might not like it or want it
Sense.TRAN: 为你自己的好处/安全/利益等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m only telling you this for your own good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我是为了你好才告诉你这些的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was kept away from the other prisoners for his own safety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把他和其他囚犯隔离开来是为了他的安全。

Sense.LEXUNIT: too nice/clever etc for your own good
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone has too much of a good quality so that it may be a disadvantage
Sense.TRAN: 过分好/聪明等对你没好处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen can be too generous for his own good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬有时慷慨过头﹐反而对自己不好。

Sense.DEF: to do something bad to someone who has harmed you, as a way of punishing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to get her own back on Liz for ruining her party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要报复利兹毁了她的派对。

Sense.DEF: to have strong opinions and intentions that are not influenced by other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hilary’s very much her own woman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉丽是个非常有主见的女人。

Sense.DEF: to change or deal with something in a way that makes it seem to belong to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Great singers can take an old song and make it their own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优秀的歌手能够把一首老歌唱得像是自己的歌一样。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use own only after possessive words such as ‘my’, ‘John’s’, ‘the company’s’ etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: own仅用于my, John’s, the company’s等所有格形式之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Few of them got back to their own country (NOT 不说 the own country).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们中很少有人返回祖国。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘an own car/room/computer etc’. Say a car/room/computer etc of your own
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说 ‘an own car/room/computer etc’. 而要说 a car/room/computer etc of your own
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He soon had enough money to buy a truck of his own.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快他就有钱买了一辆属于自己的卡车。

Sense.DEF: to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过购买﹑接受赠与等而合法地〕拥有〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building is owned by the local council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to get permission from the farmer who owns the land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要得到拥有这块土地的农场主同意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many more people now own their own homes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在更多的人拥有了自己的住房。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the cost of owning a car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养车的开销

GramExa.GLOSS: belonging to the government or a private organization
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a privately owned company
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 私营公司

Sense.LEXUNIT: as if/as though/like you own the place
Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that is too confident and upsets other people
Sense.TRAN: 就像是这里的主人似的〔指表现过于大模大样而令他人不快〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She acts like she owns the place!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表现得就好像这里是她的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: They walked in as if they owned the place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们走进来就跟他们是这里的主人似的。

Sense.DEF: to admit that something is true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I own that I judged her harshly at first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我承认原先我对她的评价很苛刻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I must own to a feeling of anxiety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得承认我有焦虑感。

Exponent.DEF: if you own something, it legally belongs to you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They live in a flat but they don’t own it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在一套公寓里﹐但不是业主。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The land is owned by farmers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片土地归农场主所有。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a privately owned plane
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 私人飞机

Exponent.DEF: to own something – used when focussing on the fact that someone has the use of something, rather than the fact that they legally own it
Exponent.TRAN: 拥有〔侧重于使用权而非拥有权〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How many students have a cell phone?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 多少学生有手机？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish I had a sports car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真希望我有一辆跑车。

Exponent.DEF: to own something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is illegal to possess a firearm in Britain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在英国拥有枪支是非法的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t even possess a smart suit!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我连一身漂亮套装都没有！

Exponent.DEF: if something belongs to you, you own it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ring belonged to my grandmother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这枚戒指是我祖母的。

Exponent.DEF: to own shares in a company
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One man holds a third of the company’s shares.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个人拥有公司三分之一的股份。

Exponent.DEF: to be owned by someone – written on signs, labels etc
Exponent.TRAN: 为某人/某物所有〔书写于指示牌﹑标签上等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This camera is the property of the BBC.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台摄影机为英国广播公司所有。

Sense.DEF: to admit that you have done something wrong, especially something that is not serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, own up. Who broke it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快点﹐说出来﹐是谁把它打碎的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No one owned up to breaking the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人承认打破了窗子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was too frightened to own up to his mistake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓得不敢认错。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He still wouldn’t own up to the fact that he’d lied.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还是不肯承认自己说谎了。

Sense.DEF: own brand goods are specially produced and sold by particular shops and have the name of the shop on them
Sense.TRAN: 自有品牌的〔指产品由店家自产自销并标有店家名称的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tesco’s own brand tomato sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐购的自有品牌番茄酱

Sense.DEF: someone who owns something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I met the owner of the local hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我碰见了当地宾馆的老板。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the club’s new owners
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 俱乐部的新老板

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车﹐很是自豪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dog-owners have been warned to keep their animals under control.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有狗的人已经被提醒看管好自己的狗。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who owns their house

Sense.DEF: houses, apartments etc that are owner-occupied are lived in by the people who own them
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子等〕业主自住的﹐业主自用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of these properties are owner-occupied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些房产大部分都是业主自住的。

Sense.DEF: the fact of owning something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dispute over the ownership of the land
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于土地所有权的纠纷

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company was returned to private ownership in mid-1987.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1987年年中﹐这家公司重归私人所有。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of home ownership is increasing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价在不断上涨。

Sense.DEF: a goal that you accidentally score against your own team without intending to in a game of football, hockey etc
Sense.TRAN: 乌龙球〔足球﹑曲棍球等比赛中误入自己球门的一球〕

Sense.DEF: an action or remark that has the opposite effect from what you intended
Sense.TRAN: 〔不利于自己的〕错事﹐蠢话﹐自打嘴巴
Sense.EXAMPLE: The minister’s admission turned out to be a spectacular own goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果这位部长的供述成了精彩的自打嘴巴。

Sense.DEF: a bull whose sex organs have been removed, often used for working on farms
a large cow or bull
the universities of Oxford and Cambridge
a vehicle pulled by oxen that was used in the past
a yellow flower like a daisy

a charity organization in the UK which helps people in poorer countries, for example by providing training in farming methods or operating educational programmes, and also by providing medicine at times of serious shortage. Oxfam gets some of its money by selling goods in its own shops all over the UK. These shops are especially known for selling used clothes, books etc.
Sense.TRAN: 乐施会〔英国向贫穷国家人民提供帮助的慈善机构〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He always looks as if he buys his clothes from Oxfam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去总像是在乐施会买衣服穿似的。

Sense.DEF: a type of leather shoes that fasten with shoelaces
a type of shirt made of thick cotton
Sense.TRAN: 牛津衬衫〔一种用厚棉布做的衬衫〕

Sense.DEF: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen
Sense.EXAMPLE: iron oxide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氧化铁

Sense.DEF: to combine with oxygen, or make something combine with oxygen, especially in a way that causes rust
used after the title of a degree from Oxford University
Sense.TRAN: 牛津大学〔用于学位名称之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: David Jones BA (Oxon)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维·琼斯﹐文学士(牛津大学)

Sense.DEF: the meat from the tails of cattle, used especially in soup
a mixture of oxygen and acetylene that produces a hot white flame that can cut steel
a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O
Sense.TRAN: 氧〔一种化学元素﹐符号为O〕

Sense.DEF: to add oxygen to something
a bar where you pay to breathe pure oxygen, or oxygen that has a pleasant smell, so that you can relax and have more energy
Sense.TRAN: 氧吧〔付费吸纯氧或香味氧气﹐帮助人放松﹑提神的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a temporary medical condition in which not enough oxygen is going to the muscles in your body, caused by doing physical exercise that takes a lot of strength or effort
Sense.TRAN: 氧债〔剧烈运动时产生的一种肌肉暂时缺氧状态〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that fits over someone’s mouth and nose to provide them with oxygen
a piece of equipment shaped like a tent that is put around people who are very ill in hospital, to provide them with oxygen
Sense.TRAN: 〔医院里给重症患者用的〕氧气帐﹐氧幕

Sense.DEF: a deliberate combination of two words that seem to mean the opposite of each other, such as ‘cruel kindness’
Sense.TRAN: 矛盾修辞法﹐逆喻〔如“残酷的仁慈”〕

Sense.DEF: a word used by law officials or by town criers in the past to get people’s attention
Sense.TRAN: 肃静〔法官或旧时城镇公告员宣布要事时的用语〕

Sense.DEF: a type of shellfish that can be eaten cooked or uncooked, and that produces a jewel called a pearl
used to tell someone that they can achieve whatever they want
Sense.TRAN: 你可以随心所欲﹔你想要什么就能得到什么

Sense.DEF: an area at the bottom of the sea where oysters live

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写=ounce or ounces 盎司

Sense.DEF: a short way of saying Australia
a poisonous blue gas that is a type of oxygen
air near the sea, thought to be fresher and healthier
not containing chemicals that damage the ozone layer
Sense.TRAN: 不含破坏臭氧层的化学物的﹐对臭氧层无害的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an ozone-friendly aerosol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对臭氧层无害的喷雾剂

Sense.DEF: a layer of gases in the sky that prevents harmful radiation from the sun from reaching the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hole in the ozone layer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭氧层空洞
